title: Business Analyst: 24-00464
job_description: ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering and Prioritization: Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and developers, to understand their needs and gather requirements for the new website. Prioritize requirements based on their impact on project duration and business value.Business Process Analysis and Optimization: Analyze existing business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization in the new system. Streamline processes to reduce project duration and increase efficiency.Documentation and Communication: Create detailed documentation, including functional specifications, user stories, use cases, and process flows, to communicate requirements effectively to the development team. Ensure clear and concise communication to minimize misunderstandings and rework.Stakeholder Management and Collaboration: Facilitate communication and collaboration between business users, project managers, and development teams to ensure alignment and understanding of project goals and requirements. Proactively address any conflicts or issues that may arise to minimize delays.Solution Design and Technical Guidance: Work closely with the development team to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that the new website meets the needs of the business and its users. Provide technical guidance and expertise to expedite the development process.Testing and Quality Assurance Strategy: Collaborate with the testing team to define test cases and scenarios, ensuring that the new website meets the specified requirements and functions as expected. Develop a comprehensive testing and quality assurance strategy to minimize defects and rework.Change Management and Training: Support the change management process by assisting with user training, documentation updates, and communication of system changes to stakeholders. Ensure a smooth transition and adoption of the new website to minimize disruptions.Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Identify potential risks and issues that may impact the project's duration and success. Work with the project team to develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize delays and ensure timely delivery.Continuous Improvement and Agile Practices: Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in web development and customer portal solutions. Implement agile practices and methodologies to increase project efficiency and adaptability.Mentoring and Support: Provide guidance and support to junior business analysts and other team members, sharing your expertise and knowledge to help them grow their skills. Foster a collaborative and supportive environment to maximize productivity and minimize project duration.QUALIFICATIONS Education / Experience / Background Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration.Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in web development or software implementation projects. Knowledge / Skills / Abilities Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.Solid understanding of software development methodologies, including Agile practices.Experience with Drupal or similar content management systems is highly desirableGood experience in using industry-standard design and work management tools such as Jira, Google Docs, Lucid Chart, etc...Knowledge of utility industry processes and customer portal solutions is a plus.Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to guide and support junior team members.Experience in working with vendors (onshore and/or offshore)
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

job_description: Title: Business Analyst with P&C insurance experience.Location: Edison, NJDuration: Long termRate: MarketJob SummaryResponsible to provide production operational support for existing applications. This includes working with our business partners and internal IT stakeholders to triage and manage incoming enhancement requests and defects for applications live in production. This role may also provide subject matter expertise on projects for the applications they support as needed. This role will include significant troubleshooting, issue resolution, working with business leaders to solicit, analyze, and document new business needs, and working with internal IT stakeholders to develop solutions to reported defects and issues.A candidate for this position must be a self-starter and able to work in a varied, fast-paced environment as part of a service delivery function for the client.Essential Job Functions Responsible for providing operational support, including triaging incoming requests and incidents. Gathers and analyzes information, troubleshoots and support application issues for a specific business group or application. Responsible for identifying, evaluating, and recommending potential solution options and managing the resolution through to production deployment. Responsible for eliciting, analyzing, and documenting business requirements for small enhancement requests. Responsible to drive small non-project enhancements through the SDLC to production deployment. Responsible for analyzing the feasibility and cost benefit of potential solution options. Responsible for managing communications between IT and business for assigned work. Assists in formulating and designing system scope and objective based on user needs and thorough understanding of business processes. Works with internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve business results. Provides subject matter expertise concerning business implications of application development projects. Participates in the full software development life cycle (SDLC). Collects and defines requirements Translates into functional design documents Participates in technical design Participates in test planning and may coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Supports execution of both QA and UAT phases Participates in user documentation processes Assists with training users on new or enhanced applications Supports Go Live activities including production smoke testing and post Go Live activities Creates application support documentation including Quick Reference Guides and Standard Operating Procedures Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs special duties and other projects as may be assigned Establishes and builds strong working relations and partnerships with various levels of IT team members, stakeholders, Business Units and Senior Management.Qualifications Broad experience with ServiceNow or other ticketing system required. Excellent written and oral communications. Excellent problem solving, research, and analytical skills. Proven ability to determine the root cause of problems and issues and provide solutions. Strong customer service orientation (responsive, consultative, collaborative and accurate). Self-starter with proven ability to take the initiative to accomplish goals. Proven ability to work with minimal oversight and direction. Superior attention to detail. Ability to juggle multiple, competing, frequently changing time-sensitive deadlines and priorities. At least 5 years Business Analysis Experience, with at least 1-2 years working in Operational Support. P&C Insurance knowledge/certifications preferred. Experience with Surety Bonds a big plus. Project management skills preferred. Demonstrated knowledge of SDLC. Experience with UML and BPMN. Experience with UI/design specs/wireframes. Any experience with Invision would be a plus and or utilizing a Design Think approach to prototyping. Ability to lead and manage non-project enhancements. Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices and deliverables associated with eliciting and clearly defining and documenting required business functionality as well as non-functional requirements Knowledge of formal methodologies for planning and executing application development, enhancement, or support Strong interpersonal relationship building skills: able to work with a variety of people and groups in a constructive and collaborative manner. Strategic thinking; Applies organizational acumen to identify and maintain focus on key success factors for the organization. Bachelor's Degree preferred (preferably in MIS, IT, or Business)

Able to be an effective matrix leader of internal IT and strategic external partner resources, ensuring that IT functions are successful in delivery of services to CPD. Demonstrated ability to elicit, interpret and document business and functional requirements, particularly in scientific areas.      Demonstrated ability to communicate complex domain problems clearly.      Experience partnering with IT delivery teams to translate business requirements into IT solutions that provide positive business outcomes. Experience leading the planning implementation of digital capabilities for scientific business partners.      Demonstrated communication and influencing skills that build trust and collaboration with partner organizations.      Ability to drive engagement with Business stakeholders.       PAY RATE: 52.60/HR

title: Technology Strategy and Execution - Business Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionJ.P. Morgan's focus on being the world's most successful financial services institution starts with Technology - the driving force that gives us our leading edge. Ongoing $billion investment in the firm's technological future means that by joining J.P. Morgan, you'll have a front-row seat to product innovation, and work on complex solutions to the most difficult financial problems.The teamSecurities Processing Technology provides core trade processing stack for the Equities, Fixed Income, Prime Brokerage and Custody business lines.This is an opportunity to join an award winning technology team delivering a very high profile program across the front to back technology stack for the Custody business.The RoleTechnology Strategy and Execution - Business AnalystDelivering high-quality and timely solutions on the front to back platform requires strong business analysis, product knowledge, technical and problem solving skills. The ideal candidate will have solid experience in financial markets, subject matter expertise in securities processing and/or custody, and a proven track record in working on complex technology projects.This specific role will be within an aggressive delivery team tasked with building an in-house Securities Processing technology platform globally, encompassing a Trade Booking layer, Settlement Engine capable of supporting all global markets, an Asset/Stock Record, an Asset Servicing solution & a strategic Data-Warehouse to support downstream requirements for reporting and analytics.The successful candidate will work within the Securities Processing E2E team as a hands-on business analyst who will leverage their knowledge to drive the strategic securities processing strategy for the custody business. They will have strong analysis skills and be able to drive large-scale technical solutions across the full application stack.The ability to bridge the gap between business and technology is paramount in this role, to drive the business forward in their objectives.Key ResponsibilitiesInitial responsibility will be as a business analyst/technology lead for the delivery of the integrated trade booking, settlement, and Asset Record flow for International Custody Project management & oversight of the deliverables & resources distributed across many different technology teams across the front to back application stack.Defines the cross-application functional architecture / system flow to meet the business needs and partners with multiple Product, Operations & Technology leads globally to deliver an E2E solutionUnderstands business requirements, performs detailed analysis, and produces associated functional specifications across multiple functions and applications.Conducts test driven analysis to investigate differences between new vs existing system processingAssesses ability to meet process SLAs across AD teamsDefines and tracks the end-to-end build, testing, and implementation timeline across all applicationsParticipation in large-scale “highly-visible” SIT/UAT testing cycles managing technology and business stakeholders Trains relevant teams prior to go-live of new business processes/products, functionality or applications Produces implementation approach, timelines, and go-live strategy. Go-live support, investigation of issues. Provide regular updates to senior management in Technology, Operations, or Custody Product organizations QualificationsEssential skillsStrong background of understanding end to end trade processing lifecycle (including: instruction capture, settlements, books and records, legal entity flows, accounting and regulatory requirements. Ability to clearly define and articulate business requirements. Excellent written, verbal and presentation communication skills Confidence in communicating internally at all levels; candidate will be dealing with the Custody Product, Operations and Technology teams on a daily basis who are both business and technically sophisticated Ability to coherently construct and present business requirements and solutions based on input from various sources Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills Good judgement, risk assessment, and escalation skillsStrong project management skills; experience of full project life-cycle, including breaking requirements down into technical deliverables, estimating the work required, and building detailed project plans Proactive, self-motivated and flexible with a positive attitude Excellent teamwork Strong time management; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high-level standard Experience in working with technology development teams during build and implementation phases Experience in writing UAT Test Plans and/or Test Scripts, together with managing the user testing phase of projects Desirable skillsExperience and/or willing to be involved in the technical detail of projects and systems both in terms of analysis, modelling and problem solvingExperience in Custody productsEducationDegree level education or equivalent 10+ years experience within similar industry area About J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment BankJ.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world. Further information about J.P. Morgan is available at http://www.jpmorgan.com/ .J.P. Morgan offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package.About UsJPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/VeteransAbout The TeamOur Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You'll develop solutions that help the bank provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk, and extend liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

You will work closely with project teams, product owners, and client stakeholders to analyze, finalize requirement, document related workflows and required business requirement documents/ functional specification documents. In addition, you are required to resolve conflicts and remove barriers, ensuring deliverables are on-time and meet all relevant quality standards.Candidate must have: Strong experience working with Trade Surveillance, Compliance, Regulatory Reporting  Understanding of the trade lifecycle for major financial asset classes across Debt, Equities, ETF and other securities  Able to understand regulatory requirements/changes, translating those requirements into system requirements, and collaborating with the internal development team to successfully deliver solution  Able to perform data mapping to identify data gaps and work with users/other IT teams to source the additional information required  Have experience working on Software Applications and have Inclination on building understanding of Technologies/how system functions  Good SQL is desirable, Understanding of XMLs will be useful  Comfortable presenting to and negotiating requirement details with users  Excellent problem solving and analytical skills  Well versed working with PPTs, Visio tools  Advise team/users on regulatory updates Responsibilities Work closely with the Compliance Stakeholders to ensure functional / Technical requirements are clearly specified  Work closely with the IT project development team to ensure that Technical specifications reflect the required functionality  Develop the project plans and governance around the development, testing and implementation  Oversee and assist with Quality Assurance testing  Plan, oversee and assist with User Acceptance testing for the new system  Document and manage resolution of all issues and new requests relating to the solution Skill Requirement Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in technical/quantitative field. 3-5 years’ experience in related fields.  Excellent business analysis and organization skills. Ability to drive complex business requirements to conclusion, managing key stakeholders  Strong analytic, quantitative, and data analysis skills  Knowledge of financial products  Excellent problem solver, able to synthesize and analyze information to develop practical solutions  Team player and self-starter  Ability to perform well under pressure and deliver to tight deadlines.  Excellent communication skills to drive system development and interface with IT developers, IT Management and other Business/Support personnel Primary Location Full Time Salary Range of $120,000-$160,000.The salary offered will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and qualifications. In addition to salary, Jefferies offers, for eligible employees, an annual discretionary incentive and retention bonus, competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Jefferies also offers paid time off packages that include planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays and paid parental leave.About UsJefferies Financial Group Inc. (‘‘Jefferies,’’ ‘‘we,’’ ‘‘us’’ or ‘‘our’’) is a U.S.-headquartered global full service, integrated investment banking and securities firm. Our largest subsidiary, Jefferies LLC, a U.S. broker-dealer, was founded in the U.S. in 1962 and our first international operating subsidiary, Jefferies International Limited, a U.K. broker-dealer, was established in the U.K. in 1986. Our strategy focuses on continuing to build out our investment banking effort, enhancing our capital markets businesses and further developing our Leucadia Asset Management alternative asset management platform. title: Technology Strategy and Execution - Business Analyst
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  J.P. Morgan's focus on being the world's most successful financial services institution starts with Technology - the driving force that gives us our leading edge. Ongoing $billion investment in the firm's technological future means that by joining J.P. Morgan, you'll have a front-row seat to product innovation, and work on complex solutions to the most difficult financial problems.The teamSecurities Processing Technology provides core trade processing stack for the Equities, Fixed Income, Prime Brokerage and Custody business lines.This is an opportunity to join an award winning technology team delivering a very high profile program across the front to back technology stack for the Custody business.The RoleTechnology Strategy and Execution - Business AnalystDelivering high-quality and timely solutions on the front to back platform requires strong business analysis, product knowledge, technical and problem solving skills. The ideal candidate will have solid experience in financial markets, subject matter expertise in securities processing and/or custody, and a proven track record in working on complex technology projects.This specific role will be within an aggressive delivery team tasked with building an in-house Securities Processing technology platform globally, encompassing a Trade Booking layer, Settlement Engine capable of supporting all global markets, an Asset/Stock Record, an Asset Servicing solution & a strategic Data-Warehouse to support downstream requirements for reporting and analytics.The successful candidate will work within the Securities Processing E2E team as a hands-on business analyst who will leverage their knowledge to drive the strategic securities processing strategy for the custody business. They will have strong analysis skills and be able to drive large-scale technical solutions across the full application stack.The ability to bridge the gap between business and technology is paramount in this role, to drive the business forward in their objectives.Key ResponsibilitiesInitial responsibility will be as a business analyst/technology lead for the delivery of the integrated trade booking, settlement, and Asset Record flow for International Custody Project management & oversight of the deliverables & resources distributed across many different technology teams across the front to back application stack.Defines the cross-application functional architecture / system flow to meet the business needs and partners with multiple Product, Operations & Technology leads globally to deliver an E2E solutionUnderstands business requirements, performs detailed analysis, and produces associated functional specifications across multiple functions and applications.Conducts test driven analysis to investigate differences between new vs existing system processingAssesses ability to meet process SLAs across AD teamsDefines and tracks the end-to-end build, testing, and implementation timeline across all applicationsParticipation in large-scale “highly-visible” SIT/UAT testing cycles managing technology and business stakeholders Trains relevant teams prior to go-live of new business processes/products, functionality or applications Produces implementation approach, timelines, and go-live strategy. Go-live support, investigation of issues. Provide regular updates to senior management in Technology, Operations, or Custody Product organizations QualificationsEssential skillsStrong background of understanding end to end trade processing lifecycle (including: instruction capture, settlements, books and records, legal entity flows, accounting and regulatory requirements. Ability to clearly define and articulate business requirements. Excellent written, verbal and presentation communication skills Confidence in communicating internally at all levels; candidate will be dealing with the Custody Product, Operations and Technology teams on a daily basis who are both business and technically sophisticated Ability to coherently construct and present business requirements and solutions based on input from various sources Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills Good judgement, risk assessment, and escalation skillsStrong project management skills; experience of full project life-cycle, including breaking requirements down into technical deliverables, estimating the work required, and building detailed project plans Proactive, self-motivated and flexible with a positive attitude Excellent teamwork Strong time management; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high-level standard Experience in working with technology development teams during build and implementation phases Experience in writing UAT Test Plans and/or Test Scripts, together with managing the user testing phase of projects Desirable skillsExperience and/or willing to be involved in the technical detail of projects and systems both in terms of analysis, modelling and problem solvingExperience in Custody productsEducationDegree level education or equivalent 10+ years experience within similar industry area About J.P. title: Sr. Analyst
job_description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!Job detailsThis Jobot Job is hosted by Gaelyn GulloAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.Salary $75,000 - $95,000 per yearA Bit About UsA well-known and established company within the Financial Services industry with a nation-wide presence.Why join us?A well-known and established company within the Financial Services industry, who offers excellent benefits including Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage with multiple health plan options Health Savings Account (HSA) with company-sponsored contributions Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) traditional and dependent care Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits 401(k) Plan competitive discretionary company matching and profit-sharing contributions Tuition reimbursement ($5,250 max per year) Paid Vacation, Sick Time, Holidays, Volunteer Time OffPaid Leave Parental Bonding, Jury Duty, Military, Disability, etc.Job DetailsJob DetailsWe are currently seeking a dynamic and highly-driven Senior Analyst to join our team in the Finance industry. This role will provide the successful candidate with an excellent opportunity to work in a fast-paced, highly competitive environment where they will play a critical role in driving our business forward. The Senior Analyst will be responsible for providing analytical support to our team, ensuring the accuracy of financial data, and contributing to strategic decision-making processes. This is a permanent position that offers a challenging and rewarding work environment, as well as the opportunity for professional growth and development.Responsibilities Provide financial analysis and reporting support to the team, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and timely delivery of information. Handle Corporate Actions and liaise with Broker/Dealer to ensure smooth operations. Utilize FIS Phase 3, DTC PBS/PST, BETA, and other relevant systems to manage and analyze financial data. Assist in strategic decision-making processes by providing insightful and actionable financial analysis. Collaborate with other team members to ensure the accuracy of financial data and reports. Participate in the development of financial strategies and plans to drive business growth. Monitor and analyze financial performance against budget and forecast. Identify and communicate potential risks and opportunities to the management team.Qualifications A minimum of 5 years of experience within the financial services industry. Experience working with Broker/Dealer and handling Corporate Actions. An associate degree or bachelor's degree in accounting, business, economics, or finance. Experience with FIS Phase 3, DTC PBS/PST, BETA, or equivalent systems. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in work. Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Strong knowledge of financial analysis techniques and methodologies. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel. Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information in a professional manner. A minimum of 2+ years of relevant and recent experience is required for this position.Interested in hearing more? title: Sr. Analyst, Managed Markets & Specialty
job_description: Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Senior Analyst, Managed Markets & Specialty, in the Enterprise Contract Management Contract Operations located in Raritan, NJ!Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (JJHCS) provides contracting, supply chain, business services, and strategic solutions to customers and commercial intermediaries of U.S.-based Johnson & Johnson companies, including hospital systems, health plans, distributors, wholesalers, purchasing organizations, government payer programs, and government healthcare institutions in the U.S. JJHCS also engages with customers to provide streamlined supply chain services for our products that seamlessly integrate with customer operations, address shared evolving market challenges to value-based care, and develop innovative solutions that improve patient care and access.Enterprise Contract Management (ECM) is an organization under JJHCS which serves as the Center of Excellence that delivers best in class solutions for Commercial Healthcare, Government & Regulatory, Systems, Processes and Training, and Risk Mitigation & Governance.The Contract Operations team is accountable for contract management activities associated with J&J's commercial customers. Its mission is to drive consistent and compliant contract management practices in support of J&J business strategies and the company's customers.The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the contracting needs for Pharmacy Benefit Managers (PBM), Managed Care Organizations (MCO) and Long Term Care (LTC) GPOs and pharmacies administered by the Managed Markets & Specialty Team. This role will have sizable interaction with Operating Companies and field personnel.Key ResponsibilitiesManage and maintain contracts, including loading of contract pricing information, as well as analysis and processing of rebate payments to organizations referenced above.Validate payments and provide direction to other department members.Demonstrate a customer service mentality and ability to learn, as well as demonstrate effective communication skills with an ability to make the complex simple.Regularly communicate in all directions to keep associates, peers and management advised of payment status, deadlines and process improvements.Assume leadership roles on teams and projects within and across departments focused on improving the contract management process that streamline and improve current procedures.Support key departmental projects by utilizing business knowledge, systems, good decision-making skills and project management skills.Partner with cross-functional teams, including Operating Companies and field personnel, and provide a high level of customer service.Transfer knowledge within the department, across departments and to Operating Companies, while understanding the impact of actions on processes across multiple business partners.Apply strong analytical skills to discuss contracting data and information with a broad range of associates in J&J and with outside organizations.Understand the entire contracting continuum.Troubleshoot problems of various complexities with limited supervision and demonstrate high levels of analytical and organizational skills, with the ability to understand systems and processes.Run and analyze reports and perform SOX analysis, as well as build and maintain Standard Operating Procedures as needed.Education:Minimum Bachelor's Degree required or advanced degree preferredExperience and Skills:RequiredMinimum four (4) years of relevant work experienceProven ability to handle conflicting priorities and meet deliverables and deadlinesExperience with data analytics, including analysis, interpretation, and presenting to leadershipProven ability to build and support strong, positive relationships with internal and external partnersMicrosoft Excel proficiency, including pivot tables and VLOOKUPPreferred:Contract development and/or contracting system experienceUnderstanding of all phases of the contract continuum and business processesWorking experience in business analytics, finance analytics, legal analytics, or contract analyticsFinancial and audit controls knowledgeProject management experience/skillsExperience in training and mentoring others to develop new skillsHealthcare industry experienceExperience with Model-N or Revitas, Sarbanes -Oxley (SOX), or Database ManagementOther:Requires up to 5% domestic travelThe salary for this role is anticipated to be between $74,000 and $110,000Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company's consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).This position is eligible to participate in the Company's long-term incentive program.Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:Vacation - up to 120 hours per calendar yearSick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington - up to 56 hours per calendar yearHoliday pay, including Floating Holidays - up to 13 days per calendar yearWork, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar yearJohnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com .

title: Proposal Analyst
job_description: About UsSolar Landscape is a groundbreaking renewable energy company on a mission to make solar power affordable and accessible to all.Solar Landscape partners with commercial real estate companies to develop, install and operate large rooftop solar installations. Households in the surrounding communities can subscribe to receive solar power at a guaranteed discount. This innovative model – community solar – is providing solar power to the two-thirds of Americans that cannot otherwise access it.Solar Landscape is growing fast. Doubling in size year after year, we are looking for the best and brightest to drive our next phase of growth. We’re made up of thought leaders, thinkers, dreamers, doers. We are insightful, driven, rebellious, fun, and we are better together. Our diverse and unique backgrounds are all given a voice and seat at the table to help make real change for the communities we serve.For more about Solar Landscape, visit www.solarlandscape.com.About The RoleThe Proposal Analyst will be responsible for managing analysis and workflow activities related to applying for community solar projects. Reporting to the Director of Proposals, they will directly support the team’s efforts to organize data and create applications for market specific community solar programs. Additionally, the Proposal Analyst will be responsible for finding, analyzing, and responding to requests for proposals (RFPs) for solar projects.The principal objective of the Proposal Analyst position is to assist in the application process for each project and ensure compliance with the requirements of the community solar program. It is essential for this role to liaise with internal teams (including Engineering, Operations, Policy, Marketing, and Executive) to manage applications for accuracy and completeness. Additionally, the Analyst will provide expertise and assistance for community solar project development, as well as for behind-the-meter EPC and PPA projects. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a background in solar energy, exceptional organizational abilities to manage multiple tasks, and a strategic business development mindset to contribute to the team's overall success.ResponsibilitiesAnalyze all aspects of community solar deals and ensure compliance with market specific requirementsManage data entry for program specific content and produce proposal documents (PowerPoint, Excel, Word formats) from start to finish. Maintain accurate data regarding Community Solar leases, EPC and PPA offers in the CRM systemBe comfortable navigating the nuances of various community solar programs and work with the Technology team to incorporate compliance requirements into CRM system. Keep track of applications in the CRM system. Evaluate and implement third party tools and services for improving workflow and velocityProject manage applications through the lifecycle and keep current with the CRM systemSupport the Business Development team by performing tasks relating to the application requirements. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Engineering or Environmental Sciences preferred3+ years of total work experience including at least 1 year of experience working on complex spreadsheets1+ years of experience in an analyst capacity within the solar energy industryWorking knowledge of energy policy, ESG topics and familiarity with solar industryExperience with solar energy design materials including drawing sets and energy production modelsBasic understanding of commercial PV construction methods (rooftop, ground-mount, carport), behind-the-meter and utility interconnections, Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs), and EPC ContractsProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; familiarity with MS Dynamics software is a plusExcellent organizational and communication skills with a keen attention to detail; self-motivated and proactiveLeadership ability and comfortable driving high-visibility projectsAuthorized to work in the United States on a full-time basisBenefits and PerksSolar Landscape’s company culture is second to none.Our 175+ employees combine our mission, grit and drive with a rebel’s attitude that is changing the industry: Located in the heart of historic Asbury Park, our state-of-the-art office space offers flexible workstations encouraging collaboration and movement Hybrid and remote work schedules ensuring a healthy work/life balance Employees come together to eat every day! Like in a home, our gourmet kitchen is the heart of the office. Solar Landscape has a full-time in-house chef cooking daily farm-to-table meals using locally sourced organic food Also included in employees is our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, & vision insurance, flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; We provide healthy snacks, coffee, volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!

title: Finance Project- Accounting/Business Analysis Vice President
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Seize the opportunity to join the Strategic Accounting Infrastructure and Control (SAIC) Team that is responsible for the analysis and execution of financial accounting architecture changes, supporting Financial Control, Asset Class Control, and Product Control.As a Vice President on the Strategic Finance Program Management team within the SAIC team, you will partner with various stakeholder across multiple regions to deliver project objectives throughout multiple phases including requirements documentation, functional analysis, and testing. You will have opportunities to leverage your expertise to help organize and manage all finance deliverables. You will facilitate meaningful discussions with partners from finance, tech, ops to solve complex business issues and build a strategic accounting infrastructure for securities processing.The projects range from production defect remediations and industry/line of business (LOB) initiatives to large-scale, multi-year strategic initiatives replacing entire product systems. We are looking for a Vice President to support our Fixed Income Transformation program, initially focused on the Latin America (LATAM) region.Job ResponsibilitiesCreate and maintain key project artifacts including project plans, RAID logs, and scorecardsMonitor the daily progress of activities, manage issues and risks, and escalate deviations from planCreate and present project status reports to key stakeholders and senior managementPartner with Technology to ensure project priorities and status reporting are aligned with FinanceProactively establish and manage meeting materials including agendas, meeting minutes, and key takeawaysPartner with Financial Controllers, Asset Class Controllers and Product Controllers to agree on project objectives, requirements, and prioritiesSupport the problem-solving and decision-making processes within SAIC by providing data analysis, visualizing process flows, documenting operating procedures, and managing communication plansRequired Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills7+ years finance or accounting project management experience Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be flexible and adapt to the changing needs of stakeholders while maintaining a positive and professional attitudeDetail oriented with the ability to take ownership, prioritize, and manage multiple deliverablesStrong communication (oral and written) and presentation skillsExceptional interpersonal and relationship building skills with the ability to collaborate across different groups and regionsExperience with project or program management best practices, including organizational skills and time managementDigital proficiency, able to quickly learn systems and effectively use tools in an agile environment. Includes solid working knowledge of MS Excel (pivot tables) and PowerPoint.Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsSecurities’/ fixed income experience preferredKnowledge of key Finance systems and processes, including MIS and GLController experienceNote: This position is not eligible for sponsorship

title: Financial Analyst - Corporate Development & Strategic Partnerships Group
job_description: Diamond Communications LLC (“Diamond”) is seeking a Financial Analyst at its Springfield, NJ headquarters to join the Corporate Development and Strategic Partnerships Group. Diamond is a leading private infrastructure telecommunications investment and operating company that has made over $2 billion of investments and acquisitions over the past five years. The successful candidate will (i) work on strategic acquisitions and integration of new businesses, (ii) be involved in many of the company’s key new business initiatives and (iii) interact regularly with the entire senior management team and key marketing, sales and operations personnel. The position offers high learning and personal growth potential through frequent exposure to highly experienced decision makers (including legal, finance and operational), numerous project and personnel management opportunities and direct interface with key company clients.Diamond Communications:Diamond is one of the largest privately-owned tower companies in the U.S. Diamond owns and/or manages more than 4,000 tenanted sites. In addition, through Diamond’s Site Management business, we actively manage and market over 400,000 locations on behalf of third parties for wireless communications purposes. Diamond is management controlled with access to significant capital for acquisitions, providing a unique opportunity to join a market leading operating company, while also being part of an active private equity investment business within the business. Diamond is headquartered in the United States, with offices in 15 states and Puerto Rico.Job Description:The Financial Analyst will be a key member of the Corporate Development and Strategic Partnerships Group at Diamond. This position is well suited for recent college graduates looking for an exciting role which combines finance, strategy and operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong desire to learn and participate in Diamond’s training program. The role will involve direct interaction with executive level management, providing financial analysis/modeling, research, presentation development and project management support related to growing the value of our existing assets and identifying opportunities for new businesses and assets to acquire/build across the country. The role will include: Developing financial models for acquisitions and strategic partnerships, including leveraged buyout models, accretion/dilution analysis and operating models for new business segments Maintain Diamond financial projection model, which is utilized by senior management and the board of directors for long-term budgeting Support capital markets activities for debt and equity financings Analyzing and supporting key strategic growth initiatives Manage integration of new acquisitions, in coordination with operations, finance and legal teams Reporting progress of various business segments for senior management Writing presentations for prospective and existing site management clients Writing and coordinating responses to Requests for Proposals that present growth opportunities for the company General market research and analysis of new and existing assetRequirementsDesired Skills:Diamond is seeking a well-rounded individual that can manage numerous tasks simultaneously and provide thoughtful, well-organized analyses: Analytical role; finance and/or accounting education/experience desired Financial modeling experience related to acquisitions and capital expenditure decisions Team player comfortable working in a collaborative environment Strong communication and writing skills Willingness/desire to work on multiple projects simultaneously Strong familiarity with Microsoft OfficePowerPointExcelWord Detail oriented Strong organizational skillsBenefits:Competitive salary, excellent benefits, and an exciting opportunity with a fast growing company.Location:Diamond is located in Springfield, NJ. Springfield is approximately 17 miles west of New York City. The office is conveniently located close to I-78 and NJ-24 and the Millburn NJ Transit station. There are nearby direct trains to both New York’s Penn Station and Hoboken Terminal.Please forward a resume to Diamond Communications at Info@diamondcomm.com, use subject heading “Financial Analyst”.

title: Senior Analyst, Sales Performance

title: Analyst - Digital Product
company: AGM Tech Solutions - A Woman and Latina-owned IT Staffing Firm-an Inc5000 company
job_description: AGM Tech Solutions, on behalf of the Client is hiring a  Remote  Job Title - Analyst - Digital Product   Summary Description & Essential Job Functions:  This hands-on contributor will partner with key teams, stakeholders, and other Product Managers to deliver business-critical projects for Digital Products (brand website and mobile app) for Client brands. This role will provide leadership and support throughout the product development lifecycle: establish business & functional requirements, test and manage the lifecycle of UAT issues; prioritize, organize, and align defect fixes, ensuring all business requirements are accurately captured, traceable, tested and deployed. The ideal candidate will have experience in both web site and mobile app consumer-facing digital channels, with a focus on e-commerce or self-service experiences; identifying & understanding customer problems and collaborating with stakeholders and partners on how to solve those problems to elevate the customer experience, reduce friction, and drive engagement and satisfaction.  Responsibilities    Partner with other product managers, UX, technology, delivery & operations teams, and key stakeholders to execute on the product lifecycle from ideation through launch for various best-in-class digital experiences, new feature rollouts, as well as enterprise initiatives.     Collaborate with teams to define business and functional requirements including acceptance criteria, as well as guest experience; contribute to metrics & competitive analysis for related Product objectives & hypotheses.     Serve as the primary customer advocate during user acceptance testing and quality assurance activities to verify all enhancements deliver on specified business requirements.    Requirements:  Experience/Certificates/Education   2+ years of product management experience, ideally in transactional websites and/or mobile apps with solid knowledge of shopping/retail functionality and API connectivity  2+ years of experience in working with functional or technical teams  2+ years of experience with software testing and Quality Assurance  1+ years of experience with third party integrations and management of technology vendors  Experience working in Agile methodologies, principles, and procedures  Must be able to speak and write in English fluently   Behavioral Competencies   Must be results-driven, proactive, and focused on aligning action to ensure delivery  Possesses the ability to view experiences from a customer perspective and make recommendations/callouts for optimization  Keen prioritization/adaptation skills  Strong presentation and communication skills (verbal and written)    Functional Competencies   Strong analytical skills, the ability to understand complex workflows, and investigate possible issues  Experience in testing and supporting responsive web applications with a mobile-first mindset  Extremely detail-oriented, possessing the ability to think outside of the box  Experience in JIRA and related product management tools  General familiarity with APIs  Ability to work with remote and third-party teams    Additional Perks: - Excellent Market Rate/Salary - Positive Work-Life Balance - Competitive Benefit Packages Including Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance.   Company Overview: • AGM Tech Solutions is a Women-Minority owned Firm relationship-based IT Consulting firm dedicated to Serving our Clients Nationwide. Our dedicated team strives to exceed the expectations of our clients and employees by building long term relationships based on Integrity, Trust, Hard Work, Commitment and our service experience. We offer a consultative approach to each and every client by taking the time to listen to their needs and help them get where they want to go by becoming an extension of their organization. We provide Information Technology staffing: High caliber talent for temporary support and project Deliverables. Direct IT placement services: Contract-to-Hire Direct Hire professionals for longer-term needs.

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Job Description: Hybrid Role-minimum 50% onsite requiredPurpose And Scope Of PositionThis job is part of an organization established to manage our rapidly evolving Cell Therapy business. The Business System Analyst Operational Support will work alongside the Global Business Process Owner (BPO) for Cell Therapy Warehouse & Inventory Management, to support cross-site material transfers management, facilitate & drive troubleshooting/issue resolution, drive continuous improvement initiatives, and decision-making for overall material cross-site transfers.Responsibilities Support in cross-site/cross functional project teams to ensure cross-site material transfers are executed smoothly (includes both process & systematic transactions). Serve as primary point of contact for process & systematic troubleshooting/root cause analysis when issues arise, during cross-site material transfer process. Identify, maintain, and manage master data needs/gaps to ensure a smooth cross-site material transfer process. Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) for cross-site material transfer operational processes, providing guidance and support as needed. Facilitate and drive process improvement efforts, including process mapping and optimization. Support monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing the end-to-end process, anticipating and resolving any issues that may arise. Collaborate with other teams, including IT and PMO, to ensure smooth execution of cross-site material transfers, both systematically and procedurally. Review and revise documentation content, such as changes and standard operating procedures (SOPs), to ensure accuracy and compliance. Support the Director in achieving productivity and financial goals through effective cross-functional teamwork. Provide support to stakeholders and team members based in different regions and time zones. Maintain a hybrid work arrangement, spending 50% of time on-site and 50% in a virtual setting.Qualifications Ability to work with a range of technically and culturally diverse people to attain desired results Ability to effectively communicate to a diverse audience at multiple levels Strong critical thinking to analyze complex situations and discern critical issues Knowledge in computer system management or validation experience Strong experience working with external parties and leading cross-functional teams. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Strong motivation & self-drive to achieve issue resolution, in a collaborative manner Strategic thinking ability to translate strategy into actionable plans. Strong prioritization skills and the ability to provide clear direction in a dynamic environment. Proven track record of leading large process improvement projects and complex technology projects. Comfortable working in fluid situations with competing project priorities. BA or BS degree; preferably in IT Systems or related field, and/or equivalent experience desired 8-10 years of business system analysis experience. 5-8 years of project management experience. 8-10 years of process management experience. 8-10 years of extensive stakeholder management and organizational change management experience. Proficiency in SAP and experience troubleshooting system issues. Heightened situational awareness and emotional intelligence.Additional Job RequirementsNone

title: Reinsurance Analyst
job_description: Our client is seeking a Reinsurance Analyst to join their team in Jersey City, NJ. This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the global Reinsurance business, ensuring an effective and efficient function. The successful candidate will be part of a leading, diversified specialty insurance and reinsurance company that values respect, honesty, trust and professionalism.What you'll do:As a Reinsurance Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting the global Reinsurance business. You will be responsible for contributing to the preparation and implementation of the reinsurance strategy, ensuring positive results for the business. Your role will involve understanding and explaining changes in the reinsurance program and its impact on financial plans. You will also assist in creating effective planning mechanisms to ensure delivery of the business plan. Additionally, you will manage interactions with reinsurers during various activities such as presentations, audits and file reviews.Support the preparation, implementation and delivery of Outwards Reinsurance strategyResponsible for the outwards reinsurance business financial planning processUnderstand, articulate and explain changes in the outwards reinsurance program and effects on plan financialsAssist in creating effective planning, control, and support mechanisms to ensure delivery of the business planContribute to procedures and controls for the collection, review, consolidation and analysis of reinsurance informationManage reinsurer interaction with underwriter teams during presentations, audits, file reviews etc.What you bring:The ideal candidate for the Reinsurance Analyst position brings a wealth of experience in reinsurance operations, accounting, contract wording and financial planning. They possess extensive knowledge of reinsurance accounting practices. Their strong data management skills are complemented by their proficiency in using Microsoft Excel for advanced data interrogation.Minimum of 5 years experience in reinsurance operations, accounting, contract wording and financial planningExtensive knowledge and understanding of Reinsurance accounting practicesStrong data management skills including advanced data interrogation using Microsoft ExcelExcellent interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to manage conflicting priorities to achieve deadlinesStrong customer orientation skillsWhat sets this company apart:This company is known for its thoughtful and creative approach towards finding the best outcomes for its clients and business partners through carefully tailored solutions.

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Job Title: Business Systems AnalystLocation: Summit, NJ, 07901 (Hybrid-50% onsite)Duration: 12 monthsPurpose And Scope Of PositionThis job is part of an organization established to manage our rapidly evolving Cell Therapy business. The Business System Analyst Operational Support will work alongside the Global Business Process Owner (BPO) for Cell Therapy Warehouse & Inventory Management, to support cross-site material transfers management, facilitate & drive troubleshooting/issue resolution, drive continuous improvement initiatives, and decision-making for overall material cross-site transfers.Responsibilities Support in cross-site/cross functional project teams to ensure cross-site material transfers are executed smoothly (includes both process & systematic transactions). Serve as primary point of contact for process & systematic troubleshooting/root cause analysis when issues arise, during cross-site material transfer process. Identify, maintain, and manage master data needs/gaps to ensure a smooth cross-site material transfer process. Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) for cross-site material transfer operational processes, providing guidance and support as needed. Facilitate and drive process improvement efforts, including process mapping and optimization. Support monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing the end-to-end process, anticipating and resolving any issues that may arise. Collaborate with other teams, including IT and PMO, to ensure smooth execution of cross-site material transfers, both systematically and procedurally. Review and revise documentation content, such as changes and standard operating procedures (SOPs), to ensure accuracy and compliance. Support the Director in achieving productivity and financial goals through effective cross-functional teamwork. Provide support to stakeholders and team members based in different regions and time zones. Maintain a hybrid work arrangement, spending 50% of time on-site and 50% in a virtual setting.Qualifications Ability to work with a range of technically and culturally diverse people to attain desired results Ability to effectively communicate to a diverse audience at multiple levels Strong critical thinking to analyze complex situations and discern critical issues Knowledge in computer system management or validation experience Strong experience working with external parties and leading cross-functional teams. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization. Strong motivation & self-drive to achieve issue resolution, in a collaborative manner Strategic thinking ability to translate strategy into actionable plans. Strong prioritization skills and the ability to provide clear direction in a dynamic environment. Proven track record of leading large process improvement projects and complex technology projects. Comfortable working in fluid situations with competing project priorities. BA or BS degree; preferably in IT Systems or related field, and/or equivalent experience desired 8-10 years of business system analysis experience. 5-8 years of project management experience. 8-10 years of process management experience. 8-10 years of extensive stakeholder management and organizational change management experience. Proficiency in SAP and experience troubleshooting system issues. Heightened situational awareness and emotional intelligence. About Us: Established in 2004, SPECTRAFORCE® is one of the largest and fastest-growing diversity-owned staffing firms in the US. The growth of our company is a direct result of our global client service delivery model that is powered by our state-of-the-art A.I. proprietary talent acquisition platform, robust ISO 9001:2015/ISO 27001 certified processes, and strong and passionate client engaged teams. We have built our business by providing talent and project-based solutions, including Contingent, Permanent, and Statement of Work (SOW) services to over 140 clients in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, and India. Key industries that we service include Technology, Financial Services, Life Sciences, Healthcare, Telecom, Retail, Utilities and Transportation. SPECTRAFORCE is built on a concept of “human connection,” defined by our branding attitude of NEWJOBPHORIA®, which is the excitement of bringing joy and freedom to the work lifestyle so our people and clients can reach their highest potential. Learn more at: http://www.spectraforce.comBenefits: SPECTRAFORCE offers ACA compliant health benefits as well as dental, vision, accident, critical illness, voluntary life, and hospital indemnity insurances to eligible employees. Additional benefits offered to eligible employees include commuter benefits, 401K plan with matching, and a referral bonus program. SPECTRAFORCE provides unpaid leave as well as paid sick leave when required by law.Equal Opportunity Employer: SPECTRAFORCE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Please contact Human Resources at LOA@spectraforce.com if you require reasonable accommodation.

The Application Analyst is responsible for addressing basic user or build issues, recommending mitigation plans and escalating more complex issues. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This role has oncall responsibilities.Additional InformationAt RWJBarnabas Health, our market-competitive Total Rewards package provides comprehensive benefits and resources to support our employees physical, emotional, social, and financial health.Paid Time Off (PTO) Medical and Prescription Drug InsuranceDental and Vision InsuranceRetirement PlansShort & Long Term DisabilityLife & Accidental Death InsuranceTuition ReimbursementHealth Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending AccountsWellness ProgramsVoluntary Benefits (e.g., Pet Insurance)Discounts Through our Partners such as NJ Devils, NJ PAC, Verizon, and more!Choosing RWJBarnabas Health! RWJBarnabas Health is the premier health care destination providing patient-centered, high-quality academic medicine in a compassionate and equitable manner, while delivering a best-in-class work experience to every member of the team. We honor and appreciate the privilege of creating and sustaining healthier communities, one person and one community at a time. As the leading academic health system in New Jersey, we advance innovative strategies in high-quality patient care, education, and research to address both the clinical and social determinants of health.RWJBarnabas Health aims to truly make a unique impact in local communities throughout New Jersey. From vastly improving the health of local residents to creating educational and career opportunities, this combination greatly benefits the state. We understand the growing and evolving needs of residents in New Jersey whether that be enhancing the coordination for treating complex health conditions or improving community health through local programs and education.Equal Opportunity EmployerRWJBarnabas Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Data Analyst
job_description: About AgadiaWe specialize in healthcare management technology and offer a suite of utilization management software solutions for our clients. Our mission is dedicated to improving the quality of care and expediting the delivery of healthcare services by advancing and automating utilization management processes. We are based in Parsippany, NJ, with clients across the United States. As we grow, we are looking for a detail-oriented, self-motivated, independent Data Analyst to help analyze, design, and modify business needs and requirements.Responsibilities:Data Modeling: Designing and building efficient, scalable data models that handle complex data structures and relationships. DAX Development: Writing DAX formulas and calculations to extract meaningful insights from data, enabling advanced analytics and visualizations. Report Development: Creating visually appealing and informative reports and dashboards tailored to business needs. Tool Mastery: Proficient in Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and other tools like Azure Analysis Services and SSIS. Data Integration: Understanding and implementing data integration techniques to connect various data sources seamlessly. Performance Optimization: Ensuring reports and dashboards run efficiently and handle large data volumes without performance issues. Other Requirements:5+ years of experience in the development of business intelligence reports.Understand and analyze business requirements in the context of business intelligence.Transform business requirements into technical publications.Develop robust data documentation about algorithms, parameters, and models.Make essential technical and strategic changes to improve present business intelligence systems.Staying updated on the latest Power BI trends and technologies.Contribute to developing Power BI best practices and standards within the organization.Ensuring data security and compliance with relevant regulations.QualificationsBachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science)Proven experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on Power BISolid understanding of relational databases and data modeling conceptsExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to communicate & present complex findings clearly and concisely to all the stakeholders, including decision-makers.Key CompetenciesCommunicates effectively– Attentively listens to others, provides timely and helpful information, and is effective in a range of professional settings. Gives and receives feedback in a productive, professional manner. Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills.Manages Ambiguity -Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear. It is flexible in approach and is able to adapt its approach to meet changing business needs.Manages complexity -Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. Has strong organizational skills and can manage multiple activities at once. It pays high attention to detail.Ensures Accountability -Follows through on commitments and makes sure others do the same. Able to work independently as part of a small team.

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Hybrid - 2-3 days/week in Newark.Long term contract to hire position.Role In this role you will:  Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. BA/BS in CS, Information Systems or Information management or Systems design. Life and Disability experience. Group Insurance experience a plus. Knowledge of SQL, Databases and Analytical/Reporting tools such as PowerBI/Tableau a plus.

title: Senior Application Development Analyst
job_description: Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.Position Purpose and Scope: Facilitate and drive application development, support, end user training, and execution of strategic and business critical projects supporting key Product Technology business initiatives across Ralph Lauren. Successfully manage technical and functional aspects of various Product-Technology applications partnering with IT cross-functional teams and Business leads and supporting the domain lead. Support and develop the primary technology application and ecosystem for visual line collaboration, digital product creation and all other product designers’ tools. The primary tools at Ralph Lauren are: VibeIQ; Adobe; Browzwear; Clo; Gerber; Key Shot; Pointecarre; Rhino; Shima Seiki; Solidworks Emphasis on involvement in transformational projects such as the support and scaling of Visual Line Collaboration (VLC) a key initiative in the Digitize the Value Chain (DVC) program. This is inclusive of but not limited to both business and technical analyses activities, discovery, documentation, change management, development and delivery of functional training, support sessions etc. Working on future scope/business capabilities that VLC may be considered for (e.g. retirement of PhotoBook+, Home in VLC for product/image library, etc.) Support overall application maintenance and stability following standard IT and security protocols and procedures. Facilitate daily technology operations including issue analysis and resolution avoiding downtime and delays. Work collaboratively with various IT and business partners to ensure seamless integration of product data across the matrix of applications. Support and execute testing efforts ensuring applications are production ready and support business requirements. Assist with technical content and execution of strategic projects that covers multiple cross-functional areas. Support domain projects with technical planning and execution. Execute and support the software build process and production release. Partner with Business Leads + IT partners to recommend and deliver global solutions. Deliver technology solutions in alignment with project and business objectives. Perform application admin responsibilities, inclusive of, but not limited to responsibilities relating to OOTB configuration and system administrative activities. End user support and training as needed. Ongoing monitoring and issue resolution within single applications and or end to end with other systems in the ecosystem. Capture & document business processes into detailed workflows, including functional & data requirements in partnership with Business Transformation or Project teams. Escalate issues/risks to system owner. Understanding the prioritization, sequencing, deliverance of new capabilities that come through transformational projects and direct interaction with business. Continually identify new opportunities to enhance and mature future ways of working.Experience, Skills & Knowledge In-depth technical and functional knowledge of fashion merchandising technologies (VibeIQ, Visulon, Adobe, 2d and 3d design tools, etc.) knowledge a plus. In-depth technical and functional PLM (PTC FlexPLM) application knowledge is a plus. Familiarity with asset management and in PLM and DAM a plus. Experience with managing product image files a plus (2d/3D). Experience with system configuration, customization, and interfaces between core systems. Preferred experience connecting PLM with ERP, BI and Merchandising systems. Previous operational and project support experience. Ability to documents and communicate concepts and proposals. Meticulous record keeping and documentation of current configurations and application history. Experience in working with project execution in Agile methodologies is preferred. Excellent communication (written and verbal), presentations and interpersonal skills required. Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Ability to quickly learn new process skills and applications. Ability to perform technical trouble shooting is a plus. Ability to run SQL/PL SQL scripts will be a plus. Bachelor’s Degree preferred. 5 years of business experience in retail industry, product design/development and project delivery. . Preferred experience in 3D technology and Line Planning Participated in successful business transformation and strategic initiatives, preferred. Ability to understand and manage complex cross-functional business processes.Collaborative, motivated, curious, kind and energetic with the ability to work on multiple tracks.
