title: Senior Threat Detection Engineer
job_description: We are looking for a savvy, high-performing Security Engineer who will be responsible for the day-to-day management of company-wide information security toolsets and the protection of Blackbaud’s and Client’s information. Security Engineers diligently investigate anomalous events and alerts, detect malicious activities, reverse engineer malware, and write signatures and scripts for various security tools to defend against malicious activity. The Security Engineer provides reports to management regarding the negative impact to the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration, or denial of access to information. The Security Engineer is primarily involved in the analysis, reverse engineering, troubleshooting and resolution of complex threats that impact the information security infrastructure at the data, application, service, operating system, and network levels.What You’ll Be DoingPerform intrusion analysis using SIEM technology, packet captures, reports, data visualization, log analysis and pattern analysis First responder to security events and escalations via email, phone, and tickets across corporate user networks, data centers, and cloud environments. Assist in remediation of all information security incidents Hunting for and identifying threat actor groups and respective tactics, techniques and proceduresDocument and communicate findings, escalate critical incidents, and interact with lines of businessImprove and challenge existing processes and procedures in a very agile and fast paced cyber security environment Keeps current on the threat landscape and cyber security trends Ability to adapt to fluid infrastructures and to learn/support new technologies Thought leader around new security alert content creation, data correlation, anomaly thresholds, and logic updates Primary mentor to the core analyst team with regards to training & escalationWhat We Are Looking For3+ years security analysis experience 5+ years of IT or networking experience Intermediate to Advanced Linux/Unix OS and Windows knowledge Deep expertise in at least one public cloudFirewall rule and policy fundamentals Network routing fundamentals Ability to manage parallel tasks and accurately document resolutions Experience working with customers in a fast-paced environment Working knowledge of network packet analysis tools Intermediate understanding of scripting (e.g., PERL, Python, shell scripting) Familiarity with cyber security frameworks such as NIST and MITRE ATT&CKIndustry recognized professional certification such as (but not limited to): Security+, CBROPS, CSA, CEH, GSEC, SSCPNice To HavesIndustry recognized professional certification such as (but not limited to):CISSP, GBFA, GCDA, GCIA, GCIH, GMON, GNFA, GOSI, GPEN, GPPA, GREM, GSOC, OSDA, OSCPDirect experience with malware and analysis techniques and methodologies.Experience with playbook development using Security Orchestration and Automated Response (SOAR) platformsStay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and YouTubeBlackbaud is a remote-first company which embraces a flexible remote work culture. Blackbaud supports hiring and career development for all roles from the location you are in today!Blackbaud is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.To all recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.A notice to candidates: Recruitment Fraudulent Alert: Your personal information and online safety as a candidate mean a lot to us! At Blackbaud and our portfolio of companies, recruiters only direct candidates to apply through our official careers page at https://careers.blackbaud.com/us/en or our official LinkedIn page. Recruiters will never request payments, ask for financial account information or sensitive information like social security numbers, or conduct interviews via Skype. Anyone suggesting otherwise is not a representative of Blackbaud. If you are unsure if a message is from Blackbaud, please email blackbaudrecruiting@blackbaud.com. The starting base pay is $101,900.00 to $132,800.00. Blackbaud may pay more or less based on employee qualifications, market value, Company finances, and other operational considerations.Benefits IncludeMedical, dental, and vision insuranceRemote-first workforce401(k) program with employer matchFlexible paid time offGenerous Parental LeaveVolunteer for vacationOpportunities to connect to build community and belongingPet insurance, legal and identity protectionTuition reimbursement programR0011541

title: Senior Reliability Engineer
job_description: What this job involves: Reliability engineers are professionals responsible for ensuring that a business’s equipment and processes operate at optimal levels and meet the needs of the organization. Their main goal is to increase equipment uptime, reliability, and efficiency. They achieve this by analyzing data, identifying problems, and developing solutions for potential equipment issues before they occur.Being the bearer of engineering best practicesDo you relish the idea of managing a variety of projects?This role requires someone who can efficiently and effectively oversee our delivery of operational and engineering services for not just one, but for multiple clients and multiple sites. Sites are a mixed between manufacturing, R&D, Industrial, Chemical and pharmaceutical. The total square footage is over 35 million square feet combined a of one of our key financial institution clients.With such a lot at stake, you must have the ability to carry out and follow through on procedures that are vital in critical environments and general building services engineering (e.g., critical equipment maintenance and upkeep). This will be overseeing and designing a robust Pdm program for a few of our key clients in our industrial and pharma verticals. Your knowledge, views, and technical expertise will allow you to keep a lookout for opportunities to develop, innovate, and share within the global engineering teams programs that not only reduce costs, but also increase productivity. Spotting developments in international best practices and figuring out how to apply them locally is a constant, yet rewarding, challenge. This role also puts you in a unique position to promote our sustainability service strategies for achieving measurable improvements in energy use.Bridging gaps in processes and controlsAs a Subject Matter Expert, you’ll contribute to the optimization of processes, tools and documentation. At the front of your mind at all times is completion and compliance of the critical environment management (CEM) audit process. Keeping planned preventive maintenance programs and service contracts in place and the work practices of contractors in check are also your mandate.‘Safety first’ mindset is critical and a key to a successful program, ensure that you follow the safety requirements per client and per site and that they meet with JLL’s standards.Leading and growing our engineering teams.In this role, you’ll manage our teams of engineering and facility management experts, ensuring that members have the skills, direction, and information they need to level up their know-how in delivering engineering services. You’ll equip them with the right training and support them in getting their accreditations. Working hand in hand with line managers, you’ll also be responsible for recruitment, performance planning and evaluations, succession planning and pay and reward programs.Do you have the skills, passion and aptitude to take on this role? Are you ready and excited to champion business goals and continuous improvement initiatives that empower both our clients and our people? Do you know how to build a diverse team and inclusive culture that brings out the best in everyone? If yes, then this job is for you.The key assignment for the role is the following:Securing a seamless (no interruptions) and mitigate downtime on equipment systemImplementing the improvement plan that leads to our contractual commitments around costs and qualitySecuring a constructive relationship with our client and our key vendor to deliver the improvement planResponsibilities:The Reliability Engineer is crucial role in the Site Team and in the Subject Matter Expert network in support of JLL Operations in APAC. Role is first to find improvement opportunities in the existing practices, and second to provide analytical support, training and coordination on all areas concerning engineering reliability management. This includes (and is not limited to) the development and evaluation of CMMS and BMS data and routine performance trending. The person in this role drives improvement based on in-depth know–how of the systems in scope, and through that knowledge optimizes the systems in-scope, their operations, and the related CMMS procedures. S/he is a competent consultant / business analyst to train Engineering teams. Drive Change and Getting it done are the most important JLL Leadership Capabilities we’re looking for. Reliability Engineer Duties:Defines and implements reliability improvement plans, recommend improvements on maintenance processes (job plans, planning, up to spare parts) and asset and system improvementsProvides in-house consulting activities to advise and counsel personnel on a variety of complicated processes/proceduresStimulates the team to define proposals and evaluates these on merit to determine the underlying cause of problems. Performs root cause analysis and reports to prevent future failuresCoordinates with JLL’s Reliability Engineering teams for implementation of all JLL tools, best practices and provides subject matter expertiseAnalyses and improves operational Engineering PerformanceCompletion rates of PPM and CM, service delivery interruptions to exceed contractual KPIsPropose and drives the action plan to correct any deviations in Site performance. In charged or working with different countries, sites ops team and client for reporting requirement, generate and consolidate for submission of reports as per requirement. Analyzing equipment failure data to identify patterns and trends. Developing and implementing new maintenance procedures. Designing and implementing new procedures for monitoring and testing equipment. Finding new technologies and processes that can improve equipment performance and reliability. Developing and implementing training programs for employees. Collaborating with other departments to ensure that reliability is integrated into all aspects of the organization. Sound like you? To apply you need to have: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent, Business, or related field desirableMinimum 10 years’ experience as a Reliability Subject Matter Expert, Performance Analytics, Data AnalyticsAnalytical thinking: the ability to think critically and logically, as well as the ability to work with large sets of data and make sense of them. Technical aptitude: a strong understanding of the systems, equipment, and processes at hand. This includes knowledge of the engineering principles and specific systems used at an organization. Problem-solving: the ability to think creatively and come up with innovative solutions to complex problems. Communication: the ability to explain technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner, as well as the ability to collaborate effectively with others. Project management: the ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously and effectively including planning, scheduling, and organizing. Data management skills: the ability to use statistical analysis tools as well as the ability to interpret and communicate the results of the analysis. A continuous improvement mindset: identifying and implementing ways to continuously improve reliability. Safety-conscious: the ability to identify potential hazards and take the necessary steps to mitigate them. Expert and knowledge of all engineering disciplines in scopePractical experience in Hard Services contract delivery, in cleanroom environments and building properties. Proven track record of complianceComprehensive knowledge and practical experience of the application of engineering reliability toolsAbility to simplify the complex: Explain difficult technical improvements in understandable terms to various stakeholders (including non-technical)Capacity to deal with ambiguity and solve complex problems effectively; knows when to escalateAnalytical, proven ability to solve problems using an objective approachStrong communicator, both verbally & written, in English and ItalianProven ability to initiate and follow through with improvement initiativesQuality Management knowledge and experienceDemonstrated process orientation and data driven skill sets Strong aptitude for technology and systemsHighly proficient in MS Office Suite specifically in Excel supporting data analytics and manipulationProficiency in SmartSheet, MS SharePoint, and data visualizations preferredSuperior customer service skills and a strong orientation to provide exceptional JLL customer experiencePreferred experience with JLL Next Generation MaintenanceAbility to multitask and work without direct supervisionStrong organizational skills and collaborative style neededTravel required

title: Product Owner
job_description: Job Description: Top Skills:• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Product Management delivering successful and innovative products• Leadership and communication. Proven ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical team members, including the executive level• Proficient in JIRA• Experience in Figma, Adobe Xd• Experience with data infrastructure / platform / back-end / data engineeringRoleThe primary focus of this role will be shepherding new programs and features from start to finish by partnering closely with end users, Engineers, and Executive Stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Product Management (Product Owner, Business Analyst, etc.), User Experience & User Research, Computer Science, or related fields, with demonstrated experience shipping new products from conception to launch.You will support the development of Client’s Data Commons by applying Product Management best practices to delight your customers in the most efficient way possible. You will leverage design thinking while collaborating cross functionally to improve the problem areas (data search, data consumption, etc.) of your program’s customers. Ultimately, you will have both tactical and strategic responsibilities, using your willingness to roll up your sleeves to achieve the company’s objectives.What you’ll do• Deeply understand core problem spaces, data use cases, pain points, and processes within the Research space• Develop an overarching multi-year enterprise level roadmap with associated milestones and objectives that informs and aligns product stakeholders (IT, Executives, etc.)• Deeply understand the Data Platform’s architecture and technology to drive from current to expected future state in a timely manner• Act as Agile Product Owner for your remit, breaking down epics into consumable user stories/tasks, continuously grooming the backlog, and partnering with other Product Managers to prioritize aProductst all platform feature development• Partner with the development team to understand technical constraints, level of effort, remove blockers, and guide feature development to completion• Utilize user product strategy and roadmap for data, search, and AI/Client features• Strive to for continuous self-improvement as a Product Manager, sharing best practices with the team regularlyYou’ll Love This into the problem space and use case details• Thrive in environments of high complexity and high impact• Thrive in working with technical teams and leadershipMinimum Qualifications:• Minimum of 5 statistics, economics, or engineering• Experience with data infrastructure / platform / back-end / data engineering• Experience working with agile development teams• Experience defining product requirements and using data and metrics to determine outcomesPreferred Qualifications:• Multiple years of pharmaceutical and/or bio-tech industry experience• Strong customer empathy, with an ability to transform complex data and customer insights into a prioritized roadmap• Leadership and communication. Proven ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical team members, including the executive level• Strong communication and partnership skills – this will be an extremely cross-functional role, with more than a handful of stakeholder teams• Entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset• Data Engineering experience is a plusAdditional Job Requirements:None

title: Sr. Associate, Business Operations - Remote| WFH
job_description: Job DescriptionOur team at Marketplace is on a mission to empower individuals to turn their aspirations into reality. With a focus on providing trusted advice and guidance, we assist people in making informed decisions that they can feel confident about, allowing them to prioritize what matters most to them. We are a group of seasoned industry experts committed to aiding readers in making smart choices and selecting the right products effortlessly.Marketplace brings together decades of experience spanning various geographies and teams, including Content, SEO, Business Intelligence, Finance, HR, Marketing, Production, Technology, and Sales. Our team's diverse expertise contributes to Marketplace's comprehensive coverage of consumer credit, debt, health, home improvement, banking, investing, credit cards, small business, education, insurance, loans, real estate, and travel.Senior Associate, Business OperationsMarketplace is in search of a Senior Associate, Business Operations to spearhead measurement and business operations across our emerging portfolio of owned and operated comparison shopping businesses.Reporting directly to the Senior Vice President (SVP) of O&O Businesses, this pivotal role involves designing, launching, and optimizing multiple new business lines in the Health, Home, and Professional service categories. During the startup phase, the incumbent will wear many hats, establishing a robust foundation of data-driven operations and processes conducive to scalable growth.The ideal candidate is a collaborative team player with a passion for business expansion. They possess an ownership mentality, perpetually seeking novel ways to enhance business operations. Their decision-making process is driven by data, enabling them to allocate resources efficiently to drive maximum impact. Thriving in dynamic, fast-paced environments, they excel at problem-solving and embrace ambiguity with curiosity and humility. Above all, they are exceptional colleagues, setting high performance standards, offering support to teammates, and fostering a collaborative work culture.Responsibilities Business Optimization: Gain insights into key performance metrics and drive optimizations based on data analysis. Collaborate across functions to implement changes, measure their impact, and leverage learnings to enhance KPI performance. Measurement and Reporting: Partner with the SVP and Analytics team to develop effective performance reporting and optimization tools. Continuously refine reporting solutions to improve speed, accuracy, accessibility, and impact. Business Operations: Develop project plans aligned with primary business objectives and key results. Maintain transparent communication on project progress, obstacles, and insights to ensure efficient project completion. Financial Modeling and Prioritization: Utilize business and financial data to model opportunities, support data-driven decision-making, and allocate resources effectively. Set revenue and cost targets in collaboration with functional leads and the SVP.Skills And ExperienceMust Have: 2-3 years of experience in an Analyst or Operations role, preferably in a large affiliate or performance marketing business. Proficiency in data manipulation tools such as MS Excel and Looker/Tableau. Experience collaborating with Data Engineers and Analytics leads to design and build measurement frameworks. Track record of working cross-functionally to understand performance and prioritize, execute optimizations. Startup or small business experience with a versatile skill set, resourcefulness, and comfort in ambiguous environments. Strong written and oral communication skills, including data insights curation, problem resolution, and resource allocation decision-making.Nice To Have Experience in Health, Home, or Professional Service and/or comparison marketplace business. Experience managing lead generation and sales programs in platforms such as Impact Radius, Commission Junction, and Leadspedia (or similar). Market sizing experience including TAM, SAM, and SOM research, customer, partner segmentation, and sizing. Proficiency in growth marketing tools for tracking and analyzing digital program performance such as Google Analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, and SEOclarity. SQL skills.Benefits Competitive compensation package. Remote work flexibility. Unlimited PTO. Every third Friday of the month off. Winter break closure; the week between Christmas and New Year's. Home office setup. Wellness reimbursement.Additional InformationThe company is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.Employment Type: Full-Time

title: Senior Financial Analyst -Interest Rate Risk Governance (Remote)
job_description: OverviewThis position is within Corporate Treasury’s Balance Sheet Management team and is responsible for supporting the establishment and enhancement of an effective governance framework for interest rate risk (IRR) management: policies and procedures, material risk identification and assessment, reviewing inventory of metrics/limits and sensitivity testing, new product assessment, and practices generally consistent with supervisory expectations for a Large Financial Institution.This individual possesses demonstrated initiative, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and a strong analytical mindset in support of efforts to identify enhancement opportunities in existing or proposed processes and support strategic decision making.Open to remote work for the following locations Charlotte, NC, Raleigh, NC, or Morristown, NJ.ResponsibilitiesIRR Framework: Support the enhancement of a sustainable IRR management program that meets regulatory expectations, while supporting the Bank’s overall balance sheet management strategies. Work cross-functionally to manage stakeholders (e.g. 2nd line of defense) and follow through on the execution of projects with a high attention to detail. Business Support - Assist in the development of a governance and control framework ensuring completeness and accuracy in analysis and reporting including clear and concise documentation of process assumptions, limitations, and weaknesses.Data Analysis - Source, compile, and interpret data. Perform data analysis, effectively communicating and directing analysis output. Recognize opportunities for automation and/or increased efficiency and help drive implementation.Reporting - Convey patterns, problems, areas of improvement with a mindset for continuous improvement of reporting processes. Prepare materials for meetings with management committees, regulators, etc.Peer Leadership - Assist management with the onboarding and training of new staff. Mentor less experienced staff, including review of daily output and coaching.In North Carolina, the base pay for this position is relative to your experience but the range is generally $87,341 to $151,391 per year. This position is eligible for variable compensation, which may be in the form of incentive, bonus, or commission pay. First Citizens offers a competitive, comprehensive benefits program which you can review here: https://jobs.firstcitizens.com/benefitsQualificationsBachelor's Degree and 6 years of experience in Finance or Consulting OR High School Diploma or GED and 10 years of experiencePreferred QualificationsDegree in Finance, Engineering, Math, Economics, or similar fieldKnowledge of Market Risk and IRR regulation is highly preferred (e.g., SR 10-1)Experience at large or growing Financial Institutions or in management/risk consultingExcellent project management, presentation, and interpersonal skills; strong technical writing skills

title: CTMS Analyst (Remote)
job_description: General Information Location:  Princeton, NJ, Remote Organization:  ThreeWire, Inc. Job Type:  Full Time - RegularDescription And RequirementsABOUT WCG: WCG’s clinical solutions are built on a foundation of best-in-class clinical services companies. We deliver transformational solutions that stimulate growth, foster compliance, and maximize efficiency for those performing clinical trials. WCG is proud to serve individuals on the frontlines of science and medicine, and the organizations striving to develop new products and therapies to improve the quality of human health. It is our role to empower them to accelerate advancement, while ensuring the risks of progress never outweigh the value of human life.WHY WE LOVE WCG: At WCG, our employees are our most valuable asset, and as with all our assets, we invest in them with an eye toward future success. We provide each eligible employee with a comprehensive set of benefits designed to protect their personal and financial health to help make the most of their future.Comprehensive Benefits package - Health, Dental, Vision, Life Disability, 401k with match, and flexible spending accountsEmployee Assistance Programs and additional work/life resourcesReferral Bonuses and Tuition ReimbursementFlexible PTOVolunteer Time Off to benefit the communityOpportunities for career development with on-the-job training, certification assistance, and continuing education reimbursementExpected annual base salary range: $69,840 to $108,500GPS level: P3JOB SUMMARY: The CTMS Business Analyst is responsible for providing high-quality calendar builds and accurate financial entry services (service deliverables) for site clients who utilize a Clinical Trial Management System for clinical research financial oversight and patient enrollment management. WCG SSU services are culminated by the CTMS service deliverables, triggering the start date for site study activation. As such, timely and accurate CTMS service deliverables are imperative to meet the increasing demands on research sites to decrease study activation timelines, which directly affects site funding.ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The accountabilities listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required.Provide expert level calendar builds and financial entry utilizing industry expertise and incorporating site client requirements. Specific duties may vary depending on team assignments and business needs:Read, analyze, and interpret clinical trial protocols to develop a comprehensive CTMS mapping plan.Collaborate with internal WCG teams and site client to ensure billing determinations, sponsor budget, and clinical trial agreement are congruent with the clinical trial protocol and site client requirements prior to building calendar or entering financials in the CTMS platform.Accurately revise previous deliverables to align with amendments and changing client preferences.Review work completed by others as a part of the internal quality review process.Manage site clients with exceptional customer service through industry expertise, guidance, and frequent communications.Consultatively solve problems with internal WCG and site client teams to obtain consensus for best practices.Other duties as assigned by supervisor. These may, on occasion, be unrelated to the position described here.Attendance, time management and attendance are essential functions of the position.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred. Equivalent combination of significant work experience in related field, education, and skills to perform the job may be considered in lieu of a relevant degree. Coverage analysis and research budget development experience preferred.Qualifications/ExperienceAbility to work in a performance-driven environment: a proactive, results-driven and goal-oriented approach.Demonstrated ability to learn and apply technical and scientific product-related information in a consultative manner.Ability to work independently while providing a high-quality product within designated timelines.Strong ability to read and interpret complex clinical trial protocols.Prior experience with building calendars and entering financials into a CTMS platform.Excellent attention to detail and highly organized.Ability to understand clinical terms and descriptors and strong investigative and critical thinking skills.Excellent communication (oral/written) and interpersonal skills.Preferred but not required:Familiarity with the clinical trial start-up processExperience with oncology calendar builds and financial entryFamiliarity with research billing guidelines (e.g. Medicare NCD 310.1) and/or general healthcare billing processes (coding, Medicare regulations, etc.).Travel Requirements☒ 0% – 5%☐ 5% - 10%☐ 10% - 20%☐ 20% - 50%☐ >50%Physical and Sensory Requirements: The physical and sensory requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be offered to individuals with disabilities to assist in performing the essential functions of the position. Work activities involve light to moderate physical effort (for example, sitting in one place for extended periods of time, standing, walking, bending, lifting lightweight objects, intermittent to sustained periods of keyboarding). Majority of time is spent in a seated position with frequent opportunity to move about at will. Activities require a variety of easy muscle movements. Work activities involve a frequent need to concentrate on a variety of sensory inputs for moderate to lengthy durations at a time requiring diligence and attention to interpret effectively. There will be a need to attend to single or simultaneous tasks where accuracy of details is important. The need for detailed and precise work is high. WCG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer – Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin or ancestry, religion or creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran status, reprisal or any other legally recognized basis or status protected by federal, state or local law.

job_description: Job DescriptionAnywhere's Finance Emerging Leaders Program offers a powerful and unique experience for top undergraduates interested in a leadership career with the top tier and most integrated provider of U.S. residential real estate services encompassing franchise, brokerage, relocation, and title and settlement business as well as mortgage joint venture. The Finance Emerging Leaders Program is a challenging 24-month rotational program designed to develop leaders who will position Anywhere for growth while at the same time investing heavily in your growth holistically to set you up for success.The Finance Emerging Leaders Program is crafted to expose you to many aspects of finance including:Financial Planning And Analysis, Controllership, And Treasury Operations. As a Member Of The Finance Emerging Leaders Program, You Will Participate In Challenging And Exciting Learning And Development Experiences IncludingRotational Assignments: The Finance rotational assignments provide on-the-job learning and help to develop a breadth of knowledge. Through assignments, Analysts gain invaluable work experience that can span across different business segments.Training & Development: Analysts are supported throughout their tenure in the program with learning events to develop eye for business and leadership effectiveness. Analysts take courses, taught by finance leaders, every rotation; these courses help to bridge the gap between school-based learning and application in the Anywhere world. Training areas include but are not limited to advancing skills, leadership and professional development.Coaching & Mentoring: Each Analyst receives coaching from multiple sources and is paired up with a more experienced leader (mentor), who assists the Analyst (mentee) in developing skills and knowledge that will improve leadership and personal growth. Analysts are also paired with a junior mentor (Finance buddy), who helps to answer the questions.Networking: Developing and maintaining mutually helpful relationships is key to launching a successful career. Analysts will have a variety of opportunities to network with senior leaders and numerous hard-working and creative colleagues from across Anywhere.Performance Management: To support accelerated development, Analysts are given continuous feedback through regular 1:1’s and formal performance evaluations every quarter.Job RequirementsThe candidate must be a high-energy, self-starter who constantly seeks to learn new things, values diverse thought, and is ready to contribute to an inclusive team-oriented work environment. This individual must be driven by curiosity and critical thinking, thrives in sophisticated environments and has the ability to adapt to change quickly and adjust their work in a positive, professional manner. Specifically: Graduation within two years with a B.A. degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Management Information Systems (MIS).  Strong record of achievement (minimum 3.2 cumulative GPA).  Leadership role in collegiate and/or community activities.  Capacity and motivation for hard work.  Outstanding analytical and quantitative skills.  Strong interpersonal, written and communication skills.  Excellent organizational and leadership skills.  Strong PC skills including Microsoft Excel (pivot tables and basic functions).  General understanding of technology’s role in Finance.  Curiosity about committing to a multi-year career with Anywhere after completion of program. Employment TypeFull-timeCompanyAnywhere Real Estate IncAbout UsAnywhere Real Estate Inc. (NYSE: HOUS) is on a mission to empower everyone’s next move. Home to some of the most recognized brands in real estate Better Homes and Gardens® Real Estate , Century 21® , Coldwell Banker® , Coldwell Banker Commercial® , Corcoran® , ERA® , and Sotheby's International Realty®The Anywhere portfolio includes franchise and brokerage operations as well as national title, settlement, and relocation companies and nationally scaled mortgage origination and underwriting joint ventures. Supporting approximately 1.5 million home transactions in 2021, Anywhere is focused on simplifying, digitizing and integrating the real estate transaction for all consumers, no matter where they may be in their home buying and selling journey. With innovative products and technology, Anywhere fuels the productivity of its approximately 196,200 independent sales agents in the US and approximately 136,400 independent sales agents in 118 other countries and territories. Recognized for twelve consecutive years as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies, Anywhere has also been designated a Great Place to Work four years in a row, named one of LinkedIn’s 2022 Top Companies in the U.S., and honored by Forbes as one of the World’s Best Employers 2022.At Anywhere, diversity fuels success – for our company and for our employees.  We strive to be the preferred company for diverse talent, committed to creating an inclusive environment that encourages everyone to succeed. We pursue talent – strategic thinkers who are eager to innovate, focused on execution and accountable for results. We value diversity – respecting backgrounds, cultures, perspectives.You’ll find our commitment to diversity reflected in our achievements: Forbes 2022 Best Employers for Diversity.  Forbes 2022 World’s Top Female Friendly Companies.  Recognized on the 2020 Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index.  Recognized for gender diversity on our board of directors by Executive Women of New Jersey and Women’s Forum of New York. With diversity, we succeed together. We hope you’ll join us.EEO StatementEOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

title: Digital Implementation Specialist - NJ/PA Area
job_description: Paradigm is a software company transforming the way that the residential, construction & building product industries operate across the globe. We are looking for a Digital Implementation Specialist to be part of revolutionizing these industries.We are looking for a Digital Implementation Specialist - New Jersey, Baltimore/Philadelphia Area to provide in-market support focused on education and supporting the local sales & operations teams on the new digital tools and workflows. Join our team as we revolutionize the home building industry!What You Will Do:You will be responsible for implementing digital tools & services for all BFS markets.You will interact directly with internal and external customers to consult on system configuration needs.You will analyze business requirements for system configuration and software enhancements. You will articulate requirements to the product team and then test/set up the new functionality for the customer. You are the liaison between the “industry” and the “software” experts.You will understand and educate the local BFS Markets on digital tools, workflows, and processes.You will provide support, through questions and training for new and existing team members.You will be a pivotal resource for our clients with configuration, testing, training, and issue resolution. Your focus is to ensure our customers are satisfied with their used of digital tools and that the system is configured to meet their needs. This will include ongoing support and maintenance of a customer’s configuration to ensure our system evolves as their business needs evolve.You will focus on adoption and usage metrics. You will provide communication around progress of adoption and new initiatives.You will work within our CRM tools and keep clean and accurate data.What You Need to Succeed:You have 2+ years of experience in a Business Analyst or Software Implementation or Support role.You will need critical thinking, requirement gathering skills, and proven problem-solving skills.You are proficient in digital communication (email, text, etc.). You know when to pick up the phone, or when to message or when to show up in person.You are comfortable using a CRM, and understand the value of good data in. If you understand how to mine CRM data to make decisions and strategies, even better!You are known for being able to stay present, providing solutions. You will learn with us, as we learn from the past, but you will be ready to affect the future.You have strong presentation skills. You are adept with Microsoft PowerPoint & Outlook for creating presentations and communication.You are flexible, able to adjust and change direction as the business & tech environments evolve & change. You are entrepreneurial in spirit; unchartered territories & problems energize you. You can thrive in the unknown and adapt to changing business needs. This invigorates you and makes you want to dig in.You will be traveling regionally/locally to BFS weekly and/or daily. Travel would flex but can range up to 80%.Ready to Join? Apply online at www.myparadigm.com/careers/
Job function: Training, Information Technology, and Customer Service

title: Senior Revenue Analyst
job_description: Genesys empowers more than 7,500 organizations in over 100 countries to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the #1 AI-powered experience orchestration platform, Genesys delivers the future of CX to organizations of all sizes so they can provide empathetic, personalized experiences at scale. As the trusted, all-in-one platform born in the cloud, Genesys Cloud accelerates growth for organizations by enabling them to differentiate with the right customer experience at the right time.We employ more than 6,000 people across the globe who embrace empathy and cultivate collaboration to succeed. And, while we offer great benefits and perks like larger tech companies, our employees have the independence to make a larger impact on the company and take ownership of their work. Join the team and create the future of customer experience together.Genesys is looking for a Revenue rockstar to join our growing team! The Senior Analyst will assist in the proactive validation, accounting and review of high value & non-standard sales-related transactions, along with supporting business initiatives including assessment of new products, acquisitions and various internal revenue reporting initiatives.The ideal candidate will also be instrumental in ensuring the accurate reporting of revenue and accounting data as part of the monthly revenue close process.Key ResponsibilitiesThe primary responsibilities for this role include (but are not limited to):Part of a team that ensures that all revenue is accounted for in accordance with Genesys policies and accounting guidelines, i.e. ASC 606.Provide ASC 606 Revenue Recognition guidance to Legal, Deals desk, Sales, and Order Management. Prepare technical accounting memos for complex transactions. Participate in ad hoc projects to support business initiatives including assessment of new products, acquisitions and new internal revenue reporting needs.Operate and oversee revenue related internal controls.Assist with the review of sales opportunities, contracts and non-standard transactions - providing appropriate accounting guidance and proposing solutions within Company's Revenue Recognition policy.Revenue AnalysisReview/approve sales orders against company policy. Advise Sales and Finance operations teams of any inconsistencies against policy and recommended actions.Review of qualifying customer orders to ensure compliance with Revenue Recognition policy and accounting principles.Prepare deal reviews/checklist to ensure revenue is being recognized in adherence to ASC 606 and Company policy.Review of completeness and accuracy of data in the Revenue system (RevPro).Maintain necessary financial and control records along with supporting documentation related to revenue for audit and Sarbanes-Oxley purposes.Other TasksWork closely with Order Management, Collections, Operations and Sales personnel to meet business objectives.Support the revenue projects function in the design, test and implementation of updates to existing and new systems.Evaluation and calculation of revenue-related reserves.Prepare ad hoc analysis, as needed.Required ExperienceMinimum 4 years of related Revenue Recognition experience.Experience with Software clients and/or industry with revenue background.Working knowledge of Software Revenue Recognition Accounting - ASC 606 and familiarity with ASC 985-605 (formerly SOP 97-2), ASU 2009-13 (formerly EITF 08-1) and ASU 2009-14 (formerly EITF 09-3).Required SkillsStrong communication and interpersonal skills.Highly organized, with great attention to detail.Confidence and proven record to communicate both orally and written, including the dissemination of technical information.Ability to interact effectively with Sales and Product teams, functional peer groups and subordinates and to gain cooperation from others, especially those in other departments, as well as with outside auditors and outside legal counsel.Ability to work independently and take ownership of multiple concurrent and diversified tasks, while working with deadlines.Problem solver: The candidate should be a strong, analytical problem solver with a common sense and practical solutions orientation.Desirable SkillsExperience using Salesforce.com, RevPro and NetSuite.Prior experience with SaaS company.Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance and/or Part Qualified Accountant (QBE will also be considered).Public accounting experience.Super-user (Advanced) in Excel (Pivoting, Lookups etc).Experience & understanding of statistical studies (to support VSOE/SSP).CompensationThis role has a market-competitive salary with an anticipated base compensation range listed below. Actual salaries will vary depending on a candidate's experience, qualifications, skills, and location. This role might also be eligible for a commission or performance-based bonus opportunities.$65,350.00 - $128,150.00BenefitsMedical, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Telehealth coverageFlexible work schedules and work from home opportunitiesDevelopment and career growth opportunitiesOpen Time Off in addition to 10 paid holidays401(k) matching programAdoption AssistanceFertility treatmentsMore details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://mygenesysbenefits.comIf a Genesys employee referred you, please use the link they sent you to apply.About GenesysEvery year, Genesys orchestrates billions of remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.Reasonable AccommodationsIf you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you or someone you know may complete the Reasonable Accommodations Form for assistance. Please use the Candidate field in the dropdown menu to ensure a timely response.This form is designed to assist job seekers who seek reasonable accommodation for the application process. Submissions entered for non-accommodation-related issues, such as following up on an application or submitting a resume, may not receive a response.Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to equity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.Please note that recruiters will never ask for sensitive personal or financial information during the application phase.PDN-9be77f52-6fb5-442a-b4f0-2e557f6f06fd

Analyst to join our clients team and play a crucial role in their continued success.Business Analyst - Data AnalystRemote – East Coast USA - Extra plus if you are in northern New JerseyMust have Pharmaceutical Experience Minimum 3 years of experience working with US Specialty Pharmacy data flow and data structureBachelor degree – Top 100 ranked US University a big plusSalary $100-140k DOE + bonusExcellent Benefits – 4 weeks’ vacation Responsibilities:Manage operational processes to onboard Specialty Pharmacy Data.Drive requirements for vendor aggregator to ensure data completeness and readiness.Provide Specialty Pharmacy Data Quality Assurance.Understand data aggregation and integration processes to identify and resolve data issues.Monitor and track weekly physician-level and trends and patterns.Utilize advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to synthesize conclusions for strategic decisions.Conduct market research, gather and interpret data, execute analysis to develop meaningful insights.Perform ad-hoc analysis and projects as required by management.Provide strategic insights to drive business growth and improve operational efficiency.Present findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders, and provide support in decision-making processes.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree3+ years of relevant experience in statistics, business, mathematics, computer science, economics, or a related field.:Minimum 3 years of experience working with US Specialty Pharmacy data flow and data structure.Strong background and experience in the healthcare/life sciences field.Strong analytical mindset, verbal and written communication skills, and problem-solving experience.Proficient in SQL, R, Python, SAS, or similar programming languages/analytical tools, and data visualization software.Experience in data and data services contracts.Knowledge of commercial Life Sciences data sets (NPP, DDD, Xponent, Plantrak, SPP) preferredStrong analytical and interpersonal skills.Organizational skills with the ability to communicate across all departments.Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks to achieve accurate and timely results.Proficient computer skills, including Excel pivot tables and v-look-up, Word, and PowerPoint.Aptitude for identifying opportunities for process improvements and continuous improvement.If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and are ready to make an impact in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. title: Senior Data Analyst (Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics)- New York (Remote)
job_description: Job Title: Senior Data Analyst (Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics)Location: New York or RemoteJob Type: ContractContract Length: 10+ MonthsPay Rate: $45/hr - $58/hrJob DescriptionWe are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining analytics tracking codes, ensuring accurate data collection, and implementing and configuring analytics tools to analyze website and app performance.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain analytics tracking codes to ensure accurate data collection and attribution.Implement and configure analytics tools, including Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics, to track and analyze website and app performance.Demonstrate proven experience as an Analytics Engineer or in a similar role, with hands-on experience in automation using Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics.Possess proficiency in Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics, including implementation, configuration, and data analysis.Have a strong understanding of web and app analytics concepts, such as tracking codes, tags, events, and goals.Utilize experience in automating analytics processes using APIs, scripting languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python), or analytics automation tools.Demonstrate familiarity with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes and tools.Apply a solid understanding of statistics and data analysis techniques.Exhibit strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with meticulous attention to detail.Possess excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders.Hold relevant certifications, such as Google Analytics Individual Qualification (IQ) or Adobe Analytics Certification, which are considered a plus.

title: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst -- Remote --
job_description: Company OverviewWe are a leading technology firm committed to innovation and excellence. Our team is dedicated to pushing boundaries and creating solutions that shape the future. Join us in our mission to drive progress and make a positive impact.Job DescriptionWe have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a key member of our finance department, you will play a crucial role in driving strategic decision-making through comprehensive financial analysis and planning.Responsibilities Lead financial planning and analysis activities, leveraging your expertise to provide insights and recommendations to senior leadership. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement financial strategies aligned with organizational goals. Drive the preparation of financial forecasts, budgets, and variance analysis to support business objectives. Utilize advanced spreadsheet software skills to create complex financial models and reports. Develop business cases to support key initiatives and investment decisions. Conduct in-depth analysis of financial data using SQL and/or SAS coding. Foster strong relationships with senior leadership, providing actionable insights and driving continuous improvement initiatives.Qualifications Bachelor's degree in finance, business, or related field. Minimum eight (8) years of experience in financial planning & analysis or directly related business experience. Minimum three (3) years of experience in a leadership role, with or without direct reports. Proficiency in advanced functions of spreadsheet software (e.g., Excel), including graphics, pivot tables, macros, and complex formulas. Experience working in the healthcare industry (desired). Strong analytical skills with experience in developing business cases. Demonstrated proficiency in SQL and/or SAS coding. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with senior leadership.Equal Opportunity EmployerAt the company, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and strive to create an environment where everyone feels valued and respected. If you require accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will accommodate your needs. Join us in our mission to create a more inclusive work environment and drive positive change.Employment Type: Full-Time

title: Remote Data, Analytics & Insights - Data Operations - Mid-level Assignment
job_description: AboutThis team is supporting a major business transformation project to streamline, standardize, digitize, and automate their business processes.The 2 new roles FP&A and Gen Accounting are under 1 manager.This team is supporting the move from SAP ECC to SAP S4 HANA.Candidates will not be doing actual FP&A or gen accounting tasks but help with the transition from SAP ECC to SAP S4 HANA.Looking ForExp with SAP S4 HANASomeone who can work with different groups within Mars to understand what the requirements are, what the business processes are currently and what they need to be in SAPHelp with testing, data migrationNot actually doing FP&A, but understands it and can translate the requirements and how they work in the new SAP S4 HANA systemSchedule: Standard 40 hours. M-F, 8-5 Eastern hours required.Interviews: 1-2 videoTitle: Data Operations- Midlevel - Analyst Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) (32433-1)Duration: 0-18 Months [Target start: 11/6/2023]Location: Newark, New Jersey 07102 [Candidate must be able to work onsite. Candidates that can work in the Eastern Time zone can be considered for remote work.]Schedule: Standard 40 hours. M-F, 8-5 EasternJob DescriptionAnalyst Financial Planning and AnalysisMars Retail Group & ETHEL M Chocolates are embarking on an 18-month business transformation journey to streamline, standardize, digitize, and automate our business. This includes business process transformation and modernizing our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system, related tools, and core functionality. The roles on the program team will work together to create standardized, efficient, and future-leaning processes and technological solutions.The Analyst (Financial Planning & Analysis) works with Mars Financial Services, Mars Global Services, MRG Finance, Digital Technologies team members, and functional Accenture team members to transform our finance processes and systems. Key areas of focus include Financial Reporting and Consolidations, FP&A process/reporting/systems as well as Product Cost Accounting. This role will support stakeholders across finance (and adjacent functions), provide clarity and prioritization on requirements, drive alignment between business and teams, and execute the transformation across business processes and the S/4 HANA system. This role is the champion of the solution and transformation.What are we looking for?3+ years' experience in a SAP FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) environment.Understanding of annual execution financial planning & analysis process including integrated value creation planningUnderstanding of Corporate Reporting (CFin preferred).Understanding of Product Standard Cost processes.Experience analyzing and communicating data with excellent written and verbal skillsUnderstanding of Mars Retail Group or Ethel M Chocolate within the context of Mars Wrigley (preferred).What would be your key responsibilities?Support documentation of business process flows for financial planning and analysis including the annual execution plan and the integrated value creation plan. Support creation of future-state process improvements & make recommendations on financial organization structures, as aligned with the GPO-Finance.Provide input to Change Impact Assessment discussions.Establish business requirements and user experiences and specify the "WHO, WHAT, WHY", including Acceptance Criteria.Support functional workstream members on requirements definition and planning when required.Carry out project tasks as assigned by the Global Process Owner Finance to ensure successful delivery of transformation objectives.What can you expect from Mars?Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus

title: SEO Specialist
job_description: At Definitive Healthcare, our passion is to transform data, analytics and expertise into healthcare commercial intelligence. We help clients uncover the right markets, opportunities and people, so they can shape tomorrow’s healthcare industry. Our SaaS platform creates new paths to commercial success in the healthcare market, so companies can identify where to go next.Our employees are kind, collaborative, energetic, approachable and driven. On top of that, we value the unique perspectives, backgrounds and voices of our employees. Why? Because their diverse experiences drive new ideas and help us build a better community.For over 10 years, we’ve built a collaborative culture driven by employees who share a passion for improving the healthcare ecosystem, enjoy giving back to the local community and value diversity and inclusion.One of the hallmarks of our culture is our commitment to community service. Through the DefinitiveCares program, employees can work with their choice of more than 40 charitable organizations, supporting causes from hunger and homelessness to healthcare, LGBTQ+ issues, racial justice, women’s initiatives and more. 2021 marked the sixth year that we had 100% employee participation in DefinitiveCares.We also provide a range of opportunities for employees to connect with each other. Employees can join any of our employee run affinity groups supporting causes such as women’s empowerment, LGBTQ+, Black, indigenous and people of color (BIPOC), disabilities and working parents and potential for many more. Affinity groups often enable greater education companywide through training, events and speaker series.We’re also a great place to work. For five years in a row, we’ve been recognized by the Boston Business Journal and the Boston Globe as a best place to work in Massachusetts. In 2022, Energage recognized us for Culture Excellence in Compensation & Benefits, Innovation, Great Leadership, Purpose & Value and Work-Life Flexibility!Think you’d be a good addition to our team? Explore our available positions here. We’d love the chance to get to know you.Your Challenge: In this role, you will report to the Sr. Director of Digital Marketing & Operations and with a dotted line to the Senior Digital Marketing Specialist. You will be responsible for implementing effective SEO strategies and optimizing the website for conversion rate. You’ll also gather and analyze marketing data across all channels, identify the most significant areas for conversion improvements, and work cross-functionally to implement strategies to capitalize on these opportunities with other members of the organization. We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about delivering insights that drive business decisions. Here are some things you will tackle: Work with Sr. Director of Digital Marketing & Operations Director and Senior Digital Marketing Specialist to manage and report on the performance of SEO channel. Stay on top of keyword research and make structural and keyword recommendations to maximize SEO efforts across all web properties and content. Work with the content writers to optimize the website content for SEO and manage the relationship with external writers. Keep track of competitors and their performance on search channels. Audit the website for technical SEO issues and work with the website team to fix the errors. Also perform QA steps for website releases. Gather and analyze marketing data to develop insights, make recommendations on areas for optimization, and report on findings from A/B test data.   Execute A/B testing and landing page and website optimizations to align with development plans for the website.   Proactively communicate with peers and leadership on plans, progress, and problems. What you'll need: 1-2 years of experience in digital marketing or related field (SEO agency experience preferred). Strong understanding of SEO techniques: keyword research, on page and off page optimization, backlinking, page speed, header tags, and Google search console. Strong analytical skills and interest in reporting and data analysis to extract meaning and present recommended actions; experience with statistical analysis is a plus.   Strong experience using Microsoft Excel to manage and analyze data.   Experience using SEO tools Ahrefs, Moz, SEMRush, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, or other digital tools are a plus.  HTML5/CSS3 experience is a plusOutstanding verbal and written communication skills when working with teammates who may be either data-driven or more qualitative.   Detail-oriented, persistent, and curious.  Ability and desire to learn quickly and troubleshoot problems.   Ability to work independently while also functioning and contributing as part of a team.   Four-year college degree or equivalent experience. Why we love Definitive, and why you will too!Industry leading productsWork hard, and have fun doing itIncredibly fast growth means limitless opportunityFlexible and dynamic cultureWork alongside some of the most talented and dedicated teammatesDefinitive Cares, our community service group, gives all of us a chance to give backCompetitive benefits package including great healthcare benefits and a 401(k) matchWhat our Employees are saying about us on Glassdoor: “Great Work atmosphere, great work life balance, excellent company to work for, amazing top notch product, incredible customer service, lots of tools to help you succeed.”Business Development Manager“Great team. Amazing growth. Employees are treated very well.”Research Analyst“I have waited 36 years to work at a dream job for a dream company and I am so happy to have finally got there.”Profile AnalystIf you don’t fit all of these qualifications, but believe you’re still a great fit, feel free to apply and tell us why in your cover letter.If you are a California, Colorado, New York City or Washington resident and this role is a remote role, you can receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.Definitive Hiring PhilosophyDefinitive Healthcare is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with equal opportunity for all applicants and teammates. title: Senior VBC Consulting Data Analyst (remote)
job_description: About Our CompanyVytalize Health is a leading value-based care platform. It helps independent physicians and practices stay ahead in a rapidly changing healthcare system by strengthening relationships with their patients through data-driven, holistic, and personalized care. Vytalize provides an all-in-one solution, including value-based incentives, smart technology, and a virtual clinic that enables independent practices to succeed in value-based care arrangements. Vytalize's care delivery model transforms the healthcare experience for more than 250,000+ Medicare beneficiaries across 36 states by helping them manage their chronic conditions in collaboration with their doctors.About our Growth Vytalize Health has grown its patient base over 100% year-over-year and is now partnered with over 1,000 providers across 36-states. Our all-in-one, vertically integrated solution for value-based care delivery is responsible for $2 billion in medical spending. We are expanding into new markets while increasing the concentration of practices in existing ones.Visit www.vytalizehealth.com for more information.Why you will love working hereWe are an employee first, mission driven company that cares deeply about solving challenges in the healthcare space. We are open, collaborative and want to enhance how physicians interact with, and treat their patients. Our rapid growth means that we value working together as a team. You will be recognized and appreciated for your curiosity, tenacity and ability to challenge the status quo; approaching problems with an optimistic attitude. We are a diverse team of physicians, technologists, MBAs, nurses, and operators. You will be making a massive impact on people's lives and ultimately feel like you are doing your best work here at Vytalize.Your OpportunityAs a Senior Consulting Analyst, your principal purpose is to generate business value for Vytalize by combining your deep expertise in actuarial analytics and value-based care to work closely with business stakeholders to create competitively differentiated insights, that are actionable to drive shared healthcare cost savings for Vytalize and its provider and payer customers.  You serve as a trusted business advisor who is highly effective at collaborating cross-functionally with stakeholders at all levels.  One of your strengths is the ability to translate your customers' business questions and objectives into actionable data-driven information and recommendations. Examples of the insights include leveraging risk adjustment data to improve preventative care, chronic disease management, patient engagement strategies, optimize referral networks, and predict future healthcare needs, as well as actuarial analysis for cost and use opportunity identification and forecasting savings from different initiatives.What You Will DoWork closely with business stakeholders to translate business questions and objectives into actionable data-driven information and recommendations that drive the business and customer goals Develop and execute analytics that identify and quantify actionable opportunities to impact shared savings, and measure the results of actions taken by business customers to realize those opportunities  Provide strategic guidance and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders using analytically generated insights aligned with Vytalize's strategic priorities, goals, and objectives  Develop and maintain strong business relationships with customers and stakeholders across departments and external to the organization, that are founded on trust, reinforced by transparent and ongoing communication, and maintained by delivery of value  Translate customers' business questions into analysis plans and analytical results into meaningful recommendations for action  Employ advanced statistical and computational methods to extract actionable insights from complex datasets to optimize business performance  Contribute to the growth of a data-driven culture by promoting data literacy and fluency—the ability to read, work with and communicate effectively about data, analytics and insights—across the organization  Work in a fast-paced startup environmentWhat will make you successful here Master's degree in Analytics, Business Administration, Finance, Healthcare Administration, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field required  Minimum of seven (7) years of experience in complex data analysis for health systems, healthcare providers, healthcare payers, managed care organizations, and/or accountable care organizations, that includes the continuum of analytics: descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive   Subject matter expertise in Provider Network or Risk Adjustment in the context of value-based care requiredStrong SQL experience requiredMicrosoft suite of tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) experience requiredTableau or similar experience preferredPython experience preferredExperience working closely with business stakeholders to understand their goals and needs and translate them into actionable and measurable data-driven insights to help drive company and customer performance Experience in health and healthcare data and analytics required  Experience with Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) accountable care models: Medicare Shared Savings Program (MSSP) and Accountable Care Organization Realizing Equity, Access and Community Health (ACO REACH) modelsProven track record of leveraging data and analytics to inform and drive clinical and financial outcomes in healthcare  Passion for leveraging data and analytics to drive innovation and organizational success in healthcare Occasional travel may be required based on business needs Perks/BenefitsCompetitive base compensationAnnual bonus potential Health benefits effective on start date; 100% coverage for base plan, up to 90% coverage on all other plans for individuals and familiesHealth & Wellness Program; up to $300 per quarter for your overall wellbeing401K plan effective on the first of the month after your start date; 100% of up to 4% of your annual salaryCompany paid STD/LTDUnlimited (or generous) paid "Vytal Time", and 5 paid sick days after your first 90 daysTechnology setupAbility to help build a market leader in value-based healthcare at a rapidly growing organizationWe are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.Please note at no time during our screening, interview, or selection process do we ask for additional personal information (beyond your resume) or account/financial information. We will also never ask for you to purchase anything; nor will we ever interview you via text message. Any communication received from a Vytalize Health recruiter during your screening, interviewing, or selection process will come from an email ending in @vytalizehealth.com

title: Senior Tax Analyst -- Remote -- WFH --
job_description: We are committed to delivering innovative solutions that address the complex challenges faced by our customers. As a responsible corporate citizen, we prioritize safety, sustainability, and environmental stewardship in all aspects of our operations. Our talented and diverse workforce is at the heart of our success. At the company, we believe in creating an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives and talents. By putting people at the center of our operations, we build strong connections, nurture innovation, and create a fulfilling work experience for all.About This Role And About YouAs the Senior Tax Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in supporting current and evolving U.S. tax compliance requirements, tax audit defense, consolidated tax accounting, financial reporting, and global tax operations. You will work closely with all members of the Canadian and US tax teams.Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience in a large, complex, multi-national company or major accounting firm, including at least three years of corporate tax experience at a major accounting firm. CPA designation or in-progress pursuit of CPA designation preferred. In-depth knowledge in corporate taxation and tax accounting is required. Knowledge in international tax, US tax, transfer pricing, and sales & use tax are assets. Bachelor's degree required, advanced degree (MAcc, MTax, MBA) is an asset. Experience with Longview Tax, SAP, Taxprep, Taxforms, Taxnetpro is an asset. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to evaluate, analyze, and prioritize work under tight timelines. Team player with excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.ResponsibilitiesTax Compliance: Support the preparation of US tax returns if needed. Ensure accurate and timely review and filing of all U.S. Federal and State tax returns and information returns. Review quarterly Federal and State estimates and annual filing extensions. Assist with preparing or reviewing periodic indirect tax calculations. Assist with remitting all direct and indirect tax payments to taxing authorities. Assist with maintenance and filing of business tax licenses. Maintain adequate sales tax exemption documentation. Assist the business in research of all tax matters.Tax Accounting Prepare or review quarterly tax provision and related note disclosures. Assist in analyzing deferred tax recognition and tax contingencies. Assist in forecasting tax rate and cash taxes. Prepare and record tax journal entries. Reconciliation and true up of tax accrual account balances.Tax Audit Support Ensure maintenance of audit-ready working papers. Support income, sales & use, and property tax audit defense in U.S. Assist with global audits where necessary.Tax Operations And Projects Play a key role in process improvement, process automation, and technology implementation. Assist with non-routine tax or business-initiated transactions or projects. Assist with monitoring and maintaining income tax and indirect rates in various financial systems. Drive knowledge sharing and cross-training efforts. Participate in special projects/adhoc reporting as requested.What The Company Offers YouWe are committed to cultivating a work environment that embraces and values the unique qualities of every employee. Our vision is to create a workplace where all individuals feel respected, empowered, and inspired to contribute their experiences, ideas, and perspectives.At the company, we celebrate multiple approaches and viewpoints. To foster an inclusive environment, we actively encourage the creation of Employee Resource Groups. These groups provide platforms for employees to share their unique perspectives, contribute their ideas, and help shape our inclusive culture.We recognize that the diversity of our employees is paramount to our organization's success. Join us in our journey towards building an inclusive workplace that values diversity and promotes the personal and professional development of our employees.Employment Type: Full-Time
