title: Business Analyst
job_description: WHO WE AREWe are a leading supplier of methacrylate chemistry. As a global company, Röhm employs 3,500 employees across four continents. Our broad product portfolio includes the world-renowned PLEXIGLAS® brand (in the Americas registered under the trademark ACRYLITE®) and its key raw material methyl methacrylate, which we manufacture in a global production network. Our products supply growth markets such as the automotive, electronics and construction industries.Röhm is committed to operating with social responsibility, and sustainability forms an integral part of our business strategy. We view our employees as our strength, and we value diversity and inclusion. If you thrive in an environment where individual contributions are both visible and recognized, Röhm may be right for you.WHAT THE ROLE DELIVERSThe purpose of the Business Analyst role is to support both the strategic and operational aspects of the business unit through effective data management. On an operational level, the Business Analyst will be expected to ensure the data accuracy of pricing, forecasting, and reporting. On a strategic level, the Business Analyst will be expected to support projects such as the maintenance of the market database and the implementation of special projects. The ideal candidate will be able to make improvements to these processes. Expert experience with Excel and associated applications such as Power Query Editor and Power BI will be important to success in this role.WHAT YOU WILL DOThe Business Analyst will work internally with the Sales team, Customer Service, Finance, and Supply Chain/Logistics. The Business Analyst will also work with the Global Marketing team. Externally, the Business Analyst will work with data providers for raw material prices and import data. The position will also work closely with our sample distribution partner to maintain inventory levels and follow-up on sample requests.· Data collection for formula prices and the update of formula prices monthly.· Accurate monthly update of all prices in SAP.· Prepare the required data for an effective forecast review with Sales and provide a monthly forecast for BM.· Generate sales reports when necessary to support Sales and business decisions.· Collect, scrub, and summarize import data to provide an accurate picture of BM trade in RAM.· Analyze pricing on a quarterly basis and conduct a review with Sales to ensure pricing consistency.· Manage the sample process and relationship with our sample shipping service.· Manage and maintain the yearly review of market data.· Identify opportunities for process improvements in pricing, forecasting, and other tasks.· Participate in special projects to improve business performance such as the launch of a customer portal, improved shipment tracking, and the development and analysis of customer surveys.WHAT WE ARE SEEKING· Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a technical field.· 2-5 years of chemical industry experience, familiarity, and interest.· In-depth knowledge of Excel and SAP functions including Power Query Editor and Power BI.· Experience analyzing data from a CRM platform.WHAT WE OFFERYou can find an overview of our benefits on our careers page.YOUR APPLICATIONSounds interesting? Learn more about us and apply here: https://www.roehm.com/en/career. Realize your dreams at Röhm!Röhm actively strives to find the most qualified candidates, and takes pride in being an equal opportunity employer. Our goal is to foster a workplace where talent and skills are the only criteria for employment, and where diversity is valued and respected.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Interested in a Business Analyst role for a Fortune 100 Financial company in Jersey City, NJ? Robert Half's reputable client is soon beginning interviews for this role! JOB DESCRIPTIONThe Cash, FX and Liquidity Change Management Team operate within the Securities Services business and are based in the US and UK. Our purpose is to support the Cash, FX and Liquidly Product teams to develop the cash target operating model for enhanced operational and cost efficiency. Provide a resilient operation that can quickly recover from market or system incidents. Improve the client experience and provide a centralized change function with consistent and robust frameworks to progress the change agenda.This role is centered around the On and Off-Balance Sheet Liquidity Product. Liquidity products are an integrated part of the Securities Services product offering and are used to support client’s investment activity. title: Business Analyst
job_description: Position: Senior Business AnalystLocation: Paramus, NJDuration:11 Months (Right to Hire)We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support the re-implementation of our Customer Portal Website within an accelerated time frame. Your job description may include the following responsibilitiesRequirements Gathering and Prioritization: Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and developers, to understand their needs and gather requirements for the new website. Prioritize requirements based on their impact on project duration and business value.Business Process Analysis and Optimization: Analyze existing business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization in the new system. Streamline processes to reduce project duration and increase efficiency.Documentation and Communication: Create detailed documentation, including functional specifications, user stories, use cases, and process flows, to communicate requirements effectively to the development team. Ensure clear and concise communication to minimize misunderstandings and rework.Stakeholder Management and Collaboration: Facilitate communication and collaboration between business users, project managers, and development teams to ensure alignment and understanding of project goals and requirements. Proactively address any conflicts or issues that may arise to minimize delays.Solution Design and Technical Guidance: Work closely with the development team to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that the new website meets the needs of the business and its users. Provide technical guidance and expertise to expedite the development process.Testing and Quality Assurance Strategy: Collaborate with the testing team to define test cases and scenarios, ensuring that the new website meets the specified requirements and functions as expected. Develop a comprehensive testing and quality assurance strategy to minimize defects and rework.Change Management and Training: Support the change management process by assisting with user training, documentation updates, and communication of system changes to stakeholders. Ensure a smooth transition and adoption of the new website to minimize disruptions.Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Identify potential risks and issues that may impact the project's duration and success. Work with the project team to develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize delays and ensure timely delivery.Continuous Improvement and Agile Practices: Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in web development and customer portal solutions. Implement agile practices and methodologies to increase project efficiency and adaptability.Mentoring and Support: Provide guidance and support to junior business analysts and other team members, sharing your expertise and knowledge to help them grow their skills. Foster a collaborative and supportive environment to maximize productivity and minimize project duration.Education / Experience / Background:Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration.Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in web development or software implementation projects.Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.Solid understanding of software development methodologies, including Agile practices.Experience with Drupal or similar content management systems is highly desirableGood experience in using industry-standard design and work management tools such as Jira, Google Docs, Lucid Chart, etc…Knowledge of utility industry processes and customer portal solutions is a plus.Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to guide and support junior team members.Experience in working with vendors (onshore and/or offshore)

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: Join our team and become a part of something bigger - a force for change in the fight against hunger. The Community FoodBank of New Jersey is more than just a food bank - we champion healthier lifestyles and positively impact social and economic change. Together we can create a stronger, more resilient New Jersey for everyone!    As a Senior Business Analyst, you will use your expertise in systems analysis and solution design to support the delivery of technology initiatives across the organization: Which includes but is not limited to Operations, Network Relations, Programs, Development and Finance.  This role is focused on systems and applications at the enterprise level and requires sharp skills in requirements gathering, process mapping, critical thinking, and problem-solving.  What you'll do in your role: Gather and write business requirements for assigned business units, diagraming current and future state process.Translate business needs into key functional documentation; Create and deliver appropriate training, and communication around discoveriesDevelop recommendations and strategic approaches based on key findings, anticipating and communicating risks.Build and executing test plans of changes and new development including but not limited to: creating test scenarios, execution of unit testing, integration testing and user acceptance testingFor defined initiatives, function as project manager including planning, discovery, development, testing, refinement, and deployment of technical solutions.  Why you'll love working at CFBNJ: Opportunity for impact: Last year we provided over 90 million nutritious meals across New Jersey and educated over 25,000 people about health and nutrition.Balance: Generous time off, 14 paid holidays, childcare resources, and organization-wide engagement days. Financial Wellness: 401k with 4% company match after 1 year. Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision and Wellness Programs. Recognition and Certifications: Learning opportunities, tuition and certificate reimbursement, and engagement with our reward and recognition program, Bonusly! What you'll need to be successful in this role: 5 + years experience in a Business Analyst role.Bachelor's degree in a business, technical, scientific or related discipline with a minimum of five (5) years of experience.Experience with systems development life cycle activities to manage, plan, design, implement, test and deliver information systems and strategies.Experience leading the systems solutions discussions and extracting and documenting data infrastructure requirements.Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.Ability to develop relationships with stakeholders and to understand their needs through excellent listening and effective written and verbal communication. CFBNJ is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to complying with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on  race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, marital status, domestic partnership or civil union status, pregnancy or breastfeeding, disability, being a victim of domestic violence, status in the uniformed services of the United States (including veteran status), record of arrest, as well as any other category protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: CIAM Business Analyst
job_description: Senior Business Systems Analyst Are you interested in building capabilities that enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability and efficiency? The Global Technology team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA! When you join our organization, you'll unlock an exciting and impactful career all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world's leading financial services institutions. Your Team As a Senior Business Systems Analyst working in a Global Identity & Access Management (IAM) Team you will partner with product owners, tech leads, designers, engineers and delivery professionals to act as the primary interface between Technology and specific business areas, identifying business unit requirements, creating project and process specifications, coordinating with project teams, and ensuring adherence to schedules and budgets to solve sophisticated business problems, deploy innovative products, services and experiences to delight our customers! In addition to applied analytical and technical experience, you will bring excellent problem solving, communication and teamwork skills, along with agile ways of working, strong business insight, an inclusive leadership attitude and a continuous learning focus to all that you do. Here is What You Can Expect on a Typical Day  Support the Director Business Systems Analyst and Product Owner setting ambitious and clear product vision, and communicating 'the story' effectively to key stakeholders and the rest of the team Beginning to identify opportunities to provide input to the team & coach others with occasional guidance Works on solving extremely complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables  Collaborate with product owners in understanding needs and defining feature stories, tech leads in defining technical design and other team members to understand the system end-to-end and deliver robust solutions that bring about business impact  Work on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables and may impact future concepts, products or technologies  Works on extremely complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of often complex variables related to technology and/or data. Exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Own the end-to-end product strategy from inception and determine business value once solution enters production  Ensure alignment of product features and stories, i.e., review, give feedback, and prioritize user stories in line with product vision  Understands the vision and owns aspects of the product management/roadmap activities Skills The Skills & Expertise You Bring   Bachelor of Computer Science or Engineering; Analytics or experience in related fields Experience with agile development methodologies and Test-Driven Development (TDD)  Knowledge of business concepts, tools and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business  Ability to learn new skills and knowledge on an on-going basis through self-initiative and tackling challenges  Excellent problem solving, communication and collaboration skills  Applied experience and/or expertise with several of the following: Project/Product Management: Planning, Progress Monitoring and Status Reporting, including visualization of works; Scaling Agile Organizing, synchronizing multiple teams setup Estimations, ROI, project life cycle  Effective Communication: Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors. Ability to facilitate dialogue at the right level of detail for all members of the Agile team.  Decision-Making & Critical Thinking : Knowledge of the decision-making process and associated tools and techniques; ability to accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment.  Business Acumen: Knowledge of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.  Interpersonal Relationships: Knowledge of the techniques and the ability to work with a variety of individuals and groups in a constructive and collaborative manner. Ability to work seamlessly with business partners and software developers alike in a liaison role.  Financial Acumen : Knowledge of understanding of financial concepts, tools and processes and how financial metrics are used to monitor and drive outcomes. Includes understanding of company accounts/metrics (ex: balance sheet, profit/loss, cash flow, budget & forecast).  Analytical Thinking : Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis; ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve these problems.  You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Join a team and culture where your voice matters; where every day, your work transforms our experiences to make lives better. As you put your skills to use, we'll help you make an even bigger impact with learning experiences that can grow your technical AND leadership capabilities. You'll be surprised by what this rock-solid organization has in store for you.

title: Shortage Business Analyst
job_description: LOCATION 1830 Route 130 North Burlington NJ US 08016OverviewThe Shortage Business Analyst will support the Director of Shortage Analysis in leveraging internal and external data to understand the drivers of merchandise shortage across the company. They will be a subject matter expert in measuring the impact of investments to reduce shortage and a key contributor to determining how best to allocate resources to reduce shortage.The Shortage Business Analyst will maintain a database of all shortage focused projects and track their expected and realized impact. They will be responsible for analyzing the impact of initiatives as well as other shortage trends to develop actionable insights. They will also help inform testing setups and ROI calculation for shortage initiatives.The Analyst will support the Director in preparing to present shortage trends and findings following each inventory cycle. They will schedule and organize the applicable executive meetings and coordinate with cross-functional partners to organize materials. They will also prepare materials to communicate their findings in a clear and actionable manner to executive leadership.A Day In The Life:Maintain a database of all shortage focused initiatives. Track and measure the targeted and actual impact of each initiative over time.Perform analysis on shortage trends and opportunities to identify actionable insights and address executive questions on shortage drivers.Develop materials for post-PI executive results meetings to clearly communicate new trends and learnings following each inventory cycle.Schedule and support post-PI executive results meetings administratively.Act as a subject matter expert of the impact of shortage initiatives, consulting on testing and rollout proposals, capital requests and any other areas needed.You'll Come With:Education: Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a STEM or data driven field. Training in data science preferred.2-5 years of experience in data analytics. Retail experience preferred.Experience in using multiple data sources to model complex business situations.Passion for data, analytics and pushing business innovation.Experience organizing, tracking, and monitoring the progress of complex initiatives.Strong written and verbal communication with emphasis on strong inter-personal skills.Experience working with multiple levels of management and in cross-functional environments.Proven ability to work independently to drive projects to completion.Retail experience with shortage focus preferred.Expert Excel skills. Proficient with PowerPoint.This position is a hybrid role & candidates must be able to be onsite in Burlington, NJ. Scope and Impact:Accountable for tracking, measuring, and reporting the impact of shortage reduction initiatives.Responsible for analyzing shortage trends and performing ad hoc analyses to understand the drivers of shortage.Responsible for consulting on testing and ROI forecasting to be used for shortage investments.This position has a significant role in ensuring executive leadership is informed of shortage trends and opportunities and that investments in shortage are data driven.Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!You will enjoy a competitive wage, flexible hours, and an associate discount. Burlington’s benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage including life and disability insurance. Full time associates are also eligible for paid time off, paid holidays and a 401(k) plan.We are a rapidly growing brand, and provide a variety of training and development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. Our teams work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.\\Posting Number 2024-218515Location US-NJ-BurlingtonAddress 1830 Route 130 NorthZip Code 08016Workplace Type HybridPosition Type Regular Full-TimeCareer Site Category CorporatePosition Category FinanceEvergreen YesMin USD $65,000.00/AnnualMid USD $80,000.00/Annual

title: Senior Business Analyst with Drupal
job_description: Our Utility Client in Paramus NJ is looking for a 6-12+month RTH for a Senior Business Analyst with Drupal experience. This is an onsite or hybrid role so need someone local who has an onsite presence.Manager notes:upgrade of our Drupal 7 Customer Self-Service Portal website to Drupal 10.I am looking for a Sr BA with strong experience in Web Content Management (Drupal would be ideal), who is curious about understanding the current features, and assist my current team in expressing the requirements to our technical partner who will be working on the technical upgrade/reimplementation. The role will cover the entire project duration, including testing, cutover, and subsequent phases. Note that this also includes assessing existing documentation (design, flows, integration, etc...)POSITION PURPOSE:We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support the reimplementation of our Customer Portal Website withinan accelerated timeframe. Your job description may include the following responsibilities:PRIMARY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Requirements Gathering and Prioritization:Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and developers, to understand their needs and gather requirements for the new website. Prioritize requirements based on their impact on project duration and business value.2. Business Process Analysis and Optimization:Analyze existing business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization in the new system. Streamline processes to reduce project duration and increase efficiency.3. Documentation and Communication:Create detailed documentation, including functional specifications, user stories, use cases, and process flows, to communicate requirements effectively to the development team. Ensure clear and concise communication to minimize misunderstandings and rework.4. Stakeholder Management and Collaboration:Facilitate communication and collaboration between business users, project managers, and development teams to ensure alignment and understanding of project goals and requirements. Proactively address any conflicts or issues that may arise to minimize delays.5. Solution Design and Technical Guidance:Work closely with the development team to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that the new website meets the needs of the business and its users. Provide technical guidance and expertise to expedite the development process.6. Testing and Quality Assurance Strategy:Collaborate with the testing team to define test cases and scenarios, ensuring that the new website meets the specified requirements and functions as expected. Develop a comprehensive testing and quality assurance strategy to minimize defects and rework.7. Change Management and Training:Support the change management process by assisting with user training, documentation updates, and communication of system changes to stakeholders. Ensure a smooth transition and adoption of the new website to minimize disruptions.8. Risk Assessment and Mitigation:Identify potential risks and issues that may impact the project's duration and success. Work with the project team to develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize delays and ensure timely delivery.9. Continuous Improvement and Agile Practices:Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in web development and customer portal solutions. Implement agile practices and methodologies to increase project efficiency and adaptability.10. Mentoring and Support:Provide guidance and support to junior business analysts and other team members, sharing your expertise and knowledge to help them grow their skills. Foster a collaborative and supportive environment to maximize productivity and minimize project duration.QUALIFICATIONS:● Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Systems, orBusiness Administration.● Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in web development or softwareimplementation projects.Knowledge / Skills / Abilities● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate businessrequirements into technical solutions.● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectivelywith stakeholders at all levels.● Solid understanding of software development methodologies, including Agile practices.● Strong sense of work organization allowing quick review of features with a high level ofattention to detail, ensuring documentation is complete and no functionality is overlooked● Experience with Drupal or similar Content Management Systems (CMS)● Good experience in using industry-standard design and work management tools such asJira, Google Docs, Lucid Chart, etc...● Knowledge of utility industry processes and customer portal solutions● Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.● Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to guide and support junior teammembers.● Experience in working with vendors (onshore and offshore)

title: Business Anlayst - ETL & Data Warehouse Solutions
job_description: As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 1,000 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Context We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to enhance the Systems and Process Solutions department of our client. The ideal candidate will possess a broad range of responsibilities encompassing functional/technical analysis, design, specification, qualification, and deployment of Systems and Process Solutions. Collaboration is key; you will work closely with the entire project team, including Project Management, Data Solution Architect, Business Analysts, Functional teams, and Downstream Applications, to ensure successful project execution.Key ResponsibilitiesCoordinate studies with the Business/sponsor.Elicit and analyze business requirements and processes.Ensure clear definition and validation of requirements.Conduct data assessment, gap analysis, and remediation.Develop solutions meeting all requirements.Generate technical/functional specifications consistent with solutions.Perform System Testing (SIT) and manage User Acceptance Testing (UAT).Act as the functional SME for the project.Assist Project Manager in execution, issue and risk management, project planning, and reporting.Preferred Experience, Qualifications, and SkillsProven experience in Business Analysis/Application Testing in Accounting or Financial systems within the Banking industry.Expertise in ETL/Datawarehouse solutions, Ledger/Financial Regulatory Reporting, Liquidity/Monitoring, Financial Risk solutions.Knowledge in complex financial products, technical accounting, financial processes, and various reporting types.Familiarity with US and Canadian Regulations is advantageous.Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.Results-driven and client-focused approach.

title: Business Analysis Senior Analyst
job_description: Are you ready to make an impact at DTCC? Do you want to work on innovative projects, collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team, and receive investment in your professional development? At DTCC, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial markets. We're committed to helping our employees grow and succeed. We believe that you have the skills and drive to make a real impact. We foster a thriving internal community and are committed to creating a workplace that looks like the world that we serve.Pay and Benefits: Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentiveComprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on locationPension / Retirement benefits Paid Time Off and Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day unique to each team or employee).   The impact you will have in this role:Being a member of the Enterprise Automation Team, the Senior Analyst will be the central point of contact between the automation configuration team and business process SMEs. This team works with the business units to gather and refine existing process documentation and conduct reviews with process SMEs to evaluate, prioritize, and build a roadmap for future process automation. In addition, the Business Analysis Senior Analyst will work closely with other areas of Business Architecture to identify areas for process optimization and re-engineering.Your Primary Responsibilities: Serve as the central point of contact between automation configuration team and business process SMEsGather and review existing process documentation with process SMEsAnalyze and clearly document business process requirements for the automation build including exception handling scenarios and process metrics such as volumes, SLAs, and cycle timesWork with business process SMEs to identify potential reengineering opportunities to streamline the use of automation (e.g., use of an application interface vs. a user screen)Work with configuration analysts in the collection and documentation of solution design requirementsDocument operational run books that describe the steps of the automated process and exception scenariosFacilitate user acceptance testing and support remediation of production defectsRecord and communicate defects identified by the business in user acceptance testingDeliver training to the business process SMEs and their teams on performing the new process using automationAlign risk and control processes into day to day responsibilities to monitor and mitigate risk  **NOTE: The Primary Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above. **Qualifications: Minimum 3 years of related experienceBachelor's degree (preferred) or equivalent experience   Talents Needed For Success:  Experience with business/system analysis and requirements documentationExperience/knowledge of JIRA and ability to organize business and functional requirements into EPIC, stories and maintain product backlog Ability to describe non-technical details to a technical audienceProficiency with Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, Project)Awareness of automation design and development considerations including Agile methodologiesExperience in banking, capital markets, or financial operations preferredAwareness about projects with API development, data migration, integration with external systems   We offer top class training and development for you to be an asset in our organization!The salary range is indicative for roles at the same level within DTCC across all US locations. Actual salary is determined based on the role, location, individual experience, skills, and other considerations. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Industries: Financial Services, Banking, and Capital Markets

title: Trading Product Owner and Business Analyst
job_description: Trading Product Owner and Business AnalystWhippany, NJAs a Barclays Trading Product Owner and Business Analyst, you will work with the business stakeholders, operations users, controls team, technology teams, User Acceptance Testing manager and all other stakeholders to understand current business process and work to design Target Operating Model and associated requirements documentation for Wholesale Lending migration to Loan IQ platform.Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, established in 1690, with a legacy of success, quality, and innovation. We've helped millions of individuals and businesses thrive, creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. An important and growing presence in the USA, we offer careers providing endless opportunity.At Barclays, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.What will you be doing?• Serving as Product Owner, leveraging extensive SME skills in Wholesale Lending and Loan IQ• Informing & Supporting Target Operating Model processes and focusing on objectives to Simplify, Standardise and Automate and drive out recommendations • Supporting all governance activities to ensure robust planning, scheduling, documentation and sign-offs are delivered• Collaborating and liaising with stakeholders including tech/ops partners and drive the documentation of business requirements, process flows, current vs future gap analysis• Ensuring all target processes are defined with a view to ensure robust controls are in place and ensure engagement with Controls and Rigour teams• Managing process mapping teams have relevant inputs to drive required documentation• Preparing any required sign-off from stakeholders on various future state design decisions and Go/No Go decisionsWhat we’re looking for:• Exceptional ability to drive strategic Business process design, associated workflow and documentation• Proven knowledge and understanding of Corporate and IB Lending processes and procedures• Experience of tools for documentation including JIRA and Confluence• Ability to manage teams to deliver project outcomesSkills that will help you in the role:• Lending/Servicing knowledge across all debt products• Experience of using Loan IQ and using Agile project management would be preferred• Experience of working in a Corporate/Investment Banking/consulting• Knowledge & experience working closely with IT, Transformation & Change areaWhere will you be working?Our next-generation workplace in Whippany allows talented, passionate, down-to-earth colleagues to connect daily. With state-of-the-art work facilities and many added features like pool tables, cafés and a gym – it’s a place you can call home. Our office is minutes away from Morristown, known for its rich history and lively modern spirit. With bustling Manhattan easily accessible and a picturesque landscape here on the doorstep, Whippany really does offer the best of both worlds.#LI-Hybrid

title: Senior Business Management Analyst
job_description: Work Location:Mount Laurel, New JerseyHours40Pay Details68,640 - 102,960 USDTD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. The included salary range for this role takes into account multiple factors that are considered in making compensation decisions. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, licensure and certifications, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs. As TD puts career development at the forefront of our colleague experience, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role.As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.Line Of BusinessBusiness Management, Strategy & SupportJob DescriptionUndergraduate degree5 + years relevant experienceWho We AreTD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.Our Total Rewards PackageOur Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes base salary and variable compensation/incentive awards (e.g., eligibility for cash and/or equity incentive awards, generally through participation in an incentive plan) and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off (including Vacation PTO, Flex PTO, and Holiday PTO), banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition. Learn moreAdditional InformationWe’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.Colleague Development If you’re interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.Training & OnboardingWe will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.Interview Process We’ll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.AccommodationIf you are an applicant with a disability and need accommodations to complete the application process, email the TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com. Include your full name, best way to reach you, and the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Sr. Business and Data Analyst - Vice President
job_description: Join the Mizuho team as a Senior Business and Data Analyst!Mizuho Americas LLC is seeking curious minds to join our data warehouse sourcing and analytics team in the role of Sr. Business and Data Analyst to collaborate with various IT and business stakeholders, including but not limited to Risk, Finance, Regulatory Reporting. In this role, the successful candidate will be expected to take a lead role in gathering business and data requirements for impact assessment and population into our Enterprise data warehouse. You will work as part of a team to understand patterns of data as they apply to a variety of MUSO Banking and Securities products, develop source to target mapping specifications for use by developers, and execute test plans to identify inconsistencies between our source systems and target warehouse objects. Additionally, the ideal candidate will collaborate under agile project methodology, participate in daily scrum meetings, sprint planning and actively participate in other Agile Ceremonies.Sr. Business and Data Analyst Job ResponsibilitiesDevelop strong value-added relationships with business partners across multiple domains – risk, finance, regulatory reporting, and other IT groups.Demonstrate leadership characteristics, be a passionate, motivated self-starter and an ardent team player with sense of urgency and proactivity in meeting stakeholder expectations.Act as an SME in understanding source system data attribution for alignment to data warehouse target state transactional and analytic models.Apply proven experience in eliciting and validating business requirements and data/interface specifications as applied to MUSO product data constructs and solutions.Conduct business/data analysis and research to validate new requirements and identify patterns and inconsistencies of data across sources and targets as relevant to the underlying product behaviors.Conduct data mining of transactional and reference data for mapping of source system data attributes to target destination, including transformation specifications for implementation conforming to the platform standards and best practices.Lead and drive culture of maintaining evergreen documentation of the strategic platform with respect to MUSO Bank products including but not limited to documenting meeting minutes, mapping of current and target state business processes, and Standard Operating Procedures to ensure consistency and transparency of effort.Actively participate in Agile processes for successful project executionConstantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer.Business/ Data Analyst Job QualificationsBachelor's degree in business administration, Finance, or related field5+ years of progressive experience in a Lead Business or Data Analyst role with strong data analysis in a large-scale Banking or Finance industrySME level familiarity with Investment Banking products and related subject areas from a data attribution level: Derivatives (OTC (Over The Counter), Fixed Income), Finance (Repos, Reverse Repos), Cash, Loans, Commitments, and related products like Collateral is a MUSTStrong exposure to a Regulatory Reporting data environment is a plus.Effective communication, collaboration, analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skillsHighly self-motivated, goal oriented and proactiveStrong documentation and specification writingUnderstanding of Database Design concepts – Dimensional modelling is a huge plusHands on, strong data querying skills to support finance product data analysis and mining efforts involving large sets of data from multiple sources, preferably in a Cloud first environment, is a plus.Programming languages such as SQL, Snow SQL,Proficiency in understanding database design principles and product, reference data strategic models is a plus. Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, to be used for End-User reports will be a plus.Familiarity/experience with Snowflake data warehouse environments (Snow SQL) is a plus.Data visualization and data analysis experience is a plus (Power Bi, Tableau)Experience with project management tools such as Jira, and ConfluenceProven experience in eliciting requirements and testingExperience in analyzing data to draw relevant business, reporting specific conclusions.Knowledge in generating process documentation (UML Sequence diagrams) is also a plus.The expected base salary ranges from $101k-$180k. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications and licenses obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.Other RequirementsMizuho has in place a hybrid working program, with varying opportunities for remote work depending on the nature of the role, needs of your department, as well as local laws and regulatory obligations.Company OverviewMizuho Financial Group, Inc. is the 15th largest bank in the world as measured by total assets of ~$2 trillion. Mizuho's 60,000 employees worldwide offer comprehensive financial services to clients in 35 countries and 800 offices throughout the Americas, EMEA and Asia. Mizuho Americas is a leading provider of corporate and investment banking services to clients in the US, Canada, and Latin America. Through its acquisition of Greenhill , Mizuho provides M&A, restructuring and private capital advisory capabilities across Americas, Europe and Asia. Mizuho Americas employs approximately 3,500 professionals, and its capabilities span corporate and investment banking, capital markets, equity and fixed income sales & trading, derivatives, FX, custody and research. Visit www.mizuhoamericas.com.Mizuho Americas offers a competitive total rewards package.We are an EEO/AA Employer - M/F/Disability/Veteran.We participate in the E-Verify program.We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

title: Business Analyst, Manager
job_description: Company DescriptionLinusBio is a patient-centric, precision exposome medicine company headquartered in New Brunswick, NJ. Originating from the world’s leading exposome laboratory at Mount Sinai Health System, Linus has developed a technology platform that builds on breakthroughs in exposome sequencing. The Company’s program pipeline comprises precision exposome medicine biomarkers and target discovery across disease domains for which historically no molecular endpoints have been available in medical practice or for clinical trials, including CNS (autism spectrum disorder, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis), gastroenterology (inflammatory bowel disease), renal disease and oncology.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in driving business growth by leveraging data-driven insights to inform strategic decision-making and optimize commercial operations. The individual will report into the Commercial Analytics team and will support sales, marketing, market research, market access, medical affairs and customer support.  This role involves analyzing sales performance, customer behavior, and marketing effectiveness to identify opportunities, define KPIs, and develop actionable recommendations to increase revenue generation and improve product commercialization, customer engagement, and market share. With a focus on continuous improvement, the Business Analyst collaborates cross-functionally to align sales and marketing initiatives with organizational goals and drive sustainable business success.ResponsibilitiesTogether with the Director of Commercial Analytics, design the commercial analytics function for the company, including developing an overall analytics strategy, building out the infrastructure required with the Engineering team, and identifying KPI’s for all commercial functions. Analyze sales and marketing performance data, customer feedback, and market insights to assess the effectiveness of commercial strategies and identify areas for improvement.Support in the development of financial models, forecasts, and business cases to evaluate the financial viability of new product offerings and strategic alliances.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, customer support, market access, and medical affairs, to develop and implement commercial strategies aligned with company objectives.Provide actionable insights and recommendations to senior management based on data-driven analysis and market intelligence.Collaborate with marketing manager(s) on in-depth primary market research and analysis to support the product brand(s).Support the development of pricing strategies, promotional campaigns, and sales forecasts to maximize revenue and gross margins.Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of commercial initiatives and drive continuous improvement efforts.Uphold the company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.Adhere to company’s SOPs and policies as well as all relevant laws and regulations.Minimum EducationBachelor’s degree, preferably in business administration, finance, economics, engineering, computer or data science, computer information systems, or marketing.ExperienceProven track record as a business analyst, preferably with a diagnostic laboratory or healthcare company (life sciences, medical devices), interacting with health care providers and patientsWorking experience with Salesforce suite of products – Sales / CRM, Marketing, ServiceWorking experience with business intelligence software and developing dashboards, preferably in Tableau or Power Bi.Working experience managing and analyzing medical claims data.Working experience using marketing platforms to track campaign performances, such as Google Analytics, Marketo, Domo, Hubspot or others.Desirable AttributesProven experience in business analysis, market research, or strategic planning within the life sciences or diagnostic industry.Strong analytical skills with proficiency in financial modeling, market research, data analysis, and quantitative research methods.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distill complex information into clear and actionable insights, and executive presence to present to C-suite and Board of Directors.Strategic thinker with a proactive and results-oriented mindset, capable of driving projects forward and influencing decision-making at all levels of the organization.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with tight deadlines and evolving priorities.Knowledge of regulatory requirements, market access dynamics, and commercialization strategies in the life sciences and diagnostic industry is desirable.Understanding of Laboratory Developed Tests (LDTs) and the regulatory and compliance requirements in the title: Senior Business Analyst - HYBRID
job_description: Role: Senior Business AnalystLocation: Paramus, NJ locals preferred ( remote work allowed up to 3 days a week)Estimated Duration: 11 monthsWe are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support the reimplementation of our Customer Portal Website within an accelerated timeframe. Your job description may include the following responsibilities:Primary Duties / ResponsibilitiesRequirements Gathering and Prioritization:Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and developers, to understand their needs and gather requirements for the new website. Prioritize requirements based on their impact on project duration and business value.Business Process Analysis and Optimization:Analyze existing business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and optimization in the new system. Streamline processes to reduce project duration and increase efficiency.Documentation and Communication:Create detailed documentation, including functional specifications, user stories, use cases, and process flows, to communicate requirements effectively to the development team. Ensure clear and concise communication to minimize misunderstandings and rework.Stakeholder Management and Collaboration:Facilitate communication and collaboration between business users, project managers, and development teams to ensure alignment and understanding of project goals and requirements. Proactively address any conflicts or issues that may arise to minimize delays.Solution Design and Technical Guidance:Work closely with the development team to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring that the new website meets the needs of the business and its users. Ensure a smooth transition and adoption of the new website to minimize disruptions.Risk Assessment and Mitigation:Identify potential risks and issues that may impact the project's duration and success. Work with the project team to develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to minimize delays and ensure timely delivery.Continuous Improvement and Agile Practices:Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in web development and customer portal solutions. Implement agile practices and methodologies to increase project efficiency and adaptability.Mentoring and Support:Provide guidance and support to junior business analysts and other team members, sharing your expertise and knowledge to help them grow their skills. Foster a collaborative and supportive environment to maximize productivity and minimize project duration.QualificationsEducation / Experience / BackgroundBachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration. Knowledge / Skills / AbilitiesStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels. title: Business Analyst Specialist
job_description: We’re adding to our diverse team of experts and are looking to hire those who are committed to building a culture that enables the creation of innovative solutions for our business units and clients. As a leading reinsurer, we deal with the issues that affect business and society and work to devise risk management and risk transfer solutions that render tomorrow’s world insurable. Our recipe for success: we anticipate risks early on and deliver solutions tailored to our clients’ needs, creating opportunities to achieve sustained profitable growth.The OpportunityFuture focused and always one step aheadDesign, develop, and maintain metrics/reports/tools and other adhoc reports as requested in support of various Claims initiatives. Train Claims personnel on the proper use of customized metrics, reports and other tools and act as key expert resource on internal systems, such as FS-RI, BW, ICO BW, etc. as well as MS Office products, such as Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint.Prepare necessary analyses in support of the production of Claims’/BRO’s quarterly reporting.Manage and assemble key financial and claim information in support the quarterly Ultimate Estimate Report. Support Claims/BRO planning process as needed.Support the design, development, and maintenance of regulatory compliance reporting.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent prior experience3-5 years of insurance/reinsurance experience is strongly preferredWorking knowledge of MRAm’s data sources, especially the new systems (FS-RI, RMnL, BW, ICO BW)Strong working knowledge of insurance/reinsurance accounting, business structures, claim and actuarial practices Extensive experience in extracting and manipulating data for the purposes of analysis, report creation, and report automationStrong knowledge of Microsoft Office (especially Excel and Access)Desire to continue to pursue advancement of technical and analytical skillsExperience with contract and coverage interpretation preferredStrong analytical and problem solving skillsStrong interpersonal skillsStrong oral and written communication skillsAt Munich Re, we see Diversity, Equity and Inclusion as a solution to the challenges and opportunities all around us. Our goal is to foster an inclusive culture and build a workforce that reflects the customers we serve and the communities in which we live and work. title: CIAM Business Analyst
job_description: Senior Business Systems Analyst Are you interested in building capabilities that enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability and efficiency? The Global Technology team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA! When you join our organization, you'll unlock an exciting and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world's leading financial services institutions. Your Team As a Senior Business Systems Analyst working in a Global Identity & Access Management (IAM) Team you will partner with product owners, tech leads, designers, engineers and delivery professionals to act as the primary interface between Technology and specific business areas, identifying business unit requirements, creating project and process specifications, coordinating with project teams, and ensuring adherence to schedules and budgets to solve sophisticated business problems, deploy innovative products, services and experiences to delight our customers! In addition to applied analytical and technical experience, you will bring excellent problem solving, communication and teamwork skills, along with agile ways of working, strong business insight, an inclusive leadership attitude and a continuous learning focus to all that you do. Here is What You Can Expect on a Typical Day  Support the Director Business Systems Analyst and Product Owner setting ambitious and clear product vision, and communicating 'the story' effectively to key stakeholders and the rest of the team Beginning to identify opportunities to provide input to the team & coach others with occasional guidance Works on solving extremely complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables  Collaborate with product owners in understanding needs and defining feature stories, tech leads in defining technical design and other team members to understand the system end-to-end and deliver robust solutions that bring about business impact  Work on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables and may impact future concepts, products or technologies  Works on extremely complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of often complex variables related to technology and/or data. Exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Own the end-to-end product strategy from inception and determine business value once solution enters production  Ensure alignment of product features and stories, i.e., review, give feedback, and prioritize user stories in line with product vision  Understands the vision and owns aspects of the product management/roadmap activities  3 to 5 years of experience in Identity and Access Management, Security / Cybersecurity.3-5 top skills: Identity & Access Management Experience (e.g., former experience with OKTA, PING, not necessarily ForgeRock). ForgeRock experience is IDEAL, but it's a new platform, so dedicated FR people are rare; however if they are interested in that space Cybersecurity / Security – not coding, but an good understanding on CIAM topics: Federation, SAML Strong Project Management skills; follow-up; attention of tiny details that can make or break the build Strong Documentation & Confluence Hands-On, Delivery Focused; Can-Do Attitude. Focused. Upbeat. Willingness to press through multiple challenges for one deliverable. IAM is 1 st preference BSA (e.g., Project Management; Stakeholder Management; Splunk, if possible) – must have strong follow up and be a people person; vocal and able to reach out and move the needle; we are in a "busy” space, so must be able to handle multiple client inquires, respond timely, update Jira easily. Jira / Scrum  Attention to detail Ability to identify and gather stakeholders and drive to solution or at least a tangible update.  Ability to understand and drive timelines Ability to collaborate with Scrum Master and PO – understanding of roadmaps; manual creation and pitching in Jira Align if needed

title: Tech BA/ETL/SQL/Global Markets
job_description: Genesis10 is currently seeking an Application Programmer with our client in the financial industry located in Jersey City, NJ. This is a 12 + month contract position.  Responsibilities:  Drive delivery across the ATLAS suite of platforms that deliver key data management capabilities in support of Corporate Treasury Data Management, Global Liquidity Management, and Enterprise-wide upstream and downstream system Requirements:  7+ years of experience working on technical projects and programs In-depth knowledge of and experience in the financial industry and global financial markets including product expertise (Equities, FX, Derivatives, etc.) Experience with standard software development methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, etc.) Experience translating business requirements into functional and technical requirements and driving solutions end-to-end Significant experience in data analysis and creating data mappings, including source, target, and transformations Excellent oral and written presentation skills Ability to work with change management, developers, technology architects, and program leads Pay Range: $58.26 - $66.26  Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position.  If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply!  About Genesis10: Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.  For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10:   Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.  The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.  Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)  Behavioral Health Platform  Medical, Dental, Vision  Health Savings Account  Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident)  Voluntary Term Life Insurance  401K  Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)  Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)  Remote opportunities available  For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.  Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Business Analyst -- Long Term Contract
job_description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Benchmark IT- Technology Talent, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!Our direct client, a global firm in Northern NJ, seeks an experienced Business Analyst to work on requirements for a new software project, where the client is building an application used in business risk management.This is a long-term contract position, with immediate interview and hire. The position is 95% remote, we would prefer a candidate who can drive to Northern NJ once or twice a month for meetings with the team and stakeholders.The Business Analyst (BA) will work alongside the business process leads (BPLs) and IT application development teams; translating business requirements and creating detailed functional specifications; assisting in the design of and supporting the implementation of software applications. The BA will participate in blueprinting and design sessions with business and technical leads to specify the solution at a detailed functional level and to help the BPLs evaluate the proposed technical solution meets the business requirements.Responsibilities include: Collaborate with business process leads to gather the high-level business requirements, documenting the findings and decisions within acceptable standards and templates Work with a multi-disciplinary team on the development and implementation of new software applications. Analyze the impact to integration points and ensure that design can meet the need Perform requirements development, analysis, and create related documentation, i.e. use cases, business process diagrams, use case realizations, user interface storyboards/prototypes, report mockups, data conversion specifications, specific to this new application. Create the detailed functional specifications document Translate requirements and work with IT on the development of implementation options to be then played back and serving as an interface to the business process leads Ensure traceability from business requirements through application testing Interface with the Testing team and help them to prepare for testing Review test cases, and test scripts developed by the Testing team, as well as perform spot checking to ensure functionality meets business requirements SME with regards to application functionality and ability to validate if a reported issue is a defect or an enhancement Work with the other members of the development, QA, testing and business teams to clarify requirements and application functionality Support and enable delivery of projects through completion Must be able to communicate requirements effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholdersDesired Skills: Able to identify ambiguity and propose necessary specificity to eliminate ambiguity and ensure alignment with Business Process Lead’s intent Strong software design skills and usability Strong analytical and organizational skills Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills Strong communication skills, both verbal and written Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work with many levels of management, and interface between technical team and business owners Must be a self-starter with a sense of urgency, strong work ethic and results oriented team player Has strong experience working on large global projects Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, Project, Visio, SharePoint/Teams, and Power PointDesired Experience/Knowledge 4-5 years of hands on Business Analysis experience in a complex regulated environment Strong experience with Microsoft tools such as Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Teams; preferred exposure to Azure DevOps. Skillful in requirements elicitation, analysis, and management for medium to large initiatives while interacting with multiple stakeholders in a matrix organization Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, proficient at communicating/interacting professionally with diverse groups, clients, executives, managers, and subject matter experts Professional designation such as CBAP, PMP, Six Sigma or comparable methodologies strongly encouraged Proficient with industry-standard, structured business analysis techniques, and practicesBusiness Analyst -- Long Term Contract

title: Strategic Initiatives Analyst
job_description: What makes Admiral Insurance Group ADMIRABLE. Since 1974, Admiral Insurance Group has been supporting business innovation and market growth through our wholesale-dedicated excess and surplus (E&S) lines of commercial insurance.  We specialize in underwriting difficult-to-place moderate to high-risk commercial businesses that require creative solutions, outside of the box thinking, entrepreneurial spirit and astute business knowledge.  As a member of the W. R. Berkley Corporation, a Fortune 500® Company and one of the nation’s premier commercial lines property casualty insurance providers, we have the resources, support and industry data to provide exceptional service and exciting solutions for our clients and partners.  Unlock your insure-ability. The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. https://www.admiralins.com/ The Strategic Initiatives Analyst will work closely with the Strategic Initiatives Director, to support the design, creation and implementation of strategies, tools and projects that will enable Admiral to strengthen its operating model by enabling scale and leveraging capacity. This individual will support and enable project execution across the organization largely around process optimization efforts. Support Admiral’s strategic initiatives program and projects.Data analysis and interpretation of results including staffing models, performance quartiles and work alignment analyses.Generate presentations and communication materials relevant to project execution.Collaborate with ALL departments and business lines to identify, prioritize, and execute key strategic initiatives and process improvements.Support the design and development of KPIs and control tools.May perform other functions as assigned relevant for problem solving or project enablement. Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, finance, computer sciences, economics, or a related field. MBA is preferred.2-4 years of relevant working experience.P&C insurance industry or consulting experience is desirable.Demonstrated ability to adapt to new challenges and navigate ambiguous situations to develop innovative solutions using available resources.Ability to balance creativity with practicality, prioritizing quick and straightforward solutions that deliver immediate value.Initiative and resourcefulness in learning concepts and seeking out the necessary resources to ensure the delivery of results.Familiarity with developing, enhancing, and implementing processes optimization tools and methodologies (LEAN, Six Sigma, or similar).Proven advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Understanding of database systems and management (including SQL), and experience with -at least- one programming language (i.e., Python).Ability to work in a collaborative, empowering, and results-oriented environment.Strong focus on execution, time management, and meeting deadlines & commitments.Must be creative and have a constant curiosity for developing new skills.Must be a collaborative team player and ability to relate and communicate with all members of the organization.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Senior Strategy Analyst
job_description: LOCATION 2006 Route 130 North Burlington NJ US 08016OverviewJoin the Burlington Stores team as a Senior Strategy Analyst !As a Senior Strategy Analyst, you will work closely with leaders of the Strategy team to define business problems, run various analyses and develop well supported solutions with specific recommendations that will enable the executive management team to make critical business decisions.A day in the life:Compile data by pulling from databases and by gathering from internal teams using soft influenceMine corporate data to support the strategic plans and processes related to customers, stores, merchandising and operational performanceLeverage advanced statistical techniques where appropriate, such as regression or clusteringUse estimation to quickly establish ‘size of the prize’ for opportunities raised by executivesDraw conclusions and provide recommendations for action to business stakeholdersDesign and execute quantitative research through online surveysConduct qualitative research through store visits and customer chatsOrganize customer chats; design question lists and customer lists and summarize findingsUnderstand the market place and competitor dynamics and summarize in reportsGather input from stakeholders to develop project plans including timelines and milestonesCommunicate status updates on a regular cadence or as timelines changeDevelop crisp and visually appealing slides and visualizations to deliver insightsExplain analysis clearly and simply to Strategy team leaders and business stakeholdersYou’ll come with:Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, applied mathematics, economics, finance, etcMBA preferred3+ years of experience in a highly analytical role such as marketing research, retail planning, or similar OR 1-2 years of experience working as a Strategy Consultant at a top tier firm.The ability to structure problems in a hypothesis driven approach, to understand the implications of strategic analysis, and to make data-supported recommendationsA people-friendly mindset who enjoys working with frontline associates, our merchants, and also our corporate executives; someone seeking to put our customer needs first and helping us become the destination of choice for the ‘treasure hunt’Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!You will enjoy a competitive wage, flexible hours, and an associate discount. Burlington’s benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage including life and disability insurance. Full time associates are also eligible for paid time off, paid holidays and a 401(k) plan.We are a rapidly growing brand, and provide a variety of training and development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. Our teams work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.\Posting Number 2024-220273Location US-NJ-BurlingtonAddress 2006 Route 130 NorthZip Code 08016Workplace Type HybridPosition Type Regular Full-TimeCareer Site Category CorporatePosition Category StrategyEvergreen YesMin USD $115,000.00/AnnualMid USD $130,000.00/Annual

The listed or specified responsibilities & duties are considered essential functions for ADA purposes.Who We AreTD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing.
