No offshore resources - Must be currently located in the NY Tri State area – (the manager is not considering candidates that are out of area or open to relocation).Title: Business Systems Analyst - RTHLocation: Newark , NJ - HYBRIDYears of Experience: 7-10 YearsRight to hire: YESNote : We are hiring a candidate with good experience in below skills and looking to be local to new jersey who needs to come to office 3 days to office.Business Analyst Responsibilities Ability to evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, identify process improvements, and developing and solutions. Performing requirements analysis and documentation of the processes and results. Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders to enable proactive business decisions Strong Communication Skills: Conducting meetings and presentations to business and management for sharing insights, plans and ideas. Perform user acceptance testing of enhancements and system solutions. Perform production support and issues resolution, Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Resource planning and tracking of resources, monitoring deliverables, and ensuring timely completion of project tasks.Business Analyst Qualifications A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field. Strong data analytics, organizational and conceptual thinking skills. Excellent documentation skills. Ability to multi-task between functional areas to support the business. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. A track record of following through on commitments. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. Technology Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Knowledge of Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Jira, and Power Query. Experience with Business Objects or equivalent query type software not limited to SQL, PostgreSQL. High competency in Data Analysis and committed to data. Experience with Commercial Real Estate applications not limited to Yardi, MRI, Kardin, RealPage, DealPath, VTS. Experience with other applications not limited to Salesforce, Business Central (NAV), Cloud applications is a plus Commercial Real Estate experience and/or private equity experience is a plusIf you are interested or have any references please share resume at mukul@brightmindsol.com.
Industries: Computer and Network Security, Computer Networking Products, and Software Development

title: Senior Salesforce and Apttus CMS Business/Technical Analyst
job_description: When you join VerizonVerizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We're a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together-lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you're fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you'll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.What you'll be doing...The Sr. Salesforce and Apttus Contract Management System (Apttus CMS - aka Conga CMS) Business and Technical Solution Provider will be responsible for leveraging an exceptional understanding of the Salesforce CRM ecosystem with a native Apttus CMS installation to conceive and design solutions for sales, sales support, and back-office automation opportunities. This person will work directly with both technical and business personnel and will serve as a knowledge leader charged with innovation in one of the most impactful elements of the business - the Salesforce CRM and the native Apttus CMS. Organizations including sales, sales support and various back-office teams - legal, finance, offer development, contract management, RFP, etc., will rely on this leader to evaluate current and proposed business operations in the context of automation possible within the Salesforce/Apttus ecosystem and potentially through the application of third-party appendages to Salesforce/Apttus. This position will require leading the engagements with sales, sales support, and the back-office teams to collect requirements and present strategies for the implementation of new Salesforce and Apttus CMS automation solutions. These will include but not limited to, conducting requirements interviews, documentation of business/technical requirements as user stories, working with the agile process for implementation, solution options and presentation, UAT planning and script development, UAT execution, production shakeout, train the trainers, and pre and post go-live planning and on-going level-2 support. This position does not require any coding.Responsibilities: Lead, propose, and maintain world-class Salesforce.com and Apttus CMS solutions using best practices in the areas of new process automation, changes to existing system processes, system decommissions (moving legacy systems or processes to Salesforce.com/Apttus CMS), lightning apps and components, custom apps, changes to core apps, Apttus CMS workflows, AppExchange Apps, approvals, workflows, Salesforce Flows, reports and dashboards, etc.Recommend improvements to existing systems and processes.Lead implementation of new processes and technologies.Lead legacy systems decommission initiatives.Lead meetings with stakeholders to review the challenges and opportunities for Salesforce.com and Apttus CMS automation needs.Lead collection and documentation of client requirements and feedback as user stories.Lead user-story grooming sessions with the IT team.Lead certification of solution design - whether submitted through user stories or alternatives proposed by the IT teams.Create Test Plans.Conduct UAT.Lead engagement of stakeholders in the UAT process.Provide contents to the training teams as needed.Lead pre and post implementation plan.Provide level 2 support as needed.What we're looking for...You'll need to have:Bachelor's degree or four or more of work experience. Six years or more of relevant experience.Salesforce.com Admin and Consultant Certifications.Knowledge of Public Sector (Federal, State and Local) contracting processes and related contract management systems -Apttus CMS, etc.Extensive functional knowledge of the Salesforce.com and Apttus CMS system.Demonstrable ability to lead strategic/consultative sessions with clients.Demonstrable proficiency in building/documentation of requirements, solution design, UAT prep and execution, and pre- and post-go-live support.Even better if you have one or more of the following:A B.S. Degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent curriculum.Apttus/Conga CMS certification.Salesforce/Apttus CMS DevOps experience.6 or more years of demonstrable leadership in providing complex business solutions via Salesforce.com and Apttus CMS.6 or more years of demonstrable leadership in managing automation processes from requirements to implementations.Demonstrated proficiency in working with Salesforce.com/Apttus CMS integrations, data migration, building of custom apps (lightning or otherwise), UX for page layouts and record types, custom objects, sharing rules, workflow and validation rules, email templates, formulas, dashboards & reporting, and Sandbox-to-Production processes.Strong ability to solve diverse, complex, and crucial business problems.Self-directed with ability to work in fast-paced environment.Ability to meet deadlines, communicate delays, clarify ambiguities.If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every "even better" qualification listed above.Where you'll be workingIn this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.Scheduled Weekly Hours40Equal Employment OpportunityWe're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

title: SAP Oil and Gas PreSales Architect
job_description: As a part of the North America SAP Solutions team , you will work closely with the brightest and most knowledgeable SAP experts of HCL, supported by a dedicated senior offshore team, helping our target clients become stronger leaders in their markets and industries, through business value delivered via transformation to a modern ERP Business Platform centered around SAP S/4HANA as the Digital Core.OrganizationWhat you can expect from us:As part of the SAP Solutions team, you will get to work in tight and direct interaction with clients across several countries and industries, helping them on the S/4HANA transformation journey.You will be presented with a wide portfolio of interesting client opportunities, while depending on your preferences also focus on specific industries and clients is possible.Within the Solutions team, you will get to network and collaborate on North America and Global level, be involved in the development of the HCL’s go-to-market approach, the Digital Core with S/4HANA offering, and the assets supporting this.Your role and responsibilities:You will focus on and lead presales activities around Digital Core with SAP S/4HANA.You will provide strategic advice to senior stakeholders of HCL clients, helping them drive business value from transformation to Digital Core with S/4HANA.You will act as Solutioning Lead of complex, multitower S/4HANA implementation programs, covering end-to-end solution definition, implementation approach, effort estimation, and implementation planning, working hand in hand with sales to define winning sales plan and unique value proposition.You will build strong global networks, enabling you to get involved and contribute in the most interesting client problems globally, and to leverage from global network to solve local challenges.You will be a Thought Leader and contribute to HCL thought leadership by creating blogs, vlogs, eBooks, white papers, proofs-of-concepts and use cases, participate in global and local events (like SAPPHIRE and SAP Now!) and seminars as a keynote speaker, presenter or SME.You will lead, support and contribute to go-to-market and marketing strategy definition, execution planning, and execution, including campaigns, content marketing, events, client meetings and tailored offerings.You will drive, contribute to and participate in the continuous development and localization of HCL offers, methodology, assets, and tools.Your profile:You will focus on and lead presales activities around Digital Core with SAP S/4HANA.You will provide strategic advice to senior stakeholders of HCL clients, helping them drive business value from transformation to Digital Core with S/4HANA.Minimum 10 years of experience in SAP supporting Oil and Gas clients (O&G) Strong experience (at least 8-10 years) in implementing SAP solutions with focus on S/4HANA preferably across various roles (business analyst, lead consultant, lead (solution) architect, project manager)Solid experience in driving the execution of business transformation via implementation of new processes and supporting technologyDeep and specialized skills in at Complex Manufacturing scenarios Good Knowledge of PLM, ERP and MES integration experience with ability to advise on Industry 4.0 aspects.Strong overall holistic understanding and experience across functional domains, business processes, applications, SAP product roadmap and emerging technologies & trends such as SAP PEO, PDMI, MII etc.Solid experience in Manufacturing industry.Sufficient knowledge across relevant technical domains (cloud, infrastructure, HANA DB, basis, security, integrations, development etc.)Entrepreneurial mindset: Independent, proactive, self-motivated and self-driven, collaborative, client-orientedAbility to build relationships and to become a trusted advisor for client senior stakeholders (VP and CXO levels)Ability to articulate a compelling vision and engage audience
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Information Services

title: Hybrid Remote, Personal Lines Account Executive
job_description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!Job detailsHybrid Remote, Personal Lines Account Manager needed with experience with carriers such as Chubb and PURE and brokerage background!This Jobot Job is hosted by Danielle McIntireAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.Salary $65,000 - $80,000 per yearA Bit About UsWe are a third-generation, family-owned, Insurance Brokerage working with carriers such as Chubb and PURE - to name a few. We develop and maintain strong partnerships with many of the world’s leading insurers!We are hiring for a Hybrid Remote (3 days in office, 2 days at home) Personal Lines Account Manager/Executive to join our growing team! Our ideal candidate will have 3+ years of Personal Lines experience and have worked with carriers such as Chubb/PURE and must have brokerage background.If you are seeking a new challenging role with growth opportunity, please apply TODAY!Why join us?Growth opportunitiesHybrid Remote (3 days in office)Salary $65-80k annuallyJob DetailsNEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT/CLIENT MANAGEMENT Meets agency’s objectives for client service, account development and placement of business.Aligns with Strategic Plan goals. Services all clients as VIP status. Handles all phone calls, outside client visits and walk-in activity by clients and carriers. Phonecalls are returned the same day or referred to manager for handling. Working with clients to perform re-markets, answer questions regarding coverages and ensuringthe coverages meets the needs of the client, cross sell to other departments. New Accounts Works with New Business Supervisor on transition of new business to Account Executive byreviewing EPIC notes to familiarize themselves with the new account. Send AE intro email tothe client. Work with New Business Supervisor to clear up any open activities from the NewBusiness binding within 72 hours. Rounding Follows the Agency program to round personal lines accounts. At time of renewal, reviewopen and closed activities to determine if additional coverage is beneficial to the client basedon past conversations and revised company contracts. Review coverage eligibilityRequirements With Company Underwriter. Profiles, sends rounding email(s); follows-up and creates new lines. Uses every contact as an opportunity to round the account and review coverages the insuredneeds; communicates those needs successfully. Renewals Responsible for timely renewal reviews on assigned Book of Business. Full review to beconducted every three years on non-VIP accounts and annual review on VIP accounts. Delegates tasks to others within the agency and ReSourcePro as appropriate. Manages their Home page in EPIC by keeping open activities current. Set up policy changes in EPIC and assigns to Junior Analyst for processing.Technical Skills NJ or NY Property and Casualty license required Minimum of one-year high net worth carrier experience At least three years of previous Account Executive experience Bachelor’s degree preferred Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 applications and Chubb, AIG, Pure, and Cincinnati websites.Knowledge Of Applied EPIC Software Preferred But Not Required Must be willing to obtain an insurance designation as per agency standardsInterested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

title: Conflicts and Audit Letter Analyst
job_description: Roseland, NJSummaryThe Conflicts and Audit Letter Analyst will be responsible for a variety of tasks, including the performance and generation of conflict of interest reports using internal and external databases and the review, analysis, and resolution of potential conflicts, with respect to both lateral attorney candidates and new business intake. This role will also assist in drafting waivers and engagement letters or other documentation.The Conflicts and Audit Letter Analyst will also be responsible for implementing and coordinating the Firm’s audit letter response process, including the preparation of audit letter responses for review by the Associate General Counsel and Firm partners and working closely with various Firm departments to collect and synthesize necessary information.ResponsibilitiesPerform conflict of interest searches and generate reports using internal and external databases.Assist attorneys in interpretation of conflict of interest reports.Update and maintain the integrity of the Firm’s names database.Provide orientation to new employees with respect to relevant firm processes within scope of the job.Maintain close working relationship with Conflicts, Finance, IT, Recruiting, and other departments as necessary.Identify and resolve conflicts of interest associated with the admission of lateral candidates and with new business intakes.Analyze and summarize conflict search reports to identify actual and potential conflicts of interest associated with the admission of candidates and new business intake.Provide timely status reports to the General Counsel, Associate General Counsel, Conflicts, and Recruiting Departments, as necessary, regarding the progress of the conflict identification and resolution process.Create and coordinate responses to auditor inquiries. Consult with General Counsel, Associate General Counsel, Conflicts, IT, Finance, and Firm Partners as necessary.Oversee the audit letter workflow to ensure timely and accurate process.Collaborate with other members of the Office of General Counsel on special projects, as needed, including engagement letters, AML/KYC research, continuing legal education, and insider trading projects.QualificationsBachelor’s degree (BA or BS).Paralegal training/certificate preferred.Minimum 2 years’ conflict of interest experience in a law firm.Familiarity with Intapp Open preferred.Knowledge of laws, Rules of Professional Conduct, and risk management requirements governing conflicts of interest and conflicts resolution processes.Experience doing legal and corporate affiliation research.Strong analytical and organizational skills.Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills.Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities, and work within extremely tight deadlines.Ability to understand, analyze, interpret, and prepare complex conflict reports.General knowledge of transactional and litigation matters and ability to identify when party information is incomplete.Familiarity with name aliases of major organizations.Ability to treat sensitive/confidential information with appropriate discretion.Maintain a reliable attendance record. Arrive to work in a timely manner and observe prescribed work break and meal periods.Be familiar with and adhere to all firm policies and procedures.CompensationThe salary range for this position is $90,000 – $100,000 (nonexempt).

title: TS Logistics Senior Analyst
job_description: Description:Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for Technology Services-Supply Chain, Senior Analyst to be part of a fast-paced, innovative, and highly visible team supporting Warehouse Management Systems (WMS). The position will be based in Raritan, NJ or Mooresville, IN.Johnson & Johnson, through its operating companies, is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. We strive to provide scientifically sound, high-quality products and services to help heal, cure disease, and improve the quality of life.TS Supply Chain Logistics Senior Analyst will play a key role in supporting and deploying Johnson & Johnson’s next generation WMS systems/capabilities.RESPONSIBILITIES:Technical support lead for WMS applications across MedTech Supply Chain Lead a team of support analysts.Planning, supporting, and deploying Warehouse Management SystemsLead, align, and collaborate across organizational boundaries (e.g. project teams, functions, and partner organizations) without direct authority.Manage risks and resolve issues that affect release scope, schedule, and quality.Maintain a release repository and manage key information such as release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists. Work with business partners to automate and ensure reliability of BY WMS services.Up to 25% of travel may be required based on business needs.Qualifications:A minimum associate degree is required. 3 years of working experience in an IT environment building/supporting applications (preferred).2 years of Blue Yonder WMS functional/support experience (preferred).Familiarity with ITSM, Incident management, Problem management processes required.Excellent troubleshooting, collaborating and communication skills required.Experience creating training and support documentation while identifying clear opportunities for improvement.Experience working with diverse group of individuals required.SalaryFor US based candidates, the base pay range for this position is $90,100 USD to $121,900 USD.BonusThe Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/ performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.BenefitsEmployees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. For additional general information on company benefits, please go to:https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefitsJohnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Business Systems Consultant - (Dynamics 365 Functional)
job_description: As a Dynamics 365 CRM Business Analyst, your primary responsibility is to bridge the gap between business requirements and technical implementation within the Dynamics 365 Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system. You will work closely with stakeholders, such as business users, project managers, and developers, to gather and analyze business needs, define system requirements, and design efficient solutions using Dynamics 365 CRM.Your Key Duties And Responsibilities May IncludeRequirement Gathering: Collaborate with business users to elicit, document, and prioritize their CRM system requirements. Conduct interviews, workshops, and analysis to understand business processes, goals, and challenges.System Analysis and Design: Analyze the gathered requirements and translate them into functional specifications. Identify gaps, propose solutions, and design business processes and workflows within Dynamics 365 CRM.Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute test plans to validate the functionality and performance of the Dynamics 365 CRM system. Identify and resolve any issues or defects through testing and collaborate with development teams to ensure a high-quality implementation.User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on how to effectively use the Dynamics 365 CRM system. Assist with user adoption, answer queries, and troubleshoot issues to ensure smooth system operation.Documentation and Reporting: Prepare comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, user guides, and training materials. Generate reports and analyze system data to provide insights and recommendations for process improvement.Collaboration and Communication: Act as a liaison between business stakeholders, project managers, and technical teams. Facilitate effective communication, manage expectations, and ensure alignment between business goals and technical solutions.To excel in this role, you should have a strong understanding of CRM concepts, business processes, and best practices. Proficiency in Dynamics 365 CRM, along with analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, is crucial. Additionally, a background in business analysis, CRM implementation, or related roles is highly beneficial.Please note that specific job requirements may vary depending on the organization and project scope.

title: Global Merchandise Planning Senior Analyst, Apparel & Accessories - Calvin Klein
job_description: Job DescriptionDesign Your Future at PVHGlobal Merchandise Planning Senior Analyst, Apparel & Accessories - Calvin KleinPosition SummaryThis role will report to the VP of Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories and will be the key data partner to Global Brand Planning and Merchandising. In partnership with the VP of Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories, this position will be responsible for the development and integration of reporting, tools and systems that will be used by the Merchandise Planning Team to drive Global Merchandising and Planning strategies.The candidate will use their technical proficiency and business acumen to deliver tools for the Global Merchandise Planning Team that turn data into insights and ensure alignment to regional needs. These tools will effectively support deep cross-functional and cross-regional partnerships to unlock knowledge and quickly assess and address business opportunities and challenges.As the critical point of reference for global data, the candidate will interface with teams such as Merchandising, Supply, Regions, Business Intelligence, Strategic Data Insights, Data Governance, Technology Process Group, Finance, and StrategyThe ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and organizational skills and has an in-depth knowledge of product life cycle, planning and merchandising functions, pricing, promotions, and calendars.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities Of The JobSupport pre-season target setting, plan building by providing robust and detailed monthly hindsight templates by country, channel, and sku that will facilitate and inform the strategic path to growth and brand elevation with KPI based insightsIn partnership with planning, create tools to guide the evolution of product and pricing architecture and the development of pre-season range plans that tie to topline strategies, driving global profitability while exploiting individual market needsSupport the evolution of pricing structure through compilation and analysis of regional competitor pricing, Good | Better | Best price tiersSupport planners in style/sku planning analysis with a focus on achievement of adoption rate targets to drive productivityMaintain Promotional / Holiday calendars by country to understand and anticipate response to shifts in businessDevelop templates to facilitate the clear and efficient exchange of projections and information between Global and Regions to reduce friction and maximize alignmentIn partnership with VP Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories, closely follow the Product Lifecyle from inception to delivery and the systems used for each. Focus on continuous improvement as point person to help trouble shoot issues for the Merchandise Planning teamPoint person for Lighthouse reporting and Data needs, communicate new or update requirements to the LH team, assist with Testing, UAT and Sign off for the brandWork with Data Governance team to ensure accurate values are available for key product attributes such as program or silhouette, gain alignment with Regions on new attribute needs or updates to existing definitions or values, work back with Data Governance team to implement.Train planning members on new processes, tools, and methodologyPeople Skills, Sphere Of InfluenceDemonstrated retail math and business acumen, including markup, margin planning, selling and inventory productivity measures Strong time management skills, attention to detail, problem solving, interpersonal and organizational skills – communication between functional groups is criticalStrategic thinker who recognizes opportunities and can recommend strategies by building business case. effective working at all levels within the organizationAbility to maintain poise and a positive attitude in a challenging, fast-paced rapidly changing environmentHave the adaptability to quickly pivot strategies and recommendationsHave a solutions-oriented mindset and be a change agentChampion best practices and look for continuous improvement opportunities._______________________________________________________________________________Qualifications & ExperienceExperience: 3-5+ years of experience in the retail sector managing planning, pricing, promotions, buying, merchandising and/or or analytics and implementing a variety of large and small-scale optimization initiativesEducation: Associates and/or Bachelor’s Degree are requiredSkillsFamiliarity with Merchandising, Planning Functions & Supply Chain ManagementAdvanced proficiency in Excel, Power BI, PowerPointAdept at analysis of big data sets and data visualizationPay Range:$85,000 - $100,000PVH currently provides base salary ranges for all positions-on job advertisements-in the United States based on local requirements. These ranges are based on what PVH reasonably believes that it will pay an associate for their base salary for said position at the time of the posting. Individual compensation will ultimately be determined based on a variety of relevant factors including but-not limited to qualifications, geographic location and other relevant skills. PVH is committed to providing a market-competitive total rewards package to eligible associates, which includes diverse and robust health and insurance benefits to meet the varied needs of our associates and an above-market 401(k) contribution to help our associates save for retirement. Accordingly, applicants are asked not to disclose this salary history information to PVH

title: Associate Campaign Manager - (USA) Senior Analyst, Media Partnerships
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Hoboken, NJ/San Bruno, CABring your energy, confidence, and enthusiasm for digital media! We are hiring an Associate Campaign Manager to assist planning, execution, and analysis of advertising campaigns to promote Walmart's products.No prior experience is required, but we are looking for someone who's passion will shine through their daily performance. Be ready to articulate an idea, an issue, or a discovery with crystal clarity - the opportunities to make an impact are your hands.This team requires 3 days in-office per week. Relocation assistance is not available.About Walmart ConnectWalmart Connect is the in-house retail media business of Walmart. We're a growing, team and this is your opportunity to join a high-visibility team within the largest retail company in the world. You can expect the pace and urgency of a startup company eager to help our customers and suppliers. Our team believes all digital advertising can be targeted and quantified - and we have Walmart's sales data to prove it!What You'll DoThe Associate Campaign Manager will report directly to the Campaign Manager Lead, overseeing a diverse range of tasks and providing support to either a major supplier or multiple Campaign Managers. Day-to-day responsibilities include:Support campaign setup, delivery, and performance monitoring and triage for advertising campaigns.Help manage the daily campaign maintenance, including internal and external questions regarding accurate campaign implementation, pacing, and performance of campaigns.Monitor campaign pacing and performance and report the results.Help gather campaign-specific materials, data, and reports for media planning.Help build and deliver media plans for new client opportunities.Help troubleshoot issues during the pre-launch and post-launch process.Solve basic campaign issues and understand relevant data that influence the business.What You'll BringThis role is for AdFellows 7.0 class0-3 years' professional experience in Digital Media Campaign Management or a related field.Understanding of traditional and digital media elements.Familiarity with digital media products and channels: Social, Display, Mobile, Search, Paid, and Programmatic.Flexibility to provide after-hours support when needed.Experience finding opportunities through analysis and mathematical skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel.Excellent communication, presentation, and writing skills.Project management skills.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.Benefits & PerksBeyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.#advertising #digitalmarketing #entrylevel #nyc #sanbruno #retailmediaAt Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.‎‎‎You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.‎For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .‎‎Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.‎Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.‎For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart .‎The annual salary range for this position is $84,000.00-$156,000.00‎Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses.‎Additional Compensation For Certain Positions May Also Include‎‎ Stock‎‎Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor degree in business or related fieldPreferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. title: Senior Enterprise Analyst

title: Representative, Client Experience
job_description: 2080735Job DescriptionThe Role Are you waiting for your opportunity in the investment services industry? Are you curious about sophisticated topics such as mutual funds, pricing, trading, mergers, and acquisitions? Then you are ideal candidate for one of Fidelity’s most exciting and dynamic teams!Our goal is to hire YOU, the curious and growth-minded individual, who is adventurous enough to immerse yourself in the sophisticated world of brokerage operations. Your mission: To learn, analyze problems and connect dots for business partners and customers. Your reward: To excel at providing award-winning service and problem solving every day. In the role you will hone your professional competence and build your professional brand. The environment will be customer focused, ambitious, and heavily team oriented. In addition to curiosity and growth, you have a desire to be innovative and strategic – these are must haves! Classes start soon. If you are driven by curiosity, mission and fascinated by the world of finance; then become part this team!Your Responsibilities IncludeYou will Analyze industry problems that may include – Transfer of Assets, Trading, Money Movement, Mutual Funds, Stock Certificates and Corporate ActionsYou will Apply various technologies to assist our customers with a range of needs – basic and sophisticatedYou will Engage with customers and business partners through multiple channels – phone, email, and instant messagingYou will Envision and execute bold ideas to attract and retain the next generation of customersYou will Improve every day to prepare for future and advanced career opportunities, including – Team Lead, Analyst and LeadershipThe Expertise And Skills You BringCustomer Service or Problem-Solving experience preferredCollege Degree or equivalent work experience preferredA desire for continuous growth and learning about the financial services industry requiredPossesses a drive to solve sophisticated problems and deliver an outstanding customer experience every daySelf-starter and comfortable working independently when neededExcellent written and verbal communications skillsProven technical knowledge and strong problem-solving skillsAbility to contribute ideas as well as influence and execute them in a team environmentAbility to lean into change while multi-tasking in a remote and multifaceted financial services centerGrowth Mindset and an appetite for endless learningFINRA Licenses are preferred but not required.The TeamAs a member of the Client Experience Team, you will take on the role of a Brokerage Operations Rep. You will be given an overview course of the industry, and niche training to help you master brokerage operations. You will also get an exclusive peek behind the scenes of one of the most successful privately-owned companies in the world.Company OverviewAt Fidelity, we are passionate about making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want! We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com. Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to complete the application or interview process. Please email us at accommodations@fmr.com or call 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 2 if you would like to request an accommodation.The base salary range for this position is $42,000 - $60,000 per year.Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. Note, the application window closes when the position is filled or unposted.CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Senior Analyst-Program & Project Management
job_description: When you join VerizonVerizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We're a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together-lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you're fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you'll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.What you'll be doing...At Verizon, we don't wait for the future, we build it! Join the industry leader in Network and Telecommunications Services as we embark on transforming our nation's critical communications infrastructure and the FAA's National Airspace System (NAS) network.As a Transition Site Readiness Project Manager, you are responsible to manage and track the interdependent deliverables from the initial site assessment through site acceptance. The lifecycle of the implementation of the site transition begins approximately 15-12 months prior to the site migration to the Verizon managed services. You have an integrated team of network engineers, infrastructure and regional project managers and order management support with Transition and Service Area Project management oversight. You will work with FAA, Network Engineering and our business partners to manage the site-specific verification of the physical and logical requirements for the Verizon's FENS managed network solution.Once you have confirmed circuit(s) installation and acceptance, site prep completion, site configuration build, and CPE readiness, you conduct "Go/No Go" with FAA site contacts and partners. Upon confirmation of readiness, CPE staging initiates. You proceed with scheduling resources, change windows, MOP updates and Provisioning activation. With assistance from Service Area Project Manager, communications and change management are submitted and dates/times approved. CPE is secured and shipped to FAA location to meet the coordinated 'time/date' for our field technician(s) partner at the site. You will work with the Service Area Transition Project Manager, Service Readiness Project Manager and the Transition and Implementation Project team for assistance in reporting, schedule, milestones, creation of jeopardy, tracking and status reports. You will have access to customized tools and the ability to work with others to potentially customize reports, analyze performance and continue to seek ways to improve service delivery for the Transition project. The Site Readiness Project Manager has the following key responsibilities:Execute and maintain project management processes in the areas of project schedule, quality management, communications management, risk/issue management, and change management.Coordinate and maintain project schedules and calendars with the input and assistance of service area project manager and transition leadsFacilitate site readiness meetings, providing meeting minutes and action items where neededBuild strong communication channels with site, district stakeholders, our field services partners, engineering, provisioning, project engineering and managed network operations.Track tasks, durations, and deliverables to ensure on time delivery. Where necessary, escalate for improvements and explore alternative solutions to meet due dates expeditiously. Responsible for tracking project changes and producing updated schedulesInfluence continuous improvement of project management methodologies including: assessment of project delivery capabilities, gathering and reporting performance metrics, establishing corresponding targets, and measurement of on-going progress.Ensure smooth communication within the project team and other cross-functional teamsInterface with internal/external stakeholders on a regular basisPrepare and document Day 1/Day 2 support documentation and acceptance criteria What we are looking for...You'll need to have:Bachelor's Degree or four or more years of experienceSupplier ManagementEnterprise Client ExperienceFinancial Business acumenFour or more years of Project Management experience with proven track record and experience with deploying and delivering complex solutionsBroad Verizon product experienceEven better if you have:Excellent organizational skillsAbility to write documentation and communicate effectively with team-membersSkills in Microsoft Office product suite, including PowerPoint, Excel & Word; Microsoft Project.Ability to work in a structured manner and according to processes and procedureProven leadership skills & capabilitiesAbility to manage and negotiate with required internal and external organizationsITIL V3 Certification Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification Proficiency in customer enablement toolsIf Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every "even better" qualification listed above. Where you'll be workingIn this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.Scheduled Weekly Hours40Equal Employment OpportunityWe're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we've got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island or Washington work location, the compensation range for this position is between $76,000.00 and $142,000.00 annually based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

title: Senior Analyst Logistics
job_description: Please note that this position is based in Princeton, NJ. Acadia's hybrid model requires this role to work in our office three days per week on average.The Sr. Analyst is responsible for overseeing and driving key commercial, clinical and non-commercial logistics and supporting related manufacturing operation activities (GMP and non-GMP). He/she will coordinate and track critical logistics activities. Develop and manage critical internal logistics and supply chain processes and support key supply operation functions including Trade Compliance readiness. title: Global Merchandise Planning Senior Analyst, Apparel & Accessories - Calvin Klein
job_description: Job DescriptionDesign Your Future at PVHGlobal Merchandise Planning Senior Analyst, Apparel & Accessories - Calvin KleinPosition SummaryThis role will report to the VP of Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories and will be the key data partner to Global Brand Planning and Merchandising. In partnership with the VP of Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories, this position will be responsible for the development and integration of reporting, tools and systems that will be used by the Merchandise Planning Team to drive Global Merchandising and Planning strategies.The candidate will use their technical proficiency and business acumen to deliver tools for the Global Merchandise Planning Team that turn data into insights and ensure alignment to regional needs. These tools will effectively support deep cross-functional and cross-regional partnerships to unlock knowledge and quickly assess and address business opportunities and challenges.As the critical point of reference for global data, the candidate will interface with teams such as Merchandising, Supply, Regions, Business Intelligence, Strategic Data Insights, Data Governance, Technology Process Group, Finance, and StrategyThe ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and organizational skills and has an in-depth knowledge of product life cycle, planning and merchandising functions, pricing, promotions, and calendars.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities Of The JobSupport pre-season target setting, plan building by providing robust and detailed monthly hindsight templates by country, channel, and sku that will facilitate and inform the strategic path to growth and brand elevation with KPI based insightsIn partnership with planning, create tools to guide the evolution of product and pricing architecture and the development of pre-season range plans that tie to topline strategies, driving global profitability while exploiting individual market needsSupport the evolution of pricing structure through compilation and analysis of regional competitor pricing, Good | Better | Best price tiersSupport planners in style/sku planning analysis with a focus on achievement of adoption rate targets to drive productivityMaintain Promotional / Holiday calendars by country to understand and anticipate response to shifts in businessDevelop templates to facilitate the clear and efficient exchange of projections and information between Global and Regions to reduce friction and maximize alignmentIn partnership with VP Global Merchandise Planning, Apparel & Accessories, closely follow the Product Lifecyle from inception to delivery and the systems used for each. Focus on continuous improvement as point person to help trouble shoot issues for the Merchandise Planning teamPoint person for Lighthouse reporting and Data needs, communicate new or update requirements to the LH team, assist with Testing, UAT and Sign off for the brandWork with Data Governance team to ensure accurate values are available for key product attributes such as program or silhouette, gain alignment with Regions on new attribute needs or updates to existing definitions or values, work back with Data Governance team to implement.Train planning members on new processes, tools, and methodologyPeople Skills, Sphere Of InfluenceDemonstrated retail math and business acumen, including markup, margin planning, selling and inventory productivity measures Strong time management skills, attention to detail, problem solving, interpersonal and organizational skills – communication between functional groups is criticalStrategic thinker who recognizes opportunities and can recommend strategies by building business case. effective working at all levels within the organizationAbility to maintain poise and a positive attitude in a challenging, fast-paced rapidly changing environmentHave the adaptability to quickly pivot strategies and recommendationsHave a solutions-oriented mindset and be a change agentChampion best practices and look for continuous improvement opportunities._______________________________________________________________________________Qualifications & ExperienceExperience: 3-5+ years of experience in the retail sector managing planning, pricing, promotions, buying, merchandising and/or or analytics and implementing a variety of large and small-scale optimization initiativesEducation: Associates and/or Bachelor’s Degree are requiredSkillsFamiliarity with Merchandising, Planning Functions & Supply Chain ManagementAdvanced proficiency in Excel, Power BI, PowerPointAdept at analysis of big data sets and data visualizationPay Range:$85,000 - title: Senior Analyst, Ceded Reinsurance - Morristown, NJ/Hybrid
job_description: Crum & Forster Company Overview Crum & Forster (C&F)  , with a proud history dating to 1822, provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. C&F enjoys a financial strength rating of "A" (Excellent) by AM Best and is proud of our superior customer service platform. Our claims and risk engineering services are recognized as among the best in the industry.Our most valuable asset is our people: more than 2000 employees in locations throughout the United States. The company is increasingly winning recognition as a great place to work, earning several workplace and wellness awards, including the October 2023 Great Place to Work ® Award for our employee-first focus and our steadfast commitment to diversity, equity and Inclusion.C&F is part of Fairfax Financial Holdings, a global, billion dollar organization. For more information about Crum & Forster, please visit our website: www.cfins.com.Job DescriptionThe candidate will play a crucial role in the placement of key reinsurance protections for C&F including treaties covering property, casualty, and professional liability. The candidate will work on reinsurance transactions with over 100 reinsurance markets, including traditional reinsurers and investment funds in the US, UK, Bermuda, continental Europe and Asia. Additionally, the candidate will collaborate closely with C&F divisional and corporate leaders, contributing to the creation of submissions, reinsurer audits, and internal strategy meetings. The role blends technical expertise with strategic foresight to drive efficiency and effectiveness in C&F’s reinsurance activities.What You Will DoTreaty Submissions:Assist in preparing and presenting reinsurance submissions. Collaborate in the design phase of reinsurance treaties, analyzing and suggesting terms and clauses that would be beneficial for the company. Data Analysis:Data-driven decision-making is at the heart of the role, requiring comprehensive analysis of portfolio risks, reinsurance market trends, and treaty performance.Engage and educate stakeholders on reinsurance matters to ensure understanding and alignment.Cross-functional Collaboration:Collaborate with C&F pricing and reserving actuaries to assess portfolio risk, optimize reinsurance structure and economics, and monitor performance.Collaborate with underwriting management to facilitate reinsurance audits and ensure reinsurance coverage aligns with underwriting objectives.Collaborate with claims to facilitate reinsurance audits, understand claim trends, and help ensure reinsurance loss reporting obligations are met.Market Analysis:Stay abreast of trends, developments, and changes in the reinsurance market.Provide insights and recommendations based on market intelligence.Contract and Compliance Management:Contribute to ensuring that the final treaty documentation accurately reflects the agreed-upon terms and conditions.Contribute to ensuring clarity and adherence to all regulatory requirements.What You Will Bring To C&FBachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Insurance, or a related field. Advanced degrees and industry designations (e.g., CPCU, ARe) are a plus.3+ years of related experience requiredPrior experience in ceded reinsurance roles or similar is preferred. Ability to work collaboratively across departments and manage multiple priorities.High proficiency in Excel.Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.What C&F Will Bring To You Competitive compensation package  Generous 401K employer match  Employee Stock Purchase plan with employer matching  Generous Paid Time Off  Excellent benefits that go beyond health, dental & vision. Our programs are focused on your whole family’s wellness, including your physical, mental and financial wellbeing  A core C&F tenet is owning your career development, so we provide a wealth of ways for you to keep learning, including tuition reimbursement, industry-related certifications and professional training to keep you progressing on your chosen path  A dynamic, ambitious, fun and exciting work environment  We believe you do well by doing good and want to encourage a spirit of social and community responsibility, matching donation program, volunteer opportunities, and an employee-driven corporate giving program that lets you participate and support your community At C&F you will BELONGWe value inclusivity and diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and welcome everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.Crum & Forster is committed to ensuring a workplace free from discriminatory pay disparities and complying with applicable pay equity laws. Salary ranges are available for all positions at this location, taking into account roles with a comparable level of responsibility and impact in the relevant labor market and these salary ranges are regularly reviewed and adjusted in accordance with prevailing market conditions. The annualized base pay for the advertised position, located in the specified area, ranges from a minimum of $71,600.00 to a maximum of $119,300.00. The actual compensation is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the market pay for the jobs at each level, the responsibilities and skills required for each job, and the employee’s contribution (performance) in that role. To be considered within market range, a salary is at or above the minimum of the range. You may also have the opportunity to participate in discretionary equity (stock) based compensation and/or performance-based variable pay programs.

title: Pricing Manager
job_description: Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for pricing optimization? Join our dynamic team as a Pricing Manager at a leading global wire and cable manufacturing company. Drive profitability and market competitiveness through your expertise in pricing strategies and analysis. The individual in this role must be located within the Eastern half of the United States.Summary: Reporting to the VP of Product Management, the primary focus of this role is to develop and implement analytical pricing tools that will provide LAPP with a competitive advantage. This person will be responsible for comprehensive analyses to deliver actionable insights on market price data, define the most impactful margin protection and cost out initiatives, and to increase profit through strategic price adjustments. This role must collaborate with cross functional teams across North American including Sales, Product Management, Operations, and Finance to lead the regional pricing strategy. Essential Duties and Responsibilities - include the following. Other duties may be assigned.• Build from the ground up a sustainable process to analyze market data and compare to current business (excel power query).• Monitor and track market price for LAPP North America.• Act as lead contact with external vendor on data scrapping project.• Determine pricing opportunities to increase revenue.• Analyze competitor pricing and market trends to increase market share and profitability.• Apply statistical modeling methods to determine the potential impact of pricing strategies on profitability (price vs volume at a product level). • Collaborate with sales and marketing departments on developing and implementing competitive pricing strategies.• Create dynamic pricing tools to effectively respond to changing market needs and trends.• Prepare and present pricing analysis findings to executives, marketing teams, and sales staff.• Apply market price project findings to daily business and customer price files. • Manage Global Account Customers pricing in the region and update SAP with local values.• Support intercompany pricing with entities to determine gaps and opportunities.• Create and manage SAP uploads related to list price and key customers. • Integrate market price knowledge into project quoting and end to end margin review. Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.Competencies• Proficient in business intelligence software.• In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.• Ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders and leadership team.• Familiar with and understands conversions of currency and metric vs imperial.• Experience in analyzing pricing strategies and forecasting revenue and market share.• Experience in collaborating on pricing strategies with sales and marketing departments.• Extremely data driven with strong attention to detail; ability to manipulate and translate data.• Understands business implications of decisions.• Adapts to changes in the work environment; manages competing demands.• Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully.• Demonstrates group presentation skills at the highest level; writes clearly and informatively.• Inspires and motivates others to perform well; effectively influences actions and opinions of others.• Displays willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound judgment.QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS• A bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, or in a related field.• A master’s degree in business administration is an advantage.• A minimum of five years' experience as a pricing analyst in a similar industry.WORK LOCATION: This position is located in the US within the Eastern or Central time zones. Travel to the Florham Park, NJ office may be required ad hoc when business demands. Incumbents of this position whose residence is in NJ will be required to work a hybrid schedule (3x per week in office- Tues & Wed +1).TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: 5-10% of domestic travel. A valid driver’s license is expected to be maintained.LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.  Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.  Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Fluent in the English language, written and spoken.COMPUTER SKILLS & ANALYTICAL SKILLS• Excel Power Query (required)• Computer and Analytical skills (required) • SQL programming (ideal)• SAP knowledge (benefit) • Tableau (benefit)• Alteryx (benefit)Compensation: After thorough market analysis, LAPP takes many factors into consideration when determining base salary such as experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, etc. of the candidate. The base salary range for this role is $120,000 - $130,000 plus participation in LAPP's bonus plan. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Vision, Dental, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, 401(k), HSA/FSA, Life Insurance, and more!*LAPP is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

job_description: Buy Side - Investment Management - Front Office Separately Managed Accounts – Trading Data Platforms Location: Midtown Atlanta Full Relocation paidHybrid: 3 days in office. You choose which days each week Compensation: 125k - 150k Base + Bonus + Profit Sharing PTO: unlimited Exceptional Benefits Sr. Business Systems Analyst – Agile Deliver: Curated Data for reporting & Realtime Data for execution management and systematic trading algorithms Liaison with Front Office traders & portfolio managers Gather Requirements & Build Stories, Test Turn data requirements into development tasks Build & Automate solutions for portfolio management capabilities (construction, optimization, trade modeling, rebalancing equities portfolios, etc.) Required Skills & Experience5 years + BA or BSA supporting Financial Services or Fintech Buy Side Investment Management is ideal (Capital Markets, IB, or similar will suffice) SMA knowledge is extremely nice to have Trading System (EZE OMS EZE EMS, CRTS, State Street Alpha) Portfolio Management System (Perform, CRIMS) Agile Fluent in Data & Application Integration SQL (write queries, script, extract data from RDBMS) Data presentation (using Tableau, PowerBI) This is a cloud native environment, and your understanding of AWS is helpfulRelevant Bachelor / Master degree(s) are nice to have however not required

title: Vendor Management Analyst
job_description: Reporting to the designated Administrator, the Vendor Management Analyst is responsible for creation, execution, and maintenance of vendor and contract relationships. This role will own the Vendor Management relationship and contract process from initiation to termination. The Vendor Management Analyst will also be responsible for developing and maintaining business relationships with key vendor partners and responsible for collaborating with all areas of NJM, including IT/PMO, Law and Regulation, and Information Security to ensure that vendors are effectively managed, and contracts are fully leveraged. This position requires the Vendor Management Analyst to be responsible for managing Medical Services Administration (MSA) contracts, performing ongoing vendor due diligence, review of industry best practices and competitor offerings to include pricing alternatives.To accomplish this, the Vendor Management Analyst willProvide management and oversite of vendors’ overall performance, contractual compliance adherence to service level agreements and report back to management. Utilizing the contract management system, create and maintain an inventory of all MSA vendors, which includes contract purpose, contract price, current contract owner and vendor’s service level agreements. Work with Law and Regulation on the creation and renewal of existing contracts which includes tracking contract termination notification dates and terms for contracts and ensure that NJM is positioned to renegotiate contract terms or terminate.Manage the evaluation, selection, transition, and monitoring of contractual agreements of vendors and coordinate contracts and other legal agreements for the department.Be engaged on vendor assessments/selection for new products and service offerings. Work with MSA Leadership to negotiate service level agreements, performance/quality metrics and contractual obligations.Perform ongoing vendor management activities which includes:Resolve vendor problems related to quality, performance, and service level agreements. Escalate to management if SLAs are not met. Coordinate status meetings between NJM and Vendor Partners including review of performance tracking measures and results and status of open issues.Work with Information Security to perform an annual Risk Assessment for strategic vendor partners, this includes assessment of currency of escrowed software, review of SOC reports, Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plan and testing results, incident response and data breach response reports, and written information security program.Conduct verification of financial stability to include review of annual financial statements, cash flow statements and any open litigation. Verification of monthly invoices and submittal for payment.Provide leadership and oversight into vendor project activities to minimize interference with business operations. This includes initial review of project management work products, including charter, project plan, schedule, milestones, risk assessment, change management and escalation process.Position Requirements (Skills, Knowledge, Traits, Education & Experience)Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of vendor management life cycle.Ability to review and understand contracts and insurance requirements.5-10 years of experience with vendor management, contracting, business process improvements, project management and analytical techniques and practices.Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel).Active listening, excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong presentation skills; influencing negotiations acumen.Professional demeanor: demonstrate independent judgement, ability to communicate with all levels of management and relationship building skills to manage business relationships with vendors.Demonstrates good critical thinking, ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions; detail-oriented and proactive.Able to work independently with minimal supervision.Strong project management skills with the ability to execute on multiple projects concurrently.A bachelor’s degree in business management, Vendor Relations or related field; insurance industry experience preferred; a comprehensive understanding of Medical Services Administration is a plus.Some travel required.Salary: $95,000 - 110,000. Salary is commensurate with experience and credentials.Legal Disclaimer: NJM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to attracting, retaining and promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is fully representative of the diversity that exists in the communities in which we do business.

title: Manager, Business Development
job_description: About UsSolar Landscape is a groundbreaking renewable energy company on a mission to make solar power affordable and accessible to all.Solar Landscape partners with commercial real estate companies to develop, install and operate large rooftop solar installations. Households in the surrounding communities can subscribe to receive solar power at a guaranteed discount. This innovative model – community solar – is providing solar power to the two-thirds of Americans that cannot otherwise access it.Solar Landscape is growing fast. Doubling in size year after year, we are looking for the best and brightest to drive our next phase of growth. We’re made up of thought leaders, thinkers, dreamers, doers. We are insightful, driven, rebellious, fun, and we are better together. Our diverse and unique backgrounds are all given a voice and seat at the table to help make real change for the communities we serve.For more about Solar Landscape, visit www.solarlandscape.com.About The RoleThe Manager, Business Development is responsible for originating, managing, and closing on new opportunities for commercial solar energy projects. As a key part of the Business Development team and as an externally facing role, the Manager, Business Development will work closely with business development leadership to originate, qualify, and execute commercial solar energy project contracts with both private and public sector customers. In addition, the role will manage interactions with customers to drive growth, support project development efforts, and bring structure to high-value relationships.This role offers a base salary plus a competitive bonus structure.ResponsibilitiesTake ownership of the existing pipeline of commercial solar project opportunitiesExpand the pipeline of solar opportunities with commercial real estate owners through prospecting, direct outreach, networking, and other meansOriginate new commercial solar energy opportunities with public and private sector clients in the target territoryTrack progress of the sales pipeline from new opportunity stage through closingCollaborate with and support the senior business development team members and leadership to qualify and negotiate community solar leases within the target accountsCollaborate with leadership to qualify and prioritize target accounts and opportunitiesCollaborate with the proposal analyst team to prioritize and manage timely responses. Collaborate with the business development analyst team to evaluate project opportunities and prepare proposals for deliveryOriginate new partnership relationships with large commercial real estate owners, primarily in the industrial and self-storage segmentsAct in a consultative selling capacity to customer and partners to advise on clean energy adoptionInterface with customer leadership including C-suite and navigate accounts to drive expansion opportunitiesSupport the project development team for project execution mattersInteract regularly with Solar Landscape leadershipInteract with the policy department to understand incentives and policy frameworksQualificationsEngineering or Environmental Sciences bachelor’s degree preferred3+ years of business or project development experience in the solar energy industryProven track record of sales or partnership performance is requiredFormal solutions sales training is a plusExperience with solar energy design materials including drawing sets and energy production modelsKnowledge of sustainability related topics including Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) topics and trendsLeadership ability and comfortable driving high-visibility projectsWell-versed in Microsoft Dynamics, MS Office suite, and Google Earth. Familiarity with ArcGIS and energy modeling software is a plusStrong understanding of:Rooftop, ground-mount, and carport commercial PV construction means and methodsUnderstanding of behind-the-meter and Utility interconnectionsPower Purchase Agreements and EPC ContractsExcellent organization and communication skillsDetail-oriented, self-starterMust have reliable transportation and willing to travel to various job sites10-30% travel requiredBenefits and PerksSolar Landscape’s company culture is second to none.Our 175+ employees combine our mission, grit and drive with a rebel’s attitude that is changing the industry: Located in the heart of historic Asbury Park, our state-of-the-art office space offers flexible workstations encouraging collaboration and movement Hybrid and remote work schedules ensuring a healthy work/life balance Employees come together to eat every day! Like in a home, our gourmet kitchen is the heart of the office. Solar Landscape has a full-time in-house chef cooking daily farm-to-table meals using locally sourced organic food Also included in employees is our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, & vision insurance, flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; We provide healthy snacks, coffee, volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!
