title: Principal Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Are you ready to make an impact at DTCC?Do you want to work on innovative projects, collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team, and receive investment in your professional development? At DTCC, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial markets. We're committed to helping our employees grow and succeed. We believe that you have the skills and drive to make a real impact. We foster a thriving internal community and are committed to creating a workplace that looks like the world that we serve.Pay and Benefits: Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentive.Comprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on location.Pension / Retirement benefitsPaid Time Off and Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day unique to each team or employee).  The impact you will have in this role:The Business Systems Analysis role specializes in acting as the primary interface between Technology and specific business / product areas, identifying, documenting, and analyzing business requirements, creating detailed project and process specifications, coordinating with project teams.Your Primary Responsibilities: Validate functional specifications by analyzing business requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams.Lead workflow design and contribute to user experience design, where applicableCollaborate with project team, product management, and stakeholders on all aspects of the project.Validate estimates of resource needs and schedule of work with related stakeholdersProvide guidance to team members by elaborating the necessary details required through all phases of projects.Review input provided to developers and Test Engineers ensuring System Integration and User Acceptance Test scripts properly reflect business and functional requirements.Participate in reviews of SIT results and defect reviews; support user acceptance testing as needed.Review system documentation to ensure compliance with company-specific best practices and standards.Review recommended controls to ensure remediation of perceived risks.Validate justification and ROI related to solutions designed to automate manual processes.Mitigates risk by following established procedures and monitoring controls, spotting key errors and demonstrating strong ethical behavior.  **NOTE: The Primary Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above. **Talents needed for Success: Minimum of 8 years of related experienceBachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience.  Nice to have skills: Serves as a trusted coach or mentor within the organization.Communicates openly keeping everyone across the organization informed.Serves as a trusted coach or mentor within the organization.Strong communicator who is a self-starter and highly motivated individualCommunicates openly keeping everyone across the organization informed.  Approaches and Behaviors: Highlights the encouraged benefits of new actions and strategies to help others overcome fears of change.Develops a culture where integrity and visibility are expected.Proactively seeks feedback from others on their own performance.Ensures that regular feedback is given in a constructive and behaviorally oriented manner.Supports an environment where individuals are respected for their contributions.  The salary range is indicative for roles at the same level within DTCC across all US locations. Actual salary is determined based on the role, location, individual experience, skills, and other considerations. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: LCSW/LSW, LAC, PC/BA
job_description: Welcome To Wincroft Support ServicesWincroft Support Services is a community based mental health agency established to serve individuals and families in need of mental and behavioral support and resources. We are seeking Full and Part Time Therapist and Behavioral Assistants to provided in home and in community services youths 3-21 years of age. We are hiring for Atlantic, Cumberland, Essex, Cape May, Gloucester, Salem, Camden, and Burlington counties.We are seeking an outgoing and talented Therapists and Behavioral Assistants to join our growing company. The ideal candidate will be capable of working alone and will have extensive experience treating patients of diverse backgrounds and personalities. We provide free supervision for LSW and LAC licensure candidates.Therapists are able to work flexible schedules and benefit from continued education and free supervision. Therapists working more than 30 hours are able to benefit from free dental , vision and buy in to the 401k and medical when eligible. Therapists are required to execute therapeutic options to assist while aiding the youth and family in coping mechanisms. Therapists must adhere to the Children's System of Care (CSOC) standards and procedures.
Industries: Health and Human Services, Medical Practices, and Individual and Family Services

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionIn this role you will:Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.Continuous upskilling of user platforms to support and in some cases administer updates within the system (configuration, tables, administration).Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.Performing requirements analysis.Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.Performing user acceptance testing.Working closely with the Product Owner ensuring the team is focused on the right priorities.Creating and developing user stories and maintaining the backlog.Managing competing priorities.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Develop proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) and AGILE tools (JIRA, MIRO).Required QualificationsAbility to influence and negotiate with key decision makers.Agile mindset.Requirement documentation.Process flow diagrams.Organized & Detail Oriented.Data analysis & integration.Preferred QualificationsExperience working in an AGILE environment.Experience with AGILE tool.BA/BS in CS, Information Systems or Information management or Systems design.Life and Disability experience.Group Insurance experience a plus.Knowledge of SQL, Databases and Analytical/Reporting tools such as PowerBI/Tableau a plus.

title: Healthcare BI Analyst
job_description: Are you interested in working for a well established healthcare company with a mission worth being passionate for?Our client helps thousands of people everyday that suffer from addiction, providing the treatment and guidance to take charge of their lives. Their analytics team is now looking to add a Business Intelligence Analyst to the team. This position is focused largely on developing dashboards & visualizations in Tableau. This role will be 70% hands on, 30% interacting with stakeholdersThis is a primarily remote position. However, candidates MUST reside within 40 miles of Cherry Hill, NJ and be able and willing to commute to the office on an as needed basis. This position cannot provide sponsorship now or at any point in the future.Must Have SkillsTableauSQLExcelStrong Verbal & Written Communication SkillsDesired ExperiencePrior experience working in healthcare (EMR/EHR)Prior experience with stakeholder managementCompensation: Dependent on Experience- Bonus EligibleAdditional Benefits Including Medical, 401k, PTO, Etc..Posted By: Caroline Stranieri

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Party City Holdco Inc. (PCHI) is a global leader in the celebrations industry, with its offerings spanning more than 70 countries around the world. PCHI is also the largest vertically integrated designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer of party goods in North America.PCHI operates across multiple businesses within its Retail Division and Consumer Products Division. On the retail side, Party City (partycity.com) is the leading omnichannel retailer in the celebrations category, operating more than 750+ company-owned and franchise stores. The Consumer Products Division includes design and manufacturing entity Amscan, an industry leader in celebration décor, tableware, costumes, and accessories. PCHI is headquartered in Woodcliff Lake, N.J. with additional locations throughout the Americas and Asia.  Job Overview: As a member of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team, the Senior Financial Analyst will play a critical role in the analysis and reporting of PCHI’s liquidity and cashflow. In this capacity, the Senior Financial Analyst will provide deep financial analysis and actionable data insights to enable leadership to make decisions impacting the success of the business.  Responsibilities and Duties:· Acts as a trusted business partner by creating value and contribution through a blend of strategic and data-driven analytical support.· Builds financial models, financial scenarios and recommends solutions, driving decision making on best use of marketing spend allocation· Builds financial models and scenarios to support new market entry, new services expansion and growth projections of new digital products and platforms, driving decision making for prioritization and roadmap planning· Partners with Merchandising department on sales/margin (rebates, freight, helium, discounts) analytics· Demonstrates excellent presentation/story telling skills and the ability to prepare ELT/BOD materials· Shows confidence and ability to deliver unpopular news when fact-based analysis justifies such messaging· Uses strong technical and financial skills with ability to source data from multiple platformsAnalyzes current business and system processes for potential areas of improvement.Actively participates in problem solving initiatives to determine root cause, gap analysis, along with the development and implementation of process improvement recommendations.Supports Senior leaders with ad hoc reporting and analysis   Skills Required:Strong communication and collaboration skillsOracle experience preferred.Ability to manage multiple work streams/projects and ad hoc requests with tight timelines.Strong technical aptitude, including ability to learn company systems/tools and create process efficiencies.High degree of accuracy and attention to detailStrong organizational skills and analytical ability· Contagiously Collaborative: Works together as a team; sharing, challenging, and building together. Exudes high energy and passion. Is influential, and adaptable to the needs of others. Works cross functionally and inclusively to make decisions.· Strategic Catalyst: Sees future possibilities and understands what it takes to achieve short and long- term priorities. Articulates credible and compelling vision. Uses data and insights to capitalize on market trends. Thinks through the impact of actions and decisions putting them in context and quickly making good decisions· Maniacal Customer Focus: Focuses on internal and external customers - listening to their needs, anticipating what they may want, constantly considering how bring about stronger results.   Qualifications:· 4+ years of relevant experienceBachelor’s degree in Finance or equivalent work experienceStrong working knowledge of Financial Statements (P&L/Balance Sheet/ Cash Flows)Excellent written and verbal communication skills with attention to detailAdvanced skills in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel

title: IT Product Senior Analyst
job_description: Job Description:The IT Product Senior Analyst provides functional and technical expertise on the BDS WMS as in charge of design, development, deployment, troubleshooting, configuration, further evolution and support of Global Applications products to business users, including ITIL Service Delivery process, Deliver Continuous Improvement, Deployment project roles and Service Introduction project roles. This position will search for better and quicker delivery value back to our customers, based on Agile and DevOps ways of working and mindsets. This role will be part of the Global Applications Service Delivery team based in various hub sites.What are we looking for?Bachelor's degreeIT background3-5 years of related experienceITIL, PMI, Agile, DevOps, Scrum certifications are a plusWhat will be your key responsibilities?Manage the demand with the business and partners (WMS Support, CIPs, projects, major incidents, special requests), including address Escalation of incidents/requests/problems/demands from business.Involvement on transformational programs/projects to provide functional and technical expertise, collaborating with since the design until go live of products, including Service Introduction role when needed.Service management with 3rd Party vendors based on role model operational excellence, with overall accountability on the metrics for service (SLAs. Availability, performance, etc).Development management with 3Rd Party vendors based on role model development excellence, with overall accountability on metrics for development.Strong collaboration with business to translate business functional requirements into actual practical and working IT solution specifications and assuring high level of satisfaction from the customersManage and execute technical design, development and configuration activities for products and services on WMS TeamIdentify and develop automation opportunities across the business processes and internal processesIdentify, propose and develop improvements for product and services as part of Problem Management processDocument solutions developed according to the defined rules in place, to assure global supportabilityParticipate and collaborate on a Community of Practices related to his functional and technical areasAssist with change management activities, including releases and production slotsHands on and “can do” attitudeWork as part of a High performance team to delivery end to end all demands from the customers and businessProactive mindset to propose and seek opportunities of improvement internally and for the businessAgile and DevOps mindsetWhat can you expect from Mars?Work with over 130,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Financial Analyst Senior
job_description: Job Description: This position is an exciting opportunity to provide financial and process analysis, modeling, and business analytics for construction activities, focusing primarily on customer growth and new business. It includes gathering, interpreting, and formatting of all metrics for analysis and presentations. The incumbent will provide cost and budget metrics for executive level reviews, support construction related activities for special projects, and offer insight into department financial and operational results. The incumbent will propose new analytics and/or processes to enhance reporting, add value, and promote success. The incumbent is accountable for awareness and compliance with applicable federal, state, and local laws, regulations and ordinances, including GAAP and the ETG Tariff.Essential Functions:Compile and interpret financial information to report and/or forecast financial results. Provide insight and ideas based on this data.Create visual presentations (tables, charts, graphs, etc.) to clearly illustrate data.Maintain department databases and provide data as requested.Compile and interpret monthly financial information to evaluate performance and project financial results. Review new business capital budgets monthly and re-forecast as necessary.Complete monthly, quarterly, and annual routine deliverables to support and report new business results.Develop construction cost metrics and dashboards. Monitor cost drivers and identify areas of greatest impact.Propose new analytics and/or processes to enhance reporting, add value, and promote success.Investigate data anomalies and respond to complex inquiries.Fully understand department targets and develop plans to help ensure department success.Support special projects by coordinating strategic planning, developing budgets, and creating dashboards. Act as point person for business case support documentation.Maintain department SOW and pricing files.Required background Bachelor's degree in economics, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, or related discipline  5+ years of experience performing financial analysis, interpreting data and providing variance explanations.  Required Skills:  Strong analytical skills and ability to solve problems High degree of initiative and ability to work independently and collaboratively Ability to work across a matrix organization structure with horizontal and vertical teams Strong attention to detail Strong communication and presentation skills Advanced proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, and moderate proficiency in other MS Office tools  Preferred: Working knowledge of gas distribution pipeline construction regulations Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) Intermediate proficiency in SharePoint and PowerBI Utility construction, natural gas, or other energy industry experience Working knowledge of Maximo and Workday

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Treasury
job_description: Party City Holdco Inc. (PCHI) is a global leader in the celebrations industry, with its offerings spanning more than 70 countries around the world. PCHI is also the largest vertically integrated designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer of party goods in North America.PCHI team members demonstrate a daily commitment to the company's Brand Purpose: to inspire joy by making it easy for customers to create unforgettable memories.PCHI operates across multiple businesses within its Retail Division and Consumer Products Division. On the retail side, Party City (partycity.com) is the leading omnichannel retailer in the celebrations category, operating more than 800 company-owned and franchise stores, as well as Halloween City (halloweencity.com) seasonal pop-up stores. The Consumer Products Division includes design and manufacturing entities Amscan, an industry leader in celebration décor, tableware, costumes, and accessories.PCHI is headquartered in Woodcliff Lake, N.J. with additional locations throughout the Americas and Asia.Job Overview:As a member of the Treasury team, the Senior Treasury Analyst will play a critical role in the analysis and reporting of PCHI’s liquidity and cashflow. In this capacity, the Senior Treasury Analyst will provide deep financial analysis and actionable data insights to ensure proper allocation of cash, compliance with debt instruments, and preparation of corresponding financial forecasts to enable leadership to make decisions impacting the success of the business.Responsibilities and Duties:· Acts as a trusted business partner by creating value and contribution through a blend of strategic and data-driven analytical support.· Monitor daily cash position, disbursements, bank accounts and funds movement.· Build and maintain detailed companywide weekly cash flow forecasts, including reporting and analysis of total company cash inflows and outflows.· Update weekly cash flow model with current cash inflows and outflows reporting out variance to upper management.· Forecast cash flow positions, related borrowing needs, and available funds for investment.· Ensure that sufficient funds are available to meet ongoing operational and capital investment requirements.· Maintain a system of policies and procedures that impose an adequate level of control over treasury activities.· Support in preparing total company capital expenditure budgeting and forecasts including reporting monthly variances.· Partner closely with various departments on capital expenditure variance analysis.· Demonstrates excellent presentation/story telling skills and the ability to prepare ELT/BOD materials.· Shows confidence and ability to deliver unpopular news when fact-based analysis justifies such messaging.· Uses strong technical and financial skills with ability to source data from multiple platforms.· Analyzes current business and system processes for potential areas of improvement.· Actively participates in problem solving initiatives to determine root cause, gap analysis, along with the development and implementation of process improvement recommendations.· Supports Senior leaders with ad hoc reporting and analysis.Skills Required:· Strong communication and collaboration skills· Oracle experience preferred.· Ability to manage multiple work streams/projects and ad hoc requests with tight timelines.· Strong technical aptitude, including ability to learn company systems/tools and create process efficiencies.· High degree of accuracy and attention to detail· Strong organizational skills and analytical ability· Contagiously Collaborative: Works together as a team; sharing, challenging, and building together. Exudes high energy and passion. Is influential, and adaptable to the needs of others. Works cross functionally and inclusively to make decisions.· Strategic Catalyst: Sees future possibilities and understands what it takes to achieve short and long- term priorities. Articulates credible and compelling vision. Uses data and insights to capitalize on market trends. Thinks through the impact of actions and decisions putting them in context and quickly making good decisions.· Maniacal Customer Focus: Focuses on internal and external customers - listening to their needs, anticipating what they may want, constantly considering how to bring about stronger results.Qualifications:· 5+ years of relevant experience· Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics (MBA preferred), OR equivalent work experience· Strong working knowledge of Financial Statements (P&L/Balance Sheet/ Cash Flows)· Excellent written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail· Advanced skills in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel

job_description: Role: Tableau Developer /Data AnalystLocation: Edison, NJ (Hybrid Model – 3 days onsite)Duration: FulltimeInterview Mode: Video  Job Description: 8 years of experience in tableauGood experience in tableau dashboardsClient facing skills is mandatoryStrong communication skills Requirements· 5+ years or experience in Tableau or across BI tools, with minimum of 3 years of experienceon Tableau· Excellent communication and collaboration skills· Ability to interact and effectively engage with key business stakeholders for requirementsgathering, validation and coordination for acceptance testing and sign-offs· Proven experience as a Tableau Developer and / or Data Analyst, in a similar role· Strong proficiency in Tableau Desktop, including advanced knowledge of calculations,parameters, and data blending· Good understanding of data visualization principles and best practices· Good understanding of data warehousing concepts and technologies· Proficiency in SQL and database concepts· Understanding of data modeling and data engineering / ETL processes· Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Online for publishing and sharing dashboards.· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Good to Have:· Knowledge of other business intelligence tools and technologies, such as Power BI orQlikView· Understanding of data integration tools / concepts· Experience with cloud data platforms like Snowflake· Certification in Tableau

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented FP&A Analyst to join our Finance team and play a key role in supporting Bookings, Revenue, and Pricing activities. The FP&A Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze financial data, provide insights, and contribute to strategic decision-making processes. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. The right candidate will be energized by a fast-paced, high-growth, PE-backed environment and a great company culture.Essential Duties And Functions:Collaborate with various departments to gather and analyze financial and operational data related to bookings & revenue.Develop and maintain financial models to forecast bookings & revenue, ensuring accuracy and relevance.Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and rolling forecasts, providing insights and commentary on key drivers.Monitor financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identify variances and trends, and provide monthly commentary.Collaborate with Business Unit leaders in regular monthly meetings to convey departmental results, discuss findings, and address any discrepancies or concerns.Responsible for partnering with the Accounting team during month-end close to reconcile revenue data and validate accuracy to support the close process.Collaborate with accounting, legal, and sales to ensure contract data is accurate and up to date.Develop and maintain comprehensive revenue forecasting models, considering various factors such as business growth, new products, pricing, client attrition, and seasonality.Work with departmental & business leaders to refine and organize pricing requests.Partner with department leaders to review and escalate pricing requests when necessary.Contribute to preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for senior management, highlighting key performance indicators and drivers.Support the development of management presentations by providing data-driven insights and analyses.Collaborate with business partners to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and enhance data accuracy.Assist in the evaluation of business initiatives, identifying potential financial impacts and assessing their alignment with overall corporate goals.Participate in ad-hoc financial projects and analyses as the Finance leadership team requires.Experience, Qualifications, Knowledge, And Skills:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.Proven experience (2-3 years) in financial planning and analysis, with a focus on Bookings & Revenue preferred.Proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis, and using financial software/tools.Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial statements.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey complex financial concepts to financial and non-financial stakeholders.Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools; experience with financial planning software is required; experience with Workday Adaptive Planning is preferred.Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet tight deadlines.Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy in work output.Problem-solving mindset and willingness to take initiative to drive process improvements.As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging At Zelis, we champion diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in all aspects of our operations. We embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at Zelis, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.Equal Employment Opportunity Zelis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, even if you do not believe you 100% fit the qualifications of the position, including women, LGBTQIA people, people of color, and people with disabilities. Accessibility Support We are dedicated to ensuring our application process is accessible to all candidates. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation with any part of the application and/or interview process, please email TalentAcquisition@zelis.com

title: Analyst, Workplace Experience Sustainability
job_description: R241307DescriptionAbout this roleRole: Workplace Sustainaibility AnalystTeam OverviewThe Global Workplace Experience team is responsible for delivery of a workplace environment for employees and visitors that is customer focused, enables productivity, reflects the BlackRock culture, and operates with efficiency. The team provides for the Design, Construction and Operation of BlackRock workplace environments, and works with stakeholders, internal partners and vendors to ensure consistent service delivery and provide a well-managed workplace that meets business needs.Role ResponsibilityRequirementsThis role will include partnership with other corporate stakeholders to align with corporate strategies and regulatory requirements. This includes the following:The Workplace Sustainability analyst is responsible for supporting the definition and execution of Blackrock’s Workplace strategies for utilities & energy efficiency, carbon reduction, waste, and sustainability within the portfolio. The role will help to monitor the execution of sustainability initiatives within BlackRock corporate properties in the following areas:Track and monitor progress of tactical and strategic deliverables to achieve sustainability goals. Provide tools and project reporting to support consistent reporting structures.Communication & training on practices, policies and programs designed to achieve sustainability objectives. Coordinate the development of a network of sustainability SMEs within the organization.Support accurate and timely response to client inquiries and disclosure statements related to sustainability.Drive execution of energy consumption reporting requirements across the portfolio, including establishing reporting tools, monitoring data for accuracy and completeness, and identifying data anomalies.Ensure team alignment on corporate sustainability objectives and strategies.Review regulatory environment and align on execution to meet requirements.QualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s degree in engineering, environmental science, sustainability or related.Understand the basic concepts of conservation and sustainable development, including energy conservation, waste management, resource and water conservation, and environmental reporting metrics.Possess strong oral and written communication skills.Proficient with MS Office, especially Excel.Ability to comprehend and learn new computer programs or tools.PreferredCertified Energy Manager (CEM), Certified Sustainability Professional (CSP), or similar certifications strongly preferred.Demonstrated record of successful implementation of sustainability programs.Advanced skills in managing large datasets.Personal QualitiesInterpersonal skills to aid in the building of relationships with key stakeholders.A self-motivator with a strong work ethic and the ability to work independently.Ability to work with interdepartmental teams.Analytically inclined.#EarlyCareersOur BenefitsTo help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.Our hybrid work modelBlackRock’s hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person – aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.About BlackRockAt BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.For additional information on BlackRock, please visit @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrockBlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

title: Sr Analyst, FP&A
job_description: ADP is hiring a Senior Financial Analyst – FP&A.Are you a financial analyst with expertise in Excel and creating financial models from scratch?Are you highly skilled in partnering with business units to provide critical analysis and support?Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? Well, this may be the role for you.As a Senior Financial Analyst – FP&A, you will lead the forecasting, planning and analytical support for one of ADP’s business units. You will analyze drivers of expense within your business unit and use historical performance, operational business decisions/assumptions, and macroeconomic conditions to project future outcomes.You will build, review, and enhance expense models. Collaborating with Finance business unit partners to build and share knowledge will be critical. You will also oversee storytelling, including connecting results and key metrics to provide a detailed, but concise explanation around performance and forward-looking projections.The day to day of this role will depend on which part of the financial life cycle we are in. While the day to day may shift, common to all these activities is one thing: becoming the subject matter expert for your business unit.What You’ll DoHere’s what you can expect on a typical day: Operating Planning and Forecasting. You will support leaders in creating an annual operating plan that is aligned to the strategic plan and perform forecasting that provides visibility into business results to enable business decisions.Management Reporting and Financial Close Activities. You will produce and distribute recurring and ad hoc management reports ensuring financial reporting accuracy. You will assist in presentation preparation on results, forecasts, and plans to senior management.Business Analysis. You will employ a deep understanding of objectives, issues and root causes and provide insightful, fact-based data analysis to help solve complex problems. Additionally, you will assist in managing KPI's such as backlog reporting, staffing requirements, starts, weeks to start, no starts, labor productivity, analysis of implementation, survey scores and client satisfaction.Strategic Planning and Initiatives. You will assist leaders in developing strategies and initiatives to drive growth and margin improvements and execute on strategic initiatives such as M-A support, product launches, market entry, and process improvement efforts. Additionally, you will provide analytical support, conduct research as required, and help to develop and coach new and junior associates.Business Partnering. You will partner with key stakeholders to align on business priorities and drive effective solutions/execution. You will make compelling arguments based on facts and data and obtain necessary buy-in to deliver on business objectives.Financial Operational Policy. You will establish and maintain consistent financial operational policies and procedures to govern related practices and comply with all departmental financial operations, policies, and practices.Experience. You have 5+ years of experience in relevant skills gained and developed in a Financial Analyst, Senior Financial Analyst, or similar role.To Succeed In This RoleExperience in corporate FP&A, including proven proficiency in performing complex financial analyses and building financial models from scratch. Advanced Excel experience, including VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, and Index Matching. external audits and exams with a focus on the EET SPI inventory and the metrics that monitor process performance         Alignment of Op Losses SIAIs to the EET processes         Oversight of process and control owner attestations         Policy/Standard annual reviews         Identify new processes controls needed to support adherence to Polices, Standards Procedures           Requirements: controls oversight and process management         Strategic thinker, self-starter, organized, versatile, and capable of performing work with minimal management oversight         Advanced Microsoft title: Project Financial Analyst
job_description: Genesis Research Group is an international healthcare consultancy providing value evidence strategy, generation, synthesis, and communication services to Life Sciences companies. Delivering these services empowered by technological innovations has enabled us to become a trusted partner with our clients across the development and commercialization life cycle. Combining both traditional and novel analytical approaches with diverse real-world data, including genomic, medical record, claims and patient-reported information, has allowed us to inform Life Science internal decision making as well as submissions and presentations to regulators; health technology assessment authorities and payers; the medical community; and patient organizations.The Project Financial Analyst (PFA) plays a critical role in enabling Genesis Research Group to plan and scale its growth initiatives. You will work closely with stakeholders to provide financial, project management, and other key insights into important decisions based on each team’s and project’s financial analysis and performance.The ideal candidate will be comfortable communicating complex analyses effectively to various individuals across the business and welcome rolling-up their sleeves to get the job done.The candidate must be proficient in Excel, have strong analytical skills, and be comfortable operating in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.The PFA Analyst will report to the Head of Client EngagementAccountabilities within this role:Oversee and manage internal project financial planning, budgeting, resource utilization & forecastingCreate project tracking reports, variance analysis reports and financial modelsLead real-time project performance monitoringEscalate issues and/or exceptions to project leadsTrack key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectivesOversee Certinia and SalesForce administration, data input and analysisQualifications:5+ years of experience in financial planning and analysis in a consulting companyBachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related equivalent professional experienceSalesForce and Certinia proficiency   Preferred Qualifications & Characteristics:Financial acumen, excellent quantitative skillsStrong interpersonal skills, collaborative, forward thinker, pro-active, effective communicator, works independently, agile learnerExperience in the Life Sciences industry, preferably in a role supporting research teamsGlobal experience a plus Compensation & Benefits:Competitive salaryPerformance-related bonusHybrid/Remote work environmentCompany-matched 401(k) plan from day oneMedical/Dental/Vision benefits from day oneFlexible PTO plan and 15 company holidays including the last week of the yearGenesis Research is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
job_description: Role: Senior Quantitative AnalystLocation: Jersey City, NJJob DescriptionOur Risk Management teams work to protect the safety and soundness of our systems and are responsible for identifying, managing, measuring, and mitigating a spectrum of key risk types including credit, market, liquidity, systemic, operational and technology in all existing and new products, activities, processes, and systems.The Senior Quantitative Analyst is primarily responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining quantitative models or tools and performing analyses for risk management and regulatory requests.ResponsibilitiesMaintain and enhance in-house fixed income risk modelsDesign metrics to monitor model performance and communicate performance results to risk users and managementDesign and produce reports and presentations to support communications with both internal model users and external supervisorsTest the adequacy of the modeling solutionsQualifications3+ years of quantitative modeling experience in fixed income and/or market risk.Knowledge of TIPS and/or mortgage security modeling a big plusFluent in at least one high level programming language (Python, C++, Java, etc.).Familiarity with SQL is a plus.Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent communication skills, both oral and writtenMaster's degree or above in a quantitative field of study

title: Senior Market Risk Analyst
job_description: Description and RequirementsThe Role: As part of the Market Risk Strategy team within the Global Risk Management organization, the Senior Market Risk Analyst will be responsible for development and advancement of replicating portfolios (RP) supporting MetLife’s asset liability management (ALM) and Investment performance attribution processes. Replicating portfolios are used globally by ALM, Actuarial, and Investment management to understand the active risk position in the liability portfolios and to ensure compliance with guidelines and limits. The Senior Market Risk Analyst will work with ALM departments globally and BlackRock to ensure RPs are calibrated and performing as expected. Additionally, the Senior Market Risk Analyst will join a team working on a next generation methodology for RP development using AI methods.Additionally, this role will support the VP of Market Risk Strategy in analyzing different potential strategies for Playbook development or ad-hoc as needed.Key Responsibilities:Manage optimizer to update replicating portfolios (RP) on a quarterly basis and evaluate RP performance Work as part of agile team expanding development and use of replicating portfolios Assist in risk analysis for various strategic initiativesAssist Market Risk team in working group operations and documentationProvide ad hoc analysis and modeling support as neededKey Relationships:to: VP Market Risk Strategyreports: 0Key Stakeholder Departments: Global Risk Management, Asset Liability Management, Investments, and FinanceCandidate Qualifications:Required:3-5 years related experienceBachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, actuarial science, finance, or similar field of studyActuarial designation (ASA or FSA)Excellent Excel modelling skillsExperience with coding (e.g. R, Python, or C++)Strong understanding of statistics, optimization, and AI methodsExcellent analytical, mathematical, and organizational abilitiesPreferred:Intermediate understanding of insurance ALM practicesIntermediate understanding of derivative products, insurance products, and investment assetsEducational background in optimization and/or predictive modelingThe wage range for applicants for this position is $103,100 to $137,400. This role is also eligible for annual short-term incentive compensation. MetLife offers a comprehensive benefits program, including healthcare benefits, life insurance, retirement benefits, parental leave, legal plan services, and paid time off. All incentives and benefits are subject to the applicable plan terms.Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at accommodations@metlife.com. This information will be held in confidence and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the application process. MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.

title: Senior Chargeback Analyst - Accounts Receivable
job_description: Job DescriptionThis is a Senior Chargeback Position in charge of client chargeback portfolios, you would be working with the credit, cash, collection and chargeback team both in the US and in India. The ideal analyst will work with the respective India team members and manage their client accounts.A critical part of this role involves Chargeback and Dispute Resolution; manage the dispute life-cycle end to end; not limited to researching, disputing on customer portals and/or requesting waivers, exemptions or negotiate down fines. Work with internal/external departments to collaboratively implement new processes or procedures. Ensure that proactive measures are taken to avoid chargebacks and work with clients to educate them on compliance initiatives as well as how to execute necessary changes. The analyst must understand and be able to communicate the issues to internal and external parties in a clear and concise manner.Major Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Researching and disputing open claims and chargebacks/deductions Ability to review vendor guides and communicate possible non-compliance issues with internal/external teams; and make recommendations to clients to improve processes to reduce chargebacks.  Communicate with internal departments (sales, customer service, 3PL) to expedite resolution of chargebacks as well as communicating with internal departments on valid issues needing corrective action.  Negotiating chargeback settlements with customers in accordance with client policy Work to develop, train and enhance chargeback team’s chargeback knowledge Prepare chargeback reports for clients and regularly attend client visits.  Reviewing valid deductions with client to obtain approval for write off Escalate any issue to management in a timely fashion.  Knowledge of EDI transactions and ability to work with EDI teams to mitigate issues and proactively reduce errors Performs other duties as required or assignedJob Requirements: 5-7 years of relevant experience in accounts receivable Retail Chargeback Experience a Must Effective oral and written communication skills.  Strong math and solid analytical skills are essential. title: Senior Analyst, CLO Investment Services
job_description: 2092668Job DescriptionThe Role:The Senior Analyst, CLO Investment Services will work to enhance the operational and oversight model for the Ballyrock CLOs and Fidelity’s overall leveraged loan capabilities. Specifically, the Senior Analyst will be assigned to a minimum of three live CLOs and will have responsibility for the daily monitoring of CLO compliance test results, regular review/updates of security reference data, monthly Trustee Report review/approval and quarterly waterfall distribution review/approval. In addition, the Senior Analyst will be required to have in-depth understanding of the indenture language for their assigned CLOs, support reset(s), refinancing(s) and liquidation(s) of their assigned CLOs and provide other ongoing operational and administrative support. Further, the Senior Analyst will be deeply involved with testing, implementing and utilizing new technologies that will provide greater portfolio management capabilities for leverage loan portfolios.The position requires close interaction with portfolio managers, traders, legal, compliance, investment services, third party trustees, underwriters and Fidelity’s Investment Operations teams.The Expertise And Skills You BringBA / BS degree required, advanced degree a plus. Major or concentration in legal, finance, business administration, or accounting preferred but not required.Minimum of 4 to 6 years of financial services experience, with preference towards prior experience with leveraged loan/CLO operations.Solid understanding of the US leveraged loan market and structured finance transactions.Prior experience with leveraged loan/CLO operations and trustee reporting.Working knowledge of Wall Street Office, familiarity with Rating Agencies (Moody’s, S&P, Fitch).Experience with credit agreements, term sheets, indentures and other security offering documents.Ability to monitor daily CLO compliance results to ensure adherence to indenture guidelines.Ability to unwind/review CLO compliance results to ensure accuracy.Interact with Trustee to communicate hypothetical trades and assess impact to compliance results.Work with external vendors to build, implement and test compliance modules for each new CLO.Oversight of Trustee reporting for the Ballyrock CLOs.Strong Microsoft Excel skills and excellent interpersonal skills.Ability to work independently while integrating seamlessly with other members of the Investment & Investment Services teams.Reliable, self-starter, highly detail oriented, well-organized and able to manage several priorities and deadlines. The TeamFidelity’s High Income & Alternatives Division is responsible for managing the firm’s diversified high yield, leveraged loan, and emerging market debt strategies, including Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLOs). In addition, the group manages strategies focused on the equities of leveraged companies. Assets under management exceeded $100 billion as of year-end 2022. The division is made up of a diverse team of Investment Professionals, Traders, and Operational and Administrative Support staff.The base salary range for this position is $81,000-$137,000 per year.Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. Note, the application window closes when the position is filled or unposted.CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Hybrid
job_description: Financial Analyst - Vineland NJCompany Overview:Our client is a leading manufacturing and distributor of specialty metals based in South Jersey. As they continue to expand, they are seeking a talented Senior Financial Analyst to join their dynamic team!Position Overview:As a Financial Analyst you will play a pivotal role in supporting the CFO in budgeting, financial planning, analysis, and strategic decision-making processes within our organization. Your responsibilities will involve conducting thorough financial analysis, creating forecasts, and providing actionable insights to drive profitability and growth of the projects and corporate finance.Key Responsibilities:Conduct comprehensive financial analysis including but not limited to variance analysis, trend analysis, and scenario modeling to evaluate project performance, costs, and revenue projections.Lead the development of annual budgets, forecasts, and long-term financial plans in collaboration with project managers and department heads.Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track project profitability, cost efficiency, and overall financial health.Prepare and present accurate and insightful financial reports, summaries, and presentations for senior management, highlighting trends, risks, and opportunities.Provide strategic insights and recommendations based on financial analysis to support decision-making on resource allocation, project feasibility, and growth initiatives.Identify and implement process improvements to streamline financial processes, enhance efficiency, and ensure compliance with industry regulations.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, procurement, and project management to align financial goals with operational strategies.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field Minimum of 2+ years of experience in financial analysis within manufacturing or distribution related field highly desiredProficiency in financial modeling, forecasting techniques, and advanced Excel skills.Strong analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.Excellent communication skills with the ability to present findings to non-financial stakeholders.Detail-oriented, organized, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously.For immediate considerations please send your resume to: cecilia.bjurstrom@tatum-us.com

title: National Accounts Senior Analyst
job_description: Attention LinkedIn Community,We're thrilled to announce that we're reposting a key position within our team and have made significant enhancements to expand opportunities for candidates like you!Pierre Fabre, the world's second-largest dermo-cosmetics lab and the second-largest private French pharmaceutical group, offers you a dynamic, purpose-driven career. We're dedicated to enhancing well-being by pioneering solutions that bridge health and beauty.Join Pierre Fabre USA to make a real impact in people's lives by remedying skin and scalp issues. Beyond being employees, we act as entrepreneurs, and our work is a pursuit of purpose and performance. Join us in our mission to protect and preserve the health and sustainability of all people and our planet. Innovate, collaborate with healthcare professionals, and make a difference with "New Ways to Care." Your purposeful career begins here.Summary:We are seeking a skilled National Accounts Senior Analyst to perform day-to-day accounting, optimize sales operations, financial reporting, and analysis for our national accounts. This role involves managing collections, preparing, and presenting accurate, timely, and strategically focused financial reports, and providing strategic insights to enhance operational efficiency and drive business growth.Essential Functions:• Conduct day-to-day general ledger accounting, financial reporting, and analysis for assigned functional areas.• Responsible for month-end, quarter-end and year-end close for assigned functional areas.• Prepare and present accurate and timely financial reports, variance analysis, and explanations.• Perform balance sheet account reconciliations, accrual calculations, and other related accounting documents/schedules.• Prepare journal entries and reconcile intercompany balances for national accounts.• Manage national accounts collections, including resolving chargebacks, non-payments, credits, and other payment-related issues.• Provide support for external audits and assist in the preparation of annual financial statements.• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize operations and enhance the customer experience for national accounts.• Coordinate with internal teams to ensure all product and sample needs are met for national accounts.• Act as the key point of contact for sales teams regarding technical challenges and data-related inquiries for national accounts.• Collaborate with the marketing and operations teams to ensure relevant marketing support materials are available for national accounts.• Analyze data from internal and external sources, converting it into useful information to enhance operations.• Make recommendations and drive strategic decision-making across national accounts.• Develop and oversee precise sales forecasts at the SKU level for national accounts, identifying potential risks and opportunities, and aligning with cross-functional teams to coordinate inventory management.• Establish effective reporting systems to track KPIs across national accounts, delivering regular reports to brand teams, operations teams, and senior management.• Manage progress on assigned KPIs for national accounts.• Conduct thorough market research, competitive analysis, and continuously monitor trends across national accounts to stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies.• Enhance operational efficiency by refining processes, pinpointing bottlenecks, and suggesting solutions to improve productivity.• Capture and update results for all Field Sales Incentive contests and oversee validation of Field Sales Incentive Compensation (IC) payout calculations.• Conduct ad-hoc reporting for Brand Teams related to HCP, Salons, and Retail strategic initiatives.• Other duties as requested by the Business.Competencies:• Understanding of accounting processes, procedure, and internal controls.• Extensive skills in Microsoft Excel.• Effective communication skills (Written & Verbal)• Ability to succeed in a team environment.• Strong research and analysis skills.• Ability to adapt quickly and learn new tasks independently.• Ability to manage competing priorities.• Demonstrated understanding of financial principles, including accounting processes, procedures, internal controls, and budgeting.• Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively to manage competing priorities and meet deadlines.Required Education and Experience:• Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or related field.• 5+ years of experience in operations, financial analysis, and sales with a strong emphasis on analytics and forecasting.• Proven expertise in analytics tools and methodologies across various channels.• Knowledge of inventory management, sales forecasting, and operations across multiple channels.• Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.Work Environment / physical demands / position type and expected hours of work:• The normal working hours of the office are from 8:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.• This job operates in a clerical, office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.• Some filing is required, which would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary. • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Travel: < 10%Benefits of being a Pierre Fabre Employee:Join Pierre Fabre for competitive benefits including three medical plans, dental and vision coverage, voluntary benefits, a 401(k) plan, and more! Our offerings also include a hybrid work policy, a generous PTO policy and company holidays, paid parental leave, discounts on our products, learning and development opportunities, and access to health and wellness programs, creating a well-rounded work experience for our employees.Pierre Fabre Pierre Fabre has been recognized by Forbes as one of the "World's Best Employers" for the 3rd year running.https://www.pierre-fabre.com/en-usTrue to My NaturePierre Fabre is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant because of race, creed, color, age, national origin, ancestry, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender expression and identity, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military status, application for military service or any other class protected by state or federal law.

title: Senior Analyst, PGIM Portfolio Advisory (Hybrid/Newark, NJ)
job_description: Job Classification:Corporate - Human ResourcesA GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTUREAs the Global Asset Management business of Prudential, we’re always looking for ways to improve financial services. We’re passionate about making a meaningful impact - touching the lives of millions and solving financial challenges in an ever-changing world.We also believe talent is key to achieving our vision and are intentional about building a culture on respect and collaboration. When you join PGIM, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading global asset managers!If you’re not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that’s investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today.At PGIM, You Can!What You Will DoThe PPA team is looking for a sharp and analytical individual to join the team as a Portfolio Management Sr. Analyst. You will be reporting to the Assistant Portfolio Manager and will be part of small team with broad responsibilities for the investment management of PPA client portfolios.This position is based in Newark, NJ and will follow a hybrid schedule (3 days in office). Our organization follows a hybrid work structure where employees can work remotely and/ from the office, as needed, based on demands of specific tasks or personal work preferences. Working from the office is encouraged when working on tasks that require a high degree of collaboration.What You Can ExpectSupport daily risk measurement of portfolio and benchmark risk positionsPerform portfolio analytics including stress testing, return attribution, and rebalancing scenarios to optimize portfolio asset allocation and hedge positionsCreate market reports to track relative value across asset classesGenerate client reports to highlight returns and risk exposureTrack client cashflow forecasts to determine portfolio liquidation needs or cash available for investmentTrack compliance limits and monitor portfolios relative to established constraints; provide periodic client and internal reportingConstruct asset class, sector, interest rate / ALM and liquidity limitsEnter trade tickets for review by PMs to rebalance portfoliosParticipate in new deal pricing analysis to assess hedge needs and risk/ruturn tradeoffsResearch and develop risk views across asset classes and sectorsAnalyze historical experience of credit sectors and developing long term default and recovery assumptionsWork with PPA PM team and PGIM businesses in assessing new investment opportunitiesSupport PM team in review and selection of external asset managers; performing ongoing due diligenceWhat You Will BringBachelor’s Degree or Equivalent in financial engineering, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative fields1-4 years of direct experience in investment risk management and Asset Liability Management (ALM)Understanding of fixed income and alternative asset classes and risksExperience with derivatives and how to hedge complex portfolio and ALM riskUnderstanding of risk-return characteristics of asset classes including bonds, structured credit, equities, alternatives, and derivatives as well as liabilities including life insurance and annuitiesKnowledge of portfolio risk systems (e.g., Aladdin) and modelsExpertise in assessing risk exposures for portfolios supporting various insurance liabilitiesQuantitative background in financial modelling, data analytics, statistical methods, and programmingFluent in statistical techniques and data analyticsCreative problem solver with focus on innovationMust be able to effectively partner with teams across PPA and PGIM asset managersSuccessful communicator with ability to develop reports and present them to clients and senior managementOpen-minded, innovative, strategic problem solverWe know not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role. What We Offer YouMedical, dental, vision, life insurance and PTO (Paid Time Off) Retirement plans: 401(k) plan with generous company match (up to 4%) Company-funded pension plan Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs. Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional health, and career development. Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment, approved degrees, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations. To find out more about our Total Reward package, visit Total Rewards BrochureNote: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $105,000 to $135,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.About PGIM Portfolio Advisory GroupPGIM Portfolio Advisory (PPA) is a newly established investment business within PGIM responsible for providing institutional clients asset-liability management, portfolio strategy, and asset allocation solutions utilizing PGIM’s multi-asset class expertise with a focus on public and private credit. On behalf of its clients, PPA will oversee portfolio construction, execution, and management and will partner with PGIM affiliates including PGIM Fixed Income, PGIM Private Capital, and PGIM Real Estate to deliver best in class private origination, credit underwriting, investment research, and risk management capabilities across a full range of asset classes.Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. title: Senior System Analyst
job_description: 2091591-1Job DescriptionThe TeamThe Regulatory Reporting Technology team is part of the broader Fidelity Brokerage Technology group. title: Senior Analyst, Treasury
job_description: Design Your Future at PVHSenior Analyst, TreasuryPosition SummaryThe Senior Treasury Analyst, Corporate Treasury will provide day-to-day support to the Senior Treasury Manager, Corporate Treasury. The individual who fills the role will primarily be responsible for the preparation of various reports and analytical tasks including Cash Flow forecasting, global daily cash reporting, foreign exchange execution, debt reporting, bank fee analysis, bank administration, and other treasury analytics. The Senior Treasury Analyst will assist in Treasury Management System maintenance, ad hoc reporting, and special projects that may be required.Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities Of The JobAssist the global team in daily and monthly reporting tasks for working capital management.Analyze and consolidate cash flow forecasts for all regions to optimize working capital. Manage foreign exchange hedging programs, engage with banks on transactions, maintain compliance records, and make recommendations to existing hedging programs.Prepare quarterly reports to aggregate IBR for leases.Work with Tax and regional Treasury to prepare and consolidate data necessary for FBAR reporting.Track and maintain financial transactions in our Treasury Management System, Kyriba.Coordinate treasury payment settlements with the NA Cash Management Team when necessary. Track treasury metrics and performance as well as prepare/compile reports for quarterly reporting. Assist Senior Treasury Manager with accounting-related requests for month and quarter end close.Assist the Senior Treasury Manager with all Treasury Management System (Kyriba) implementations, maintenance, and updates. Prepare Letter of credit accruals for accounting journal entries.Pull various Bloomberg FX data points to assist in MTM Rate comparison to ensure a level of reasonability is within the limits of auditing standards.Various special projects and ad hoc requests as needed to support company operations.Support bank administrative tasks in a backup capacity.Participate and/or lead Treasury projects and initiatives; some geared towards creating efficiencies in existing processes.Assist with Supply Chain Finance program analytics.This role has the opportunity to grow with demonstrated achievement and leadership.Qualifications & ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field required.CTP (Certified Treasury Professional) and/or Advanced Degree a plus.3-5 years of Finance/Treasury experience.Proficient knowledge of MS Office software (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).Experience with Kyriba, SAP S4, 360T and Bloomberg preferred.Strong technical knowledge of foreign exchange risk management.Excellent analytical and project management skills.Ability to work productively in a changing environment.Ability to interact effectively with various levels of management.Ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Great attention to detail.PVH Corp. or its subsidiary ("PVH") is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment on the basis of their individual capabilities and qualifications, consistent with applicable law and without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.
